story: Throughout the years, Earthbound has shared its home with a diverse mix of people who are passionate about music and want to continue providing a venue for creative expression, fostering independent artist growth and exposure, and striving to bring unity between all that the local SD music community has to offer. It’s time for a revival, to move forward from financial challenges, and create momentum towards a positive movement involving everyone who still cares about supporting local music, art, and business. To be quite honest, we need help in raising money to save Earthbound from closing down. Please help spread the word. Every penny will count.
story_txt: Throughout the years, Earthbound has shared its home with a diverse mix of people who are passionate about music and want to continue providing a venue for creative expression, fostering independent artist growth and exposure, and striving to bring unity between all that the local SD music community has to offer. To be quite honest, we need help in raising money to save Earthbound from closing down.  Please help spread the word.  Every penny will count.

story:
Bonjour,

Je me présente Astrid SIMONEAU-PLANES, j'ai 42 ans, je suis mariée et maman de 2 adolescents. J'étais hôtelière restauratrice pendant une dizaine d'année et j'ai aussi eu aussi des commerces.

J'ai mis une photo de moi, afin que vous puissiez voir à qui vous avez à faire et aussi parce que le logo du site internet et de l'association n'est pas encore terminé.

Aujourd'hui je donne mon temps à des associations, dont l'APF (Association des Paralysés de France) et les Restos du coeur. Là, j'ai découvert la double peine que subissaient les personnes ou les familles d'enfant,  handicapés, ou atteints d'un maladie grave, rare et/ou orpheline. En plus des difficultés de santé, ils doivent affronter des difficultés financières.

J'ai donc créé l'Association Pour l'Action Participative, loi 1901, à but non lucratif, qui va gérer un site internet :                            "www.je-suis-philanthrope.fr" afin d'aider des personnes ou des familles touchées par un handicap, une maladie grave, rare et/ou orpheline ou la dépendance d'une personne âgée. Association Loi 1901, à but non lucratif, déclarée à la préfecture de Toulon, RNA W832010683. 

Notre devise:                                                                                     On ne peut pas aider tout le monde. Mais tout le monde peut aider quelqu'un.

Les personnes ou les familles pourront y émettre un appel aux dons, en leur nom, afin de les aider à financer un besoin, dû à leur handicap ou leur maladie.

Par exemple, ils pourront faire un appel pour financer:

     - Le reste à charge de l'achat d'un fauteuil roulant électrique (coût environ 20 000 €)

     - Une thérapie ABA, pour les enfants autistes, non remboursée par la sécurité sociale.

     - Une chirurgie à l'étranger, non pratiquée en France, et donc non remboursée.

     - L'aménagement d'une voiture familiale, pour accueillir un fauteuil roulant électrique ( environ 10 000 €, hors prix de la voiture)

     - Une prothèse auditive 

     - ETC.......

 

 

Sur le site, on trouvera aussi:

- Une page Petites annonces, dédiés au handicap et aux malades.

- Une page: Actu des Associations: où elles pourront annoncer l'organisation d'événement, comme un loto pour Eva, Les 10kms de La Londe pour Léo......

- Une page : Forum: où tout le monde pourra se retrouver pour dialoguer, se renseigner, échanger des bons plans........

Aujourd'hui, Je cherche donc, pour démarrer le site internet, la somme de 5500 €.

Vous pouvez verser : 5 €, 10 €..........

Mais je cherche aussi des adhérents (cotisation annuelle de 40 €) qui parlent de nous, nous intègrent à leurs réseaux, nous aident à se faire connaître, et surtout à faire connaître notre site internet. Vos employés, vos clients, vos fournisseurs, vos amis, vos collègues, votre boulanger, votre médecin, votre famille..... sont nos futurs PHILANTHROPES.

Si vous versez plus de 40 €, vous devenez automatiquement adhérent de l'association, pour une année.

Vous pouvez aussi m'aider sans verser d'argent mais en prenant contact avec moi, afin de m'apporter vos compétences, vos idées et peut-être donner un peu de votre temps à l'association en diffusant des affiches qui parlent de nous, dans votre commune....

Aidez-moi à les aider.

Merci!!!!

Astrid SIMONEAU-PLANES

story:
I am fundraising for a volunteer trip down to earthquake ravaged Haiti with Burners without Borders and Shelters International based in Jacmel, Haiti. I have been informed that Shelters International is in the process of receiving a grant from the Salvation Army to build shelters in Jacmel, Haiti. Burners without Borders are also raising funds for these shelters to be built in Jacmel, (see attached website for more information). I have been asked to help with the management and construction of “Grandma’s House” and an orphanage in Jacmel, so that the residents do not have to endure a potentially long rainy season without shelter. My target date of arrival is mid-July to early August and I will work with Shelters International for two weeks to a month, depending on fundraising. I have several years of project management/construction engineering experience with affordable housing, residential and commercial construction. Burners Without Borders have asked each builder to fundraise for our plane tickets, transportation costs about the island, and food. I will also be investigating sustainable construction efforts with other NGOs such as Kleiwerks International.

Here is the information about the June 29th Haiti fundraiser from 7pm until midnight if you would like to paste into emails to spread the word to friends:

San Francisco Local Artists & Musicians
Benefit For Burners Without Borders and Shelters International in Haiti
June 29th, 2010• The Red Devil Lounge
7pm – Midnight

Performances By:
Ronkat Spearman (P FUNK, KATDELIC), Broun Fellinis, James Whiton (EMT), DJ Shooey (Space cowboys), Renee Wilson—Actress/singer from the movie “Ray” See www.reneewilson.org, Black Quarterback, Dave Mihaly,Paper Radio, Members of Glide, John Karr, VJ and More!
$10 minimum donation, $20 suggested donation or we shall graciously accept more.

Raffle!!!!!
Win prizes from fresh organic produce/food, wine, art by Anastasia Schipani, and even a private ride in a plane from a flight instructor.

Please email me if you have any questions or concerns at crisx100@hotmail.com.

Here is the link to the zvents link regarding the June 29th fundraising event at the Red Devil Lounge:
http://www.zvents.com/san-francisco-ca/events/s...

Presale tickets link: http://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetai...

Many Thanks,

Christie

story:
Short Summary

 

HELLO HELLO HELLO!

 

We are THE UN-MEANT team, probably the most genuinely creative chaps amongst the 150 teams that will take part in the Mongol Rally in July 2012. Two goals: drive across a third of the world and raise money for 2 different charities that share with us the same human and ethical values:

 Lotus Child a non-profit, non-government organisation working with vulnerable children and families to provide the basic human rights of shelter, food and education. Here it follows a link where you can check yourself al the different activities they are involved with:
http://lotuschild.org/  

 REF, Renewable Energy Foundation is a UK registered charity promoting sustainable development for the benefit of the public by means of energy conservation and the use of renewable energy. Link to the website:
http://www.ref.org.uk/ 

 The happy ending of this adventure would see us donating our vehicle to Mongolia’s capital local people thanks the adventurist organization that will take care of the car once reached our destination. Before this can happen, THE UN-MEANT will have to travel for 10,000 miles interacting with local communities in order to increase the understanding of their needs and promote global awareness of their realities through our future creations that will be featured in different platforms on the web.

 

During the 6 weeks journey, we will have to face 3 deserts, 5 mountain peaks across 15 different countries only driven by the noble interest of raising money for international and local charities. Comfort and commodity will be a luxury itself for us throughout the trip.

 

WHO ARE WE BTW?

THE UN-MEANT team is made of:

Mattia an eager photographer and designer from Italy with a 5cm long beard (to be improved), now based in London since 4 years. He is currently studying at London College of Communication and occasionally freelancing. He has recently been selected for several international exhibitions, such as the Barcelona OFFF festival and the International Graphic Art Biennial. During the trip he is planning to create a reportage on different condition affecting poor comunities focusing particularly on lack of clean water.

 Sofie is a young one off Swedish student of fashion design in Florence, modelling in her free time for big firms such as Luisa Via Roma and young photographer like me. She continuously finds pleasure in forcing aventure and unexpectedness in her daily life.

 This trip will also be a chance to combine our passion, skills and true creativity with the main focus on photography and video.

 Find below a link to the previous work that saw us both involved:

http://www.behance.net/gallery/QUANTUM/3093943

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will contribute to our project by helping us to cover the following initiatives:

 

1000£= 1587$ donation to above charities

716£=1136 Mongolian Rally Fee that covers all the logistic and organization behind this event

2000£/ 2500£= 3000$/3500$ to buy the car

800£/= 1270$ Visas

 

Every little helps! We welcome donations from 10£. Lots of 10£ can get us very far.

We will value your support at best of our possibilities.

 

In case of extra money collected the over budget will be used to buy water-filter to donate to people and villages that we will encounter in the inner to Mongolia which suffers from continuos shortage of clean and fresh water.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If anyone in the Eurozone have a car laying in some garage and wants to donate it would solve quite a bit of head-aches for us.

 

Also, the ever present "LIKE US" on facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/UnMeantMongolRally

 

links to perk's

http://www.behance.net/gallery/Mongol-Prints/34...

story: This fund is in memory of Brooke Steyaert, she had an impact on everyone in her life and will be long remembered for her music, for her artwork, and for her heart. She is loved and treasured. Brooke gave so much to all of us, this is just a simple way we can give a little back.
story_txt: This fund is in memory of Brooke Steyaert, she had an impact on everyone in her life and will be long remembered for her music, for her artwork, and for her heart. She is loved and treasured. Brooke gave so much to all of us, this is just a simple way we can give a little back.

story:
TEXTE EN FRANCAIS CI-DESSOUS

Who are you people?

We are FrancoJeunes, a small but aspiring group of dedicated young French-speaking Louisiana professionals who believe in both the future of the French language in Louisiana and the cultural impact of our French-speaking cultures. FrancoJeunes seeks to further engage French speakers, especially young professionals, in Louisiana’s francophone community. FrancoJeunes supports and promotes francophone endeavors and French-friendly businesses, encourages bilingual signage and services in both public and private sectors, supports an increase in the visibility of French in all sectors of the community, all to make French an integral part of Louisiana’s cultural economy.

The Council for the Development of French in Louisiana (CODOFIL) is the state agency charged with French language educational and cultural economic development initiatives in Louisiana. The agency has multiple legislative mandates that include francophone tourism, economic development, culture, education and international relations. On Friday June 15, 2012 a line-item veto was performed by Governor Bobby Jindal that slashed $100,000 from CODOFIL’s budget (approximately 40% of its total budget) for the upcoming year. This budget cut leaves CODOFIL just enough money to pay operating costs with no room for a budget to accomplish its goals, which are

  • to oversee the development and expansion of the state's economic development and tourism activities designed to promote our French culture, heritage, and language
  • to promote, develop, and oversee cultural and educational relations and exchanges within the state and between the state of Louisiana and other countries, provinces, and states that share Louisiana's historical French heritage, culture and language
  • to develop and expand French immersion educational environments
  • to develop a certification system whereby vendors, festivals, and restaurants may be designated as 'Francophone Friendly' and design and issue a marquee that may be displayed at each entry
  • to provide state government services to French speaking citizens and visitors in the French language
  • to assist Louisiana citizens who speak French in dealing with and reviving services from state government so as to support the long-term sustainability of Louisiana's historic French cultural heritage
  • to assist French-speaking visitors to the state and thus to promote an increase in tourism and greater investment in the state from Francophone countries

 

We believe that the loss of CODOFIL will be a huge blow to the growth and advancement of the French language and culture in Louisiana.  The French culture in Louisiana is a unique and precious gem that makes up much of Louisiana's cultural identity. It also contributes to a large percentage of our tourism activity. Without CODOFIL and like organizations a large piece of what makes Louisiana the great state that it is, will slowly be lost over the coming years. 

What do you want and what do I get in return?

Our goal is to have 100,000 Cajuns + Creoles and friends of the French language in Louisiana donate $1 to help us fill the funding gap facing CODOFIL at this time. All profits will go to CODOFIL. While our goal is $100,000 we thought a solid short term goal for this campaign would be half of the total loss, so our goal here is $50,000.

Aside from the awesomeness you feel knowing that you are helping continue Louisiana's cultural heritage we have some pretty amazing perks in store for you. Check out the Perks section on the right to see all the cool swag you can get for joining the 100k.

If we do not reach our goal all profits will still be given to CODOFIL!

You can find the Facebook Page to this project at www.facebook.com/100kLA

Here is a picture of the cover of 'En Français'

 

If you plan to send a physical check pelase send and make it out it to:

Le Consortium des Ecoles d'Immersion
155 Antigua Drive
Lafayette, LA 70503
Memo: CODOFIL Fundraiser

If you are sending a physical check we will not be able include a perk as that money does not go through this Indegogo campaign.

 

The patch you will get:

Moss Picker in the Swamp:

 

Qui êtes-vous?

Nous sommes les FrancoJeunes, un petit mais dynamique groupe de jeunes professionnels franco-louisianais qui croient en l’avenir du français en Louisianeainsi qu’en l’importance de nos cultures franco-créolophones. Nous les FrancoJeunes voulons engager des Francophones, surtout des jeunes professionnels, dans la communauté franco-louisianaise. Nous appuyons et promouvons les initiatives francophones et les entreprises franco-responsables et encourageons l’affichage bilingue et les services en français dans le secteur public ainsi que dans le secteur privé. Nous appuyons aussi une augmentation DE la visibilité de la langue française dans tous les secteurs de la communauté, et nous voulons que le français soit consideré comme un élément clef de l’économie culturelle de la Louisiane.

 

Le Conseil pour le Développement du Français en Louisiane (CODOFIL) est l’agence étatique chargée des initiatives éducatives et économiques culturelles en français en Louisiane. L’agence a plusieurs mandats législatifs tels que le tourisme francophone, le développement économique, la culture, l’éducation et les relations internationales. Le gouverneur de la Louisiane, Bobby Jindal a fait un véto à la ligne le vendredi 15 juin qui a coupé $100.000 du budget du CODOFIL (à peu près 40% de son budget total) pour l’année fiscale 2013. Cette coupure budgétaire laisse le CODOFIL avec juste assez d’argent pour les coûts du personnel et pas de budget opérationnel pour accomplir ces buts, dont les suivants :

  • Superviser le développement et l’augmentation du développement économique de l’état et les activités touristiques désignées pour l’épanouissement de la culture, de l’héritage et de la langue.
  • Promouvoir, développer et superviser les relations culturelles et éducatives et les échanges entre la Louisiane et les autres pays, provinces et états qui partagent notre héritage, culture et langue.
  • Développer et augmenter les environnements éducatifs en immersion française.
  • Développer un system de certification par lequel les marchands, les festivals et les restaurants peuvent s’identifier comme ‘franco-responsable’, et créer une marque ‘franco-responsable’ pour mettre à l’entrée.
  • Offrir des services gouvernementaux en français aux citoyens et visiteurs francophones
  • Accompagner les citoyens franco-louisianais en obtenant et en emploient les services du gouvernement pour soutenir la durabilité à long terme de l’héritage culturel francophone.
  • Accompagner les visiteurs francophones en Louisiane et promouvoir une augmentation en tourisme ainsi qu’un investissement plus profond dans la Louisiane des pays francophones.
 

Nous croyons que si on perd le CODOFIL, la langue française et la culture francophone en Louisiane souffrira. La francophonie louisianaise est un trésor précieux qui fait l’identité culturelle de l’état ce qu’elle l’est. Elle contribue beaucoup à l’activité touristique et donc à l’économie. Sans les agences comme le CODOFIL, l’identité franco-louisianaise sera perdue dans les années qui viennent.

Qu’est-ce que vous voulez et qu’est-ce que je recevrai en retour ?

Notre but est de rassembler 100.000 Cadiens + Créoles et amis de la langue française en Louisiane et les encourager à contribuer $1 pour nous accompagner en restaurant la coupure budgétaire à laquelle le CODOFIL fait face. Tout l’argent reçu sera utilisé pour les efforts concernant la langue française fait par le CODOFIL. Bien que notre but total est de lever $100.000, nous commençons par un but à court terme de lever la moitié de la perte, ce qui est $50.000.

Non seulement vous se sentirez super cool en sachant que vous accompagnez la Louisiane en continuant son héritage culturel, mais vous aurez aussi la possibilité de recevoir de petits cadeaux d’appréciation. Vous pouvez voir dans la section ‘Perks’ sur la droite tout ce que vous pouvez recevoir quand vous devenez un des 100k.

  • $1 –Faites partie des 100kLA ! Montrez votre soutien. Vous ne recevrez pa de cadeau, mais vous aurez le doit de fanfaronner !

$25 – Vous recevrez une copie digitale de ‘En Français.’ Le personnel incroyable à Bayou Teche Brewing Company nous a permis de vous donner une copie digitale de ce disque qui est une collection de chansons classiques de rock ‘n roll américain, reprises en français par les meilleurs musiciens au sud de la Louisiane.

$30 – Montrez votre soutien ! Vous recevrez une copie digitale de ‘En Français’ ainsi qu’un patch du drapeau acadien (dessiné par Thomas J. Arceneaux en 1965, patchifié par Bram Johnson en 2012), fait par Parish Ink. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $3 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.

$50 – Montrez votre soutien…encore plus ! Voyez-vous notre logo? Avec les petites personnes en bleu ? Vous aurez ça sur un t-shirt ! Portez-le partout ! Et si on vous voit en le portant, on vous fera un bisou ! Vous recevrez aussi une copie digitale de ‘En Français’ et le patch du drapeau de l’Acadiana pour votre générosité. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $5 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.

$75 –Tout le tremblement ! Vous recevrez tous les cadeaux…OUI, tous ! Mais attendez –il y en a plus ! En plus de votre copie digitale de ‘En Français,’ vous recevrez une copie dure du disque que vous pouvez tenir dans vos propres mains. Mettez ça dans votre lecteur de CD, augmentez le volume et chantez –les paroles sont incluses. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $10 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.

 

Si vous préférez faire un don par la poste, veuillez l'envoyer à l'adresse suivante:

Le Consortium des Écoles d'Immersion
155 Antigua Drive
Lafayette, LA 70503
Note: Collecte de fonds Codofil

IMPORTANT: Le chèque doit être libellé au Consortium des Écoles d'Immersion 

 

Puisque ce don ne sera pas effectué par l'entremise du site Indiegogo, nous ne serons pas en mesure d'offrir les avantages cités sur ce site.
story_txt:
TEXTE EN FRANCAIS CI-DESSOUS
Who are you people?
We are FrancoJeunes, a small but aspiring group of dedicated young French-speaking Louisiana professionals who believe in both the future of the French language in Louisiana and the cultural impact of our French-speaking cultures. FrancoJeunes seeks to further engage French speakers, especially young professionals, in Louisiana’s francophone community. FrancoJeunes supports and promotes francophone endeavors and French-friendly businesses, encourages bilingual signage and services in both public and private sectors, supports an increase in the visibility of French in all sectors of the community, all to make French an integral part of Louisiana’s cultural economy.
The Council for the Development of French in Louisiana (CODOFIL) is the state agency charged with French language educational and cultural economic development initiatives in Louisiana. The agency has multiple legislative mandates that include francophone tourism, economic development, culture, education and international relations. On Friday June 15, 2012 a line-item veto was performed by Governor Bobby Jindal that slashed $100,000 from CODOFIL’s budget (approximately 40% of its total budget) for the upcoming year. This budget cut leaves CODOFIL just enough money to pay operating costs with no room for a budget to accomplish its goals, which are

to oversee the development and expansion of the state's economic development and tourism activities designed to promote our French culture, heritage, and language
to promote, develop, and oversee cultural and educational relations and exchanges within the state and between the state of Louisiana and other countries, provinces, and states that share Louisiana's historical French heritage, culture and language
to develop and expand French immersion educational environments
to develop a certification system whereby vendors, festivals, and restaurants may be designated as 'Francophone Friendly' and design and issue a marquee that may be displayed at each entry
to provide state government services to French speaking citizens and visitors in the French language
to assist Louisiana citizens who speak French in dealing with and reviving services from state government so as to support the long-term sustainability of Louisiana's historic French cultural heritage
to assist French-speaking visitors to the state and thus to promote an increase in tourism and greater investment in the state from Francophone countries

 
We believe that the loss of CODOFIL will be a huge blow to the growth and advancement of the French language and culture in Louisiana.  The French culture in Louisiana is a unique and precious gem that makes up much of Louisiana's cultural identity. It also contributes to a large percentage of our tourism activity. Without CODOFIL and like organizations a large piece of what makes Louisiana the great state that it is, will slowly be lost over the coming years. 


What do you want and what do I get in return?
Our goal is to have 100,000 Cajuns + Creoles and friends of the French language in Louisiana donate $1 to help us fill the funding gap facing CODOFIL at this time. All profits will go to CODOFIL. While our goal is $100,000 we thought a solid short term goal for this campaign would be half of the total loss, so our goal here is $50,000.
Aside from the awesomeness you feel knowing that you are helping continue Louisiana's cultural heritage we have some pretty amazing perks in store for you. Check out the Perks section on the right to see all the cool swag you can get for joining the 100k.
If we do not reach our goal all profits will still be given to CODOFIL!
You can find the Facebook Page to this project at www.facebook.com/100kLA
Here is a picture of the cover of 'En Français'
 
If you plan to send a physical check pelase send and make it out it to:
Le Consortium des Ecoles d'Immersion155 Antigua DriveLafayette, LA 70503Memo: CODOFIL Fundraiser
If you are sending a physical check we will not be able include a perk as that money does not go through this Indegogo campaign.
 

The patch you will get:

Moss Picker in the Swamp:


 
Qui êtes-vous?

Nous sommes les FrancoJeunes, un petit mais dynamique groupe de jeunes professionnels franco-louisianais qui croient en l’avenir du français en Louisianeainsi qu’en l’importance de nos cultures franco-créolophones. Nous les FrancoJeunes voulons engager des Francophones, surtout des jeunes professionnels, dans la communauté franco-louisianaise. Nous appuyons et promouvons les initiatives francophones et les entreprises franco-responsables et encourageons l’affichage bilingue et les services en français dans le secteur public ainsi que dans le secteur privé. Nous appuyons aussi une augmentation DE la visibilité de la langue française dans tous les secteurs de la communauté, et nous voulons que le français soit consideré comme un élément clef de l’économie culturelle de la Louisiane.
 
Le Conseil pour le Développement du Français en Louisiane (CODOFIL) est l’agence étatique chargée des initiatives éducatives et économiques culturelles en français en Louisiane. L’agence a plusieurs mandats législatifs tels que le tourisme francophone, le développement économique, la culture, l’éducation et les relations internationales. Le gouverneur de la Louisiane, Bobby Jindal a fait un véto à la ligne le vendredi 15 juin qui a coupé $100.000 du budget du CODOFIL (à peu près 40% de son budget total) pour l’année fiscale 2013. Cette coupure budgétaire laisse le CODOFIL avec juste assez d’argent pour les coûts du personnel et pas de budget opérationnel pour accomplir ces buts, dont les suivants :


Superviser le développement et l’augmentation du développement économique de l’état et les activités touristiques désignées pour l’épanouissement de la culture, de l’héritage et de la langue.
Promouvoir, développer et superviser les relations culturelles et éducatives et les échanges entre la Louisiane et les autres pays, provinces et états qui partagent notre héritage, culture et langue.
Développer et augmenter les environnements éducatifs en immersion française.
Développer un system de certification par lequel les marchands, les festivals et les restaurants peuvent s’identifier comme ‘franco-responsable’, et créer une marque ‘franco-responsable’ pour mettre à l’entrée.
Offrir des services gouvernementaux en français aux citoyens et visiteurs francophones
Accompagner les citoyens franco-louisianais en obtenant et en emploient les services du gouvernement pour soutenir la durabilité à long terme de l’héritage culturel francophone.
Accompagner les visiteurs francophones en Louisiane et promouvoir une augmentation en tourisme ainsi qu’un investissement plus profond dans la Louisiane des pays francophones.


 
Nous croyons que si on perd le CODOFIL, la langue française et la culture francophone en Louisiane souffrira. La francophonie louisianaise est un trésor précieux qui fait l’identité culturelle de l’état ce qu’elle l’est. Elle contribue beaucoup à l’activité touristique et donc à l’économie. Sans les agences comme le CODOFIL, l’identité franco-louisianaise sera perdue dans les années qui viennent.

Qu’est-ce que vous voulez et qu’est-ce que je recevrai en retour ?

Notre but est de rassembler 100.000 Cadiens + Créoles et amis de la langue française en Louisiane et les encourager à contribuer $1 pour nous accompagner en restaurant la coupure budgétaire à laquelle le CODOFIL fait face. Tout l’argent reçu sera utilisé pour les efforts concernant la langue française fait par le CODOFIL. Bien que notre but total est de lever $100.000, nous commençons par un but à court terme de lever la moitié de la perte, ce qui est $50.000.
Non seulement vous se sentirez super cool en sachant que vous accompagnez la Louisiane en continuant son héritage culturel, mais vous aurez aussi la possibilité de recevoir de petits cadeaux d’appréciation. Vous pouvez voir dans la section ‘Perks’ sur la droite tout ce que vous pouvez recevoir quand vous devenez un des 100k.

$1 –Faites partie des 100kLA ! Montrez votre soutien. Vous ne recevrez pa de cadeau, mais vous aurez le doit de fanfaronner !

$25 – Vous recevrez une copie digitale de ‘En Français.’ Le personnel incroyable à Bayou Teche Brewing Company nous a permis de vous donner une copie digitale de ce disque qui est une collection de chansons classiques de rock ‘n roll américain, reprises en français par les meilleurs musiciens au sud de la Louisiane.
$30 – Montrez votre soutien ! Vous recevrez une copie digitale de ‘En Français’ ainsi qu’un patch du drapeau acadien (dessiné par Thomas J. Arceneaux en 1965, patchifié par Bram Johnson en 2012), fait par Parish Ink. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $3 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.
$50 – Montrez votre soutien…encore plus ! Voyez-vous notre logo? Avec les petites personnes en bleu ? Vous aurez ça sur un t-shirt ! Portez-le partout ! Et si on vous voit en le portant, on vous fera un bisou ! Vous recevrez aussi une copie digitale de ‘En Français’ et le patch du drapeau de l’Acadiana pour votre générosité. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $5 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.
$75 –Tout le tremblement ! Vous recevrez tous les cadeaux…OUI, tous ! Mais attendez –il y en a plus ! En plus de votre copie digitale de ‘En Français,’ vous recevrez une copie dure du disque que vous pouvez tenir dans vos propres mains. Mettez ça dans votre lecteur de CD, augmentez le volume et chantez –les paroles sont incluses. Si vous habitez hors des Etats-Unis, merci d’ajouter $10 à votre contribution pour défrayer les coûts d’expédition.
 
Si vous préférez faire un don par la poste, veuillez l'envoyer à l'adresse suivante:
Le Consortium des Écoles d'Immersion155 Antigua DriveLafayette, LA 70503Note: Collecte de fonds CodofilIMPORTANT: Le chèque doit être libellé au Consortium des Écoles d'Immersion 
 
Puisque ce don ne sera pas effectué par l'entremise du site Indiegogo, nous ne serons pas en mesure d'offrir les avantages cités sur ce site.

story:
What is The Parent Quest?

  • * Vision: The Parent Quest is committed to supporting families while navigating through the obstacles of parenthood.
    * Mission: To enrich the parenting experience by strengthening familial bonds through the utilization of a parent to parent     mentoring relationship. 

  • When I became a mom, I realized how much I needed other mothers advice and input to get me through my day. Then one of my friends because a mom and my pilot program for The PQ inadvertently began.  It went so well, I decided to create this nonprofit organization to help moms and dads. Hence the reason why The PQ was founded.
  • The need is huge.  This program just needs funding.  We have the Board of Directors, a program director, a grant writer, a lawyer working on the nonprofit side of it, and website designers all working for this wonderful foundation.
  • Please help us with any amount you can contribute. 

What The Parent Quest Logo Campaign Needs:

  • We met our goal for the logo...now we are onto fundraising for the website!!!

Other Way You Can Help The Parent Quest:

  • Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help:
  • Please get the word out about my campaign...LIKE it on Facebook, tell your friends, etc.  ALL funding will go towards The Parent Quest.  This program is Non-Profit.
  • Please use the Indiegogo SHARE tools to help get the word out about my campaign!!!
story_txt:
What is The Parent Quest?



* Vision: The Parent Quest is committed to supporting families while navigating through the obstacles of parenthood. * Mission: To enrich the parenting experience by strengthening familial bonds through the utilization of a parent to parent mentoring relationship. 


When I became a mom, I realized how much I needed other mothers advice and input to get me through my day. Then one of my friends because a mom and my pilot program for The PQ inadvertently began.  It went so well, I decided to create this nonprofit organization to help moms and dads. Hence the reason why The PQ was founded.
The need is huge.  This program just needs funding.  We have the Board of Directors, a program director, a grant writer, a lawyer working on the nonprofit side of it, and website designers all working for this wonderful foundation.
Please help us with any amount you can contribute. 



What The Parent Quest Logo Campaign Needs:

We met our goal for the logo...now we are onto fundraising for the website!!!



Other Way You Can Help The Parent Quest:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help:
Please get the word out about my campaign...LIKE it on Facebook, tell your friends, etc.  ALL funding will go towards The Parent Quest.  This program is Non-Profit.
Please use the Indiegogo SHARE tools to help get the word out about my campaign!!!

story:
Smylee’s Summary

Greetings!

We are Raw Cuisine Delights; Idaho’s pioneering raw vegan business.  We are a startup biz moving into our third year in farmer’s market sales and just hitting our one-year anniversary in the retail distribution market; the new Idaho industry is looking good! Through part-time kitchen rentals, persistent efforts and dedication we have created a viable part-time business promoting healthy snacking and eating.  We are ready to step it up! Naturally, our next step is into our very own full-time certified kitchen; thus, Smylee’s Holistic Bistro.

The Impact

With your contributions we can create an environment that supports and educates about diverse practices of holistic lifestyles-cultivating body, mind and spirit. We nurture our bodies with a primarily raw vegan bistro serving beverages, food, snacks, and “baked” goods such as cakes, pies, and cookies. Our retail area includes hard-to-find raw vegan ingredients, healthy living tools, recipe books, and books to stimulate and retrain our minds. Our education culture provides hands on experiences in classes, workshops and culinary incubator. We support a social community forum through Facebook to keep our spirits fresh and expanding.

It is essential for us to provide yummy food with optimum nutritional value. Your taste buds belief, demonstrated faith, and hungry bellies have inspired us to create a safe haven for you to explore and discover healthy alternatives. Our current market distribution continues to grow, (thanks to you), and we are excited to share the benefits of a primarily raw vegan lifestyle via Smylee’s Holistic Bistro. It is interesting to note that our body’s optimum performance is with an 80% fresh raw diet and 20% everything else. Yet, where do we go to dine on our 80% option? Smylee’s is dedicated to changing that perspective.

What We Need

We have recognized your support and it inspires us to do more, which requires more resources. We are not interested in obtaining a traditional business loan and sinking immediately into debt. We believe with your help we can represent Smylee’s vision and offer you a vegan holistic sanctuary. We are asking you, our community, for funding assistance. We have provided a detailed and prioritized excel file, “Bistro Needs”, available under our Gallery tab.  To make your contribution all the more tempting we have created the following perk packages to please your palates. ;)

What You Get

Check out our Smylee Perks Video For details! Video is listed under Gallery tab.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE – SHARE – SHARE

One way you can help out is by sharing any resources on acquiring our listed items at discounted or reduced rates.

Another way is to please use Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word about Smylee’s dream of a Holistic Bistro; nurturing your mind, body and spirit. 

Gratitude

Thank you Robert Wesley Hall for your artistic rendition and passionate heart.

Many thanks Diane Krouse for “vectorfying” Robert’s work.

The RCD team, Thank you mom and Cathi for loving to feed the people!

 

**********************

story:
So They Can Know has been featured in:

So They Can Know is a website designed to help people who've been diagnosed with STDs notify their partners. Right now, only 23% of at-risk partners are notified following a diagnosis. If we increase the percentage of people notifying their partners, we can spread communication and treatment back along an infected sexual network. This has the potential to eradicate curable STDs (like chlamydia) from entire communities. Plus, don't you want to help make sure your partners tell you if they get diagnosed?

We are Sexual Health Innovations- the 501(c)3 non-profit that has created and is maintaining So They Can Know. We are dedicated to using technology to improve sexual health. Jessica Ladd and Jenny McManus are the two leaders of the initiative- two bad-ass young women with Masters in Public Health from Johns Hopkins and long-standing commitments to sexual health. And we have an incredible Board and Advisory Board helping us out.

We want to make sex more awesome for everyone and eradicate STDs from the United States. With your help, we can maintain So They Can Know as a free service for the next year and provide free promotional materials to STD and family planning clinics to give out to their patients. This will ensure that there will be more people notifying their partners, more partners getting tested and treated, and fewer people spreading STDs. How cool is that?

Jessica Ladd speaks about So They Can Know at TEDxMidAtantic:

 

The Problem

Each year there are 9.1 million new STD cases among 15-24 year olds in the United States. Most people with STDs donʼt have any symptoms and donʼt seek testing or treatment. This results in ongoing transmission, particularly among youth and racial/ethnic minorities. Untreated STDs cause serious reproductive health problems over time and they leave those infected vulnerable to other STDs, such as HIV.

Traditionally, anonymous partner notification has been provided by health departments. However, most health departments no longer have the funding to provide anonymous partner notification services for STDs other than HIV and syphilis, and even when they do, not everyone wants to tell a government entity who they've had sex with. Still, anonymous partner notification programs have historically coincided with dramatic decreases in STD incidence.

Why We Think This Will Work

So They Can Know has an incredible team behind it, has a ton of support from the public health community, and is likely to work. We asked a random sample of STD clinics if they would tell their patients about it, and over 90% said yes. We asked young Americans if they would use it to notify a partner they weren't willing to tell in person, and over 80% said they'd be likely to. Planned Parenthood, the National Coalition of STD Directors, the Baltimore and New York City health departments, and many other organizations will help us get the word out to clinics that need us.

We've already put in the blood and sweat to build this thing. Now let's get it into the communities that need it and start preventing some STDs.

 

Sexual Health Innovations needs $25,000 dollars to maintain So They Can Know and start promoting it to STD clinics across the United States. The funds will go towards supporting this campaign, printing and distributing promotional material, and office space and salary support for Sexual Health Innovations’ staff that are promoting the website.

The more money we raise, the more clinics we can get promoting So They Can Know to their patients, the more partners being notified. Even if we don’t reach our goal, 91% of all funds we raise will go directly to our promotion efforts. Regardless of how much we raise, your contribution directly impacts our ability to reach at-risk youth in the United States. 

Here's what the cards that we want to provide to at least 100 clinics in the next year look like :

By supporting So They Can Know with any size donation, you become a part of the effort to improve the sexual health of young Americans.

$1 or more: You = Awesome. Tax exempt donation (the amount of your donation minus the cost of your perk)! And we'll think you are awesome and keep you updated on our progress.

$5: You= 5 x Awesome. You're five times as awesome! Go you! 

$15 or more: You = Fan. We'll write your name on a Sexual Health Innovations post-it note, take a photo of us holding it, and tweet it and email it to you. And then we'll stick it to the wall of our office so that we can be reminded of how great you are while we're working. Because you're officially a Fan!

$25: Fan + Condoms/Post-It Notes. You're a Fan! Choose between our customized condoms and post-it notes. And your donation pays for a month of hosting for the website!

$40: Fan + Awesome Undies. You're a Fan! Choose among thirteen pairs of totally awesome underwear (and with more underwear designs coming soon). Nine of these were inspired by FORCE and the "PINK loves CONSENT" spoof, and created with their permission. And your donation pays for the cost of printing 300 promotional cards! 

$50: Fan + T-Shirt/Museum of Sex/(Underwear + Condom). You're a Fan! Choose among: a t-shirt, two passes to the Museum of Sex in New York City, or a pair of underwear and a custom condom. And your donation pays for promotional material for one clinic for a 6 months!

$100: Friend + Gift Pack. You're officially a Friend of Sexual Health Innovations, and will be listed as such on our organizational website (unless you don't want to be). And you get a gift pack, which includes a custom condom, post-it notes, and two items of apparel of your choice. And your donation covers the cost of promotional material for one clinic for a year!

$250: Family + Launch Party + Swag. You're officially Family of Sexual Health Innovations, and will be listed as such on our organizational website (unless you don't want to be). Two free tickets to our next launch party + your choice of apparel. Your donation covers 2 weeks of office space for Jess or Jenny.

$500: Family + 2 Years of Parties + 2 x Swag. You're Family! Two free tickets to all parties we have in the next 2 years + your choice of two items of apparel. Your donation covers a month of overhead costs for one staff person.

$1000: Family + Clinic Sponsor: You're Family! You're also an official sponsor of 5 clinics. You choose the clinics, and we will reach out to them and provide them with free promotional material for a year.

$5000: Family + Advisor/Presentation: Choose to either participate in an organizational brainstorming session or have us present at your next event for FREE (travel costs not included). Your donation covers the cost of 2 new videos for the So They Can Know website!

 

Even if you are not in place to give right now, you can still help further our cause!

  • Get the word out about our cause by sharing it with your social networks. Post our campaign on facebook or twitter, or send out some mass emails.
  • Volunteer for Sexual Health Innovations. So They Can Know was built entirely by volunteer programmers, graphic designers, and public health professionals. Our volunteers are ESSENTIAL to our success. We are always looking for more volunteer programmers, graphic designers, marketing buffs, videographers......anything. Let us know what you can offer and we will find a project for you!

Tell your friends about So They Can Know (so they can tell their friends, and they can tell their friends, and.....) Who knows? Maybe down the line, your actions will prevent you or someone you care about from getting an STD.

The more money we raise, the more clinics we can get promoting So They Can Know to their patients, the more partners being notified. Even if we don’t reach our goal, 91% of all funds we raise will go directly to our promotion efforts. Regardless of how much we raise, your contribution directly impacts our ability to reach at-risk youth in the United States. 
Here's what the cards that we want to provide to at least 100 clinics in the next year look like :

By supporting So They Can Know with any size donation, you become a part of the effort to improve the sexual health of young Americans.
$1 or more: You = Awesome. Tax exempt donation (the amount of your donation minus the cost of your perk)! And we'll think you are awesome and keep you updated on our progress.
$5: You= 5 x Awesome. You're five times as awesome! Go you! 
$15 or more: You = Fan. We'll write your name on a Sexual Health Innovations post-it note, take a photo of us holding it, and tweet it and email it to you. And then we'll stick it to the wall of our office so that we can be reminded of how great you are while we're working. Because you're officially a Fan!
$25: Fan + Condoms/Post-It Notes. You're a Fan! Choose between our customized condoms and post-it notes. And your donation pays for a month of hosting for the website!



$40: Fan + Awesome Undies. You're a Fan! Choose among thirteen pairs of totally awesome underwear (and with more underwear designs coming soon). Nine of these were inspired by FORCE and the "PINK loves CONSENT" spoof, and created with their permission. And your donation pays for the cost of printing 300 promotional cards! 


$50: Fan + T-Shirt/Museum of Sex/(Underwear + Condom). You're a Fan! Choose among: a t-shirt, two passes to the Museum of Sex in New York City, or a pair of underwear and a custom condom. And your donation pays for promotional material for one clinic for a 6 months!

$100: Friend + Gift Pack. You're officially a Friend of Sexual Health Innovations, and will be listed as such on our organizational website (unless you don't want to be). And you get a gift pack, which includes a custom condom, post-it notes, and two items of apparel of your choice. And your donation covers the cost of promotional material for one clinic for a year!
$250: Family + Launch Party + Swag. You're officially Family of Sexual Health Innovations, and will be listed as such on our organizational website (unless you don't want to be). Two free tickets to our next launch party + your choice of apparel. Your donation covers 2 weeks of office space for Jess or Jenny.
$500: Family + 2 Years of Parties + 2 x Swag. You're Family! Two free tickets to all parties we have in the next 2 years + your choice of two items of apparel. Your donation covers a month of overhead costs for one staff person.
$1000: Family + Clinic Sponsor: You're Family! You're also an official sponsor of 5 clinics. You choose the clinics, and we will reach out to them and provide them with free promotional material for a year.
$5000: Family + Advisor/Presentation: Choose to either participate in an organizational brainstorming session or have us present at your next event for FREE (travel costs not included). Your donation covers the cost of 2 new videos for the So They Can Know website!
 



Even if you are not in place to give right now, you can still help further our cause!

Get the word out about our cause by sharing it with your social networks. Post our campaign on facebook or twitter, or send out some mass emails.
Volunteer for Sexual Health Innovations. So They Can Know was built entirely by volunteer programmers, graphic designers, and public health professionals. Our volunteers are ESSENTIAL to our success. We are always looking for more volunteer programmers, graphic designers, marketing buffs, videographers......anything. Let us know what you can offer and we will find a project for you!

Tell your friends about So They Can Know (so they can tell their friends, and they can tell their friends, and.....) Who knows? Maybe down the line, your actions will prevent you or someone you care about from getting an STD.

story:
2 DAYS LEFT IN OUR CAMPAIGN. ALL DONATIONS MADE IN THE REMAINING 2 DAYS WILL BE MATCHED DOLLAR FOR DOLLAR BY THE CHANTAL PAYDAR FOUNDATION. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT, LETS MAKE THIS HAPPEN! 


Let me start with a thank you for your interest in my campaign.

My name is Remo Moomiaie-Qajar, M.D. and I am the founder and president of the Chantal Paydar Foundation, a federally recognized Peace, Justice and Conflict Resolution pubic charity (501c3) in the US. The foundation has supported many bright young people who are doing great deeds to improve their communities and contribute to a better world. Last year on a trip to Africa, I meet two young men, Billian and Jeff, who exemplified the “do good” characteristics the foundation has become so privileged to help. The “Billian Music Family” started three years ago to mentor and to teach life-skills to a handful of disadvantaged yet talented children of the Mathare Slum using music. Through music and dance in a loving and caring family environment, it has blossomed into a community movement fostering the next generation of leaders. Fueled only by the determination of Billian and Jeff, the Billian Music Family has accomplished amazing outreach. Listening and working with Billian and Jeff, I am asking you to join the Chantal Paydar Foundation to address their most urgent need and empower the Billian Music Family to expand the number of young lives they positively influence by funding a community youth art centre in this Indiegogo campaign.

What is the Billian Music Family?

The Billian Music Family is a community based music enlightenment project out of the Mathare Slum of Nairobi Kenya. The Billian Music Family was started by Billian Okoth and Jeffery Andre as an experiment 3 years ago to see if the power of music, hip-hop, and dance could elevate the spirits and hopes of the youngest slum residents. The Billian Music Family provides the children of the Mathare Slum the opportunity to explore their lives through music as a means to empower and enable them to grow as community leaders. The experiment was so successful that it grew from 6 children to over 30 in 3 years. The experiment transformed into a movement within the Mathare Slum as a platform for creating a positive change in the community. The “Clean Up the Slum” event removes litter around the slum. “Environmental Love”, where the Billian Music Family plants tree seedlings throughout the slum, motivates others in the community to invest in their community. The Billian Music Family empowers the youth and community of the Mathare slum to believe in and value themselves.  

 

Our Success Story

The talented children continue to inspire as they evolve into young leaders in Mathare. Here are some photos of organized community activities from this past year in Mathare.  Make sure to checkout the musical talents of the kids of the Billian Music Family using the Gallery Tab above.  

  

What is the need?

The Mathare slum is one of the largest slums in the world and houses more than 500,000 people. Although filled with the problems of poverty, the slum is fertile with culture and talent. In 3 years, the founders of the Billian Music Family have proven that with determination and commitment, music and leadership can inspire the children of the Mathare slum. The Billian Music Family has grown beyond its means and needs your help to continue its movement of enlightenment by creating a community centre where children of the slum can learn and expand their musical talents in a peaceful and sheltered environment.

   

For the first three years, Billian and Jeff have operated the Billian Music Family through the generosity of local store owners who shut down their places of business to offer sanctuary to the Billian Music Family's 30 kids for a few hours of the day. The need for a proper learning environment for the growth of the children is paramount to this success story. With your help, the Chantal Paydar Foundation and the Billian Music Family will purchase a piece of property within the Mathare Slum to convert into a youth centre for learning music, community development, and leadership. The goal is to have a place where children will come and feel wanted, where they are free to express themselves and learn to sing, dance, and play instruments as all children should. 

A Grass Roots Vision based on our Experience

“Growing up in Mathare, I know too well that the first youth art centre in Mathare is what the community has been yearning for a long time. It may be hard for people to understand what the slum life can do to a young child and why a center like ours will bring meaningful change to them. Many lives are going to be directly transformed through the youth art center by empowering the youth to express themselves and gaining knowledge of a talent they have within. The centre has this power to change the lives of youth by giving them options they do not know exist. Options to work hard in discovering and mastering their musical talents while learning how to become valuable members of their community and important leadership skills. The problems of the Mathare slums are many, but until today we have very little answers to them. The community youth centre can be one of the answers for our community. We hope that the next big star will come from the Billian Music Family, but for us the victory exist by giving the youth the chance and hope to become a big star that we know they already are.” Billian Okoth

“I am passionate about working with the Billian Music Family because I want to actively help shape and positively transform our community, I believe that nurturing the young talent at a tender age and enlightening them plays a big role in community development since the kids will grow up to be responsible, independent minded, resourceful and great development ambassadors of Mathare. I do believe in them.” Jeffrey Andre

 

Your donation for the Billian Music Family Youth Community Centre will go towards:

 

  • Purchase and constructing a proper community youth art centre in Mathare

  • Operating cost for the first year

  • Instrument purchases

  • Continuing education for 30 current students of the Billian Music Family

  • Extra-curricular music and art learning opportunities to other youth spanning the Mathare Slum

  • Mathare Slum community as a whole by giving the community a place for sheltering children from crime and violence.   

 

 

How Can YOU be a PART of this MOVEMENT? 

The obvious answer is to donate today what you can.  Every little bit and big bit helps us get closer to our goal.  We have great affordable options for everyone and we offer some really cool perks.  Your contributions are also tax-deductible, so it is a WIN-WIN-WIN for all involved!  

You can contribute as well with helping us go VIRAL! Use the IndieGoGo share tools at the bottom of the page to spread the word about this campaign and your role in it through FACEBOOK, TWITTER, Email, Fax, Smoke signals, etc.  Write a comment and share your thoughts with us!

Anything you do right now is a help to us.  With much gratitude we thank you!!!

Thank You for Your Support!!!

To my wife Laura and my family for sharing in my belief that if you can help others, you should. 

Chantal Paydar Foundation Supporters who make all our projects AWESOME!

William Potter who will go anywhere to film a good story! You rock!

Tomasz Radomski, M.D. for his time, efforts and talents to support this project!

George Gachara and the NEST family for being such great ambassadors for Nairobi!  Your movement inspires me. 

Biggs Museum of American Art (Ryan and Linda)-when in Dover DE, check out this gem. 

Billian and Jeff for opening your world to me and being a partner from the start in this great venture! You are heroes to the 30 kids of the BMF and loved by your community! Doesn't get better then that.

Last but not least. YOU and the IndieGoGo community for donating today and with other similar and caring souls acting in unity to support our project.  

Sincerely,

Remo Moomiaie-Qajar, M.D.

story:
**UPDATE: I needed to set the campaign end date on Monday to ensure credit card donations will be disbursed within 2 weeks to get to landlord. Please email me at hchannigan@gmail.com if you'd still like to help, THANK YOU!!

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR DONATIONS & SUPPORT. LOVE AND GRATITUDE!! xo

[Note: Please donate via paypal if possible, thank you!! Only paypal donations are received immediately, e-checks, bank card etc are held until a week after the end. Please also spread the word with Indiegogo's share tools.]

**This is an urgent call for help.** I have done everything humanly possible to get to this point.

Situation (Updated For Better Clarity):

I didn't want to dish on someone else, yet I'm getting a handful of hate messages saying GET A JOB. So the J-O-B is actually what got me here. After recovering from the massive liver infection, the housing I could get was work trade helping a woman start her business plus her California paid in home care. I swallowed my ego and took it.

A month and a half after I moved in, she got diagnosed with Borderline Personality. It was a long slow slide. Eventually, she got erratic, broke some of my stuff, moved most to storage and I started rushing plans to escape. It got to where she had NO boundaries, tried to take up all my time (the majority of it unpaid), and disrupted my schedule whenever possible while trying to get new work, gigs and business clients…in her co-dependency she had to be the constant center of attention.

One night I got home from a business networking event. She had booze in hand. I saw a new box full of painkillers in the corner. She was loaded, had a psychotic episode, threatened me and the neighbors called the police from her noise.

Even though I had tenant rights, the police said they could only guarantee my safety if I moved out right then. My spiritual mentor came across the bay and got me from the nearby bus stop at 1:30 am to stay on her couch overnight. I was able to secure a warehouse stay briefly.

After that, I have barely had time to secure new rental housing, not enough time for new work/gigs/business clients. Now, after just having moved in an apartment with a friend, I am already facing eviction due to lack of further funds. I don't really have anything significant left to sell for cash.

I immediately need enough funds to stabilize my housing situation, cover food, utilities, keep my business phone on, and counseling to recover from the trauma of my prior situation. The Indiegogo perks are client work products, so this isn't a handout. If you want something else, feel free to suggest. If you have any questions please message me.

More is below about my business plans and how I intend to pay it forward. My entire purpose and reason for being is to help women of ALL backgrounds find freedom in their lives and work.

My eternal gratitude. THANK YOU!! <3 

Immediate Needs:

$500 – One month rent*

$125 – Utilities, transportation, internet, plus business phone lifeline

$300 – 1 month healthy food, supplies, vitamins and necessary medication

$150 – 1 month sliding scale therapy

$85 – Indiegogo/Paypal fees estimate
-----
$1160

*Note: Was $650…got a partial reduction helping the landlord with cleaning.

Entrepreneurial Journey:

I am intersex, raised as a boy yet mentally, emotionally, and hormonally more female. I was misunderstood, bullied in childhood, harassed in the corporate world. My father committed suicide in February 2005 over drinking and gambling problems. I blamed myself for not being more available. I had a near death experience (NDE), then lost my last day job.

It became clear the only path was my own venture. After moving to the San Francisco Bay Area in 2010, while finishing schooling in Non-Profit and Business Management, I started helping local small business owners, experimenting with a number of different potential niches that mixed in advertising, marketing, professional and digital organizing and more. I made the rounds at local weekend seminars and women's meetup business events. 

In 2011, I taught a Motivational Life and Business Coaching program at API Wellness in San Francisco. This past year I lead Skillshare business classes on Social Media, Branding, Marketing, Messaging and more at Wix Lounge SF.

I have plans to help many others, now encapsulating all I've learned into the new business skills training program I'm about to start offering. A new business mentor just arrived on Monday (she is being an angel offering her guidance initially for free), however I need time in September to implement the crucial information she has provided.

My WHY is being a conduit for women of ALL backgrounds to be their kick-ass, fully activated, authentic, and expressive selves while powerfully manifesting their business dreams. As part of my promise to "pay it forward" for this help, I will always keep at least one low-cost scholarship open in my business offerings to help women, especially queer and transgender women.
AGAIN, THANK YOU!! <3

story:
Hello! My name is Umesh Pai, I am based in Sydney, Australia.

About myself and my business venture. I am an electronic engineer, now involved in my start-up called GalaxC. The business is registered in Sydney since 2008 (ACN: 130 907 274)

About the product: GalaxC is an innovative web-application, a tool for Consumers and Businesses to transact business and enjoy several unique benefits (not available from the other alternatives). Details follow below. 

Click here: www.GalaxC.com (redirecting to Australian sub-domain site)

Our Values: I want GalaxC to be a community focused business with strong ethical and social responsibility (paying its fair share of taxes and committing to return 5% to 10% of profits back to the community for worthy causes or projects in every country).

Vision: To be the preferred e-marketplace with a globally recognizable brand, that every Consumer and every business in the world would want to use - to buy or sell a product or a service.

Mission: (1) To help every Consumer and Business save time and money while buying or selling any service or product (2) To build trust in the marketplace between the two groups. (3) To raise the bar for customer service standards.

My Team: We will seek like-minded experienced executives and a reputed board of directors at the appropriate time and will also be head-hunting a top ICT professional to implement future development plans. (Until then we have a small Team working towards the same goals, including our outsourced software developer) 

How it came about: Having experienced a lot of frustration and financial pain, both as a Consumer and as a Provider, I had been thinking about a solution as far back as 2004. I actually started seriously researching and developing the solution while recuperating after an operation in 2007. I soon learnt from many of my friends that these marketplace problems are actually quite common. 

Without an ICT / software background and inability to find a co-founder with the right background, outsourcing was inevitable. GalaxC is the result. So far, we have used our own money including contributions from friends and family. The delay has been mainly due to the funds running out. The product is now ready for the real test - in the actual marketplace.

A product introduction video:

The background: The problem with present methods of buying or selling anything, whether service or product – using directories (like Yellow Pages), Search Engines (mostly Google) or RFQ / broker sites, to search for Providers (businesses) or get quotes - is that they do not provide efficient or reliable solutions, to say the least. This is because:

Consumers cannot shop around easily to get best possible Value for their Money (which encompasses the price, quality / reliability, delivery times, their own preferences and the process itself). Booking the best value is even more difficult if the requirement is urgent.

Providers (Businesses) 'waste' too much money on advertising and lead generation and waste time on the wrong type of customers or prospects, paying for spurious leads etc. Online methods like SEO or SEM are neither quick nor cheap, and have been getting more expensive over time as more providers compete online for Consumers' eyeballs using search engines.

The GalaxC solution for Consumers lets them get the best possible Value deal for their money or budget, for any service or product – without Searches, reading reviews, multiple telephone calls or emails to request quotes, haggling, quote comparisons. Some exceptions exist, but they are still simpler and quicker than the present methods.

The GalaxC solution for Providers offers virtually unlimited FREE leads of the highest quality through RFQs (requests for quotes) from purchase-ready and committed Consumers from their chosen territory who are looking for reliable Providers and value for their money. GalaxC makes it possible for Quality Providers to win with higher quote amounts. Only the winning Provider pays a small Success Fee.

GalaxC meets universal marketplace needs because it helps Consumers get what they want - the best value for the money they spend - any number of times in a year. Aren't we all consumers? And businesses owners want to save time and money in every part of the world and improve their productivity. GalaxC offers real solutions – not just search results or poor choice offered by our competition. 

By cutting the costs for businesses through unlimited leads (virtually FREE), and by creating fairer competition, we help the national economy in each market / country.

See the video below for How Providers (businesses) benefit from GalaxC (1M47s)

 

Click this link to see: How Consumers benefit from GalaxC (video: 4M33s)

This campaign and its importance:

This campaign is very important because the project is awaiting funds injection required for the Pilot Test to show market 'traction', to some big investors / prospective partners (even though they have seen the product demo and like the product). After the Pilot Test, we expect to form strategic alliances with reputed corporations who share our values, vision and goal.

What the contributions will help me achieve:

The Pilot Test is expected to validate the platform, prove the business model, get some publicity through the media, and get the 'traction' that was recommended by some prospective strategic partners. We expect to be well placed for getting the bigger funding required for the next stage and even for ramping up global deployment which will be in phases. The Pilot is expected sometime in December (2013) - January 2014.

What we need (for our immediate needs centred on the Pilot Test): 

We are seeking $100K - about 3.5% of our original budget of $A3M for Australian
(national) roll-out as the geography for this Pilot is a very small part of Sydney. This estimate is approximate and includes allowance for contingencies.

The Breakup of expenses for the Pilot + other immediate tasks (over 3-5 months): $100K. The amount is allocated for the following tasks / expenses:

  • Ads for awareness creation / membership $20K
  • Preparation: (Videos, content, T&C, Mobile App + webinars/seminars) $14K
  • Bug-fixing (post Pilot / Beta) + refinements & desirable features $18K
  • Live Customer Support 2-3 people @ $3-4K/m (for 3-4months)  $25K
  • Insurance, Hosting, SMS Gateway, IP issues etc. $11K
  • Approx. Fees (PayPal + Indiegogo) + Contingency $12K

Why this project is valuable to you, the contributor and to the world:

1. This product can save hundreds to thousands of dollars every year for every Consumer and every Business - depending on how often they use it. 

2. If you like supporting the underdog, or an ethical business with strong corporate social responsibility and be part of something benevolent on a global scale, please join us. Let us create some pleasant ripples or maybe even cause a big revolution.

3. We firmly believe we can create a popular global brand, and a business which can help Consumers and businesses around the world. It is your privilege to make this happen. GalaxC will be taking on the biggest guns and we need all the support we can get.

4. You would be able to give something back to your community and your country. GalaxC values deem it a privilege for a company to pay more in taxes; giving back to the community is part of its social responsibility.

5. Your contribution is highly valued and will be duly recognized. The perk itself is also very valuable when compared with competing products in the market. Your help in promoting the GalaxC campaign through your social media network is also very welcome and will prove extremely useful to serve you in your city, faster. Even if neither of these is convenient, perhaps registering your interest on the GalaxC.com website would help (those outside Australia) get GalaxC in your country /city sooner. It will be sufficient proof to our would-be local strategic partners in your country. 

A flash Ad idea for GalaxC: A possible Social Medium  (Click this link)

Understanding the basic GalaxC products (also used for supporters' perks): The basic GalaxC products are Online Directory and RFQ platform with paid subscriptions for memberships as given below. The perks are targeted at Providers (business owners), but are transferable for other (Consumer) funders. Other surprise perks may be considered for Consumers.

A) PRO-membership: This offers a competitive platform for Providers, with level playing field, and incentives for Quality and reliability. All Members get unlimited leads virtually FREE. They get instant alerts, equal opportunity for members to bid for the 'job' / project / product and the winner pays a small Success fee. Customers don't call providers directly.

B) Directory Listing / Membership: It is like any business directory; leads come direct from customers (from their chosen territory). Members do not get indirect leads / RFQs via GalaxC. No other fees are payable, like pay-per-click or impressions.

Full membership = a combination of both the above at a discount (for best of both worlds)

C) Territory: Providers can choose a suburb or post code or a small part of the city or one whole city, state or whole country as their territory. Their customers within the chosen territory can find them or request quotes. 

E.P.= Expected Pricing for membership / subscription. Yet to be decided and will vary from country to country, depending on the size of the country, the local currency and the PPP (purchasing power parity) and the perk will be adjusted to local currency and economy. (For example, members in third world and smaller countries could get extended subscriptions for the same perks / contributions). Success fee less than 4.5% (for small transactions and falling) to less than 0.1% at very large transactions

Notes on GalaxC perks:

1. The perks are over and above the normal Promotional or New member Trial offer of: 1 month PRO + 3 Months Directory Memberships for territory up to 5 suburbs / postcodes.

2.  Perks will generally be available at launch time in any market. Estimated perk delivery date shown is for USA. Other countries could follow in quick succession.

3. All funders will be acknowledged on the GalaxC website, as soon as possible (with their names, City / postcode and Country) unless advised not to or remain anonymous.

4. Funders who cannot use the listed perks or transfer them to businesses owned by friends or family, may be offered surprise gifts around the time of local launch (in their country).
story_txt:
Hello! My name is Umesh Pai, I am based in Sydney, Australia. 
About myself and my business venture. I am an electronic engineer, now involved in my start-up called GalaxC. The business is registered in Sydney since 2008 (ACN: 130 907 274) 
About the product: GalaxC is an innovative web-application, a tool for Consumers and Businesses to transact business and enjoy several unique benefits (not available from the other alternatives). Details follow below. 
Click here: www.GalaxC.com (redirecting to Australian sub-domain site)
Our Values: I want GalaxC to be a community focused business with strong ethical and social responsibility (paying its fair share of taxes and committing to return 5% to 10% of profits back to the community for worthy causes or projects in every country). 
Vision: To be the preferred e-marketplace with a globally recognizable brand, that every Consumer and every business in the world would want to use - to buy or sell a product or a service.
Mission: (1) To help every Consumer and Business save time and money while buying or selling any service or product (2) To build trust in the marketplace between the two groups. (3) To raise the bar for customer service standards.
My Team: We will seek like-minded experienced executives and a reputed board of directors at the appropriate time and will also be head-hunting a top ICT professional to implement future development plans. (Until then we have a small Team working towards the same goals, including our outsourced software developer) 

How it came about: Having experienced a lot of frustration and financial pain, both as a Consumer and as a Provider, I had been thinking about a solution as far back as 2004. I actually started seriously researching and developing the solution while recuperating after an operation in 2007. I soon learnt from many of my friends that these marketplace problems are actually quite common.  
Without an ICT / software background and inability to find a co-founder with the right background, outsourcing was inevitable. GalaxC is the result. So far, we have used our own money including contributions from friends and family. The delay has been mainly due to the funds running out. The product is now ready for the real test - in the actual marketplace.
A product introduction video:

The background: The problem with present methods of buying or selling anything, whether service or product – using directories (like Yellow Pages), Search Engines (mostly Google) or RFQ / broker sites, to search for Providers (businesses) or get quotes - is that they do not provide efficient or reliable solutions, to say the least. This is because: 
Consumers cannot shop around easily to get best possible Value for their Money (which encompasses the price, quality / reliability, delivery times, their own preferences and the process itself). Booking the best value is even more difficult if the requirement is urgent.
Providers (Businesses) 'waste' too much money on advertising and lead generation and waste time on the wrong type of customers or prospects, paying for spurious leads etc. Online methods like SEO or SEM are neither quick nor cheap, and have been getting more expensive over time as more providers compete online for Consumers' eyeballs using search engines.
The GalaxC solution for Consumers lets them get the best possible Value deal for their money or budget, for any service or product – without Searches, reading reviews, multiple telephone calls or emails to request quotes, haggling, quote comparisons. Some exceptions exist, but they are still simpler and quicker than the present methods. 
The GalaxC solution for Providers offers virtually unlimited FREE leads of the highest quality through RFQs (requests for quotes) from purchase-ready and committed Consumers from their chosen territory who are looking for reliable Providers and value for their money. GalaxC makes it possible for Quality Providers to win with higher quote amounts. Only the winning Provider pays a small Success Fee. 
GalaxC meets universal marketplace needs because it helps Consumers get what they want - the best value for the money they spend - any number of times in a year. Aren't we all consumers? And businesses owners want to save time and money in every part of the world and improve their productivity. GalaxC offers real solutions – not just search results or poor choice offered by our competition. 
By cutting the costs for businesses through unlimited leads (virtually FREE), and by creating fairer competition, we help the national economy in each market / country. 
See the video below for How Providers (businesses) benefit from GalaxC (1M47s)

 
Click this link to see: How Consumers benefit from GalaxC (video: 4M33s)
This campaign and its importance: 
This campaign is very important because the project is awaiting funds injection required for the Pilot Test to show market 'traction', to some big investors / prospective partners (even though they have seen the product demo and like the product). After the Pilot Test, we expect to form strategic alliances with reputed corporations who share our values, vision and goal.

story:
Today I am reaching out to my family, friends and community in hopes to raise money to re-build my business, spirits, and lively-hood that was submerged in black water after only 2 days of rain. The timing couldn't have been worse, I know, with Christmas just passing and with the new year we have deadlines and goals, I can understand if sending me love and strength is all you got! 

When I walked into the space after getting the call about the flood, all my positive self talk on the way there went soaring out the window! Before the water was drained, everything I owned was submerged in a foot of black water! After the initial shock, and emotions passed, I thought about how I was going to get this back in working order and my goal was 4 days to a week. Well, if you've ever had to demo and rebuild your house, business or anything, you are aware of all the little things that can come up and delay your progress. With a month into the demo, I can see the finish line and I'm moving full speed ahead! 

Thank you for your help and a chance at a new and drier beginning!
