story:
January 6, 2014 - The heART of a Woman Project was implemented Nov.15-30, 2013 and was a success! Take a look at the postcards that were created during the workshop and are now selling in the on-site boutique. Each participant received 200 postcards. The postcards and prints are now available online. 

October 22, 2013: Thank you everyone for your donations from the bottom of my heart and on behalf of the women at eKhaya eKasi. 

If you have found this page and would like to get involved we still need donations, used iPhones and volunteers, please visit us at

The heART of a Woman Project


How You Can Help:

  • Spread the word, connect with us on Twitter or Facebook
  • Donate  
  • Corporate Sponsorship
  • Used iPhone donations. If you or anyone you know upgraded or is planning to, please consider donating the used one to the project. 
  • Bloggers & Writers Making a Difference 
  • Volunteer - With just a few hours a week or 30-60 minutes a day, you can help and you can be anywhere

 

The Story:

In December 2012, I visited eKhaya eKasi, an art and education centre in Khayelitsha, a township outside Cape Town, South Africa. I learned of the many issues women are faced with. HIV/AIDS is an epidemic; unemployment is high as is domestic abuse and alcoholism. For many, education does not advance beyond the grade 9 level and there is very little social assistance available. Women are raising their children alone. Grandmothers are raising their children’s children. 

Unemployment rates are 80% and most live on a few dollars a day or less. 

Many still live in makeshift buildings without electricity or water. 

Women are the heart of their families and communities and I believe it is the Heart of a Woman that will persevere, inspire and empower other women in their communities and elsewhere. 

The model of education and empowerment through the arts inspired me and I came up with an idea of how to help using mobile photography. 

the view from the rooftop of eKhaya eKasi - December 10, 2012


The Pilot Project - heART South Africa

To educate unemployed mothers and young women (15 years+) of eKhaya eKasi, in mobile photography to empower and to fight poverty by creating a small business and sustainable income through the sales of photographic art products in the on-site art boutique.  

Workshop Date: November 15 - November 29, 2013

Location: eKhaya eKasi Art & Education Centre, Khayelitsha, South Africa. 

eKhaya eKasi is an Art & Education Center that works to benefit the Khayelitsha community through a programs that target illiteracy, unemployment, poverty, the AIDS epidemic and lack of social services.  eKhaya eKasi is the perfect model to pilot this project as it is already established in the community and serves over 400 women, children and men and welcomes tourists from around the world. 

As a woman and mother, the visit to eKhaya eKasi and Khayelitsha spoke to me. They are mothers just like I am and all they want is what I want for my children, to be happy and healthy and to have a better life than the life we have. 

As a daughter and granddaughter of immigrants from a developing country, Myanmar (Burma), I know how easily it could be me, it could be my children. 


eKhaya eKasi Art & Education Centre - December 10, 2012

As a professional photographer and small business entrepreneur of 10 years in Toronto, Canada, I will bring my experience and knowledge in photography, mobile photography, social media and small business for photography. 

What the Participants Will Learn during the Workshop

  • mobile technology and mobile photography 
  • photography fundamentals with a focus on lighting and composition
  • how to select, edit and prepare images for print as photographic art products
  • social media and small business for photography

Goal: Each participant will have 200 art cards produced from 1 image to be available for sale in the on-site boutique at eKhaya eKasi by the end of the workshop and through distribution in the Tourism and Fair Trade industry. If ONE tourist buys ONE art card, it can feed a family that day. What is only a few dollars to us in the developed world... a Starbucks latte, goes a much longer way in developing communities


What Will Your Donation Buy? 

  • mobile devices for participants should we not receive enough used iPhone 4/4s/5 donations
  • transportation to/from Cape Town so that they may participant in a hands on photo walk for 2 days as Khayelitsha is not safe for a group of our size
  • lunch during the workshop and photo walks
  • tour bus fees
  • production of photographic art products
  • produce perks, Indiegogo, Paypal fees
  • marketing and printed materials
  • accessories such as mobile chargers and cases
  • administration & start up costs such as producing products and sample products
  • transportation or petrol for offsite trips (printer, distribution, internet cafe)
  • internet service and portable wifi unit 
  • internet cafe to upload images to central site
  • a laptop to store the images until they can be uploaded to a cloud facility to prevent image loss and for volunteers to edit and produce products abroad. 


How it could make an Impact:

  • Empowers 
  • Gives women a voice and a creative outlet
  • Allows a real perspective of a woman in a developing community
  • Offers skills in mobile technology, photography, internet, small business and social media 
  • Creates sustainable income
  • Supports the community and eKhaya eKasi 
  • Opportunity to teach other women
  • Inspires
  • Raises awareness
  • Creates change and makes a difference 


Volunteer Program at eKhaya eKasi & From Home

At eKhaya eKasi: We hope to set up a volunteer program for photographers, mobile photographers and social media enthusiasts. It would be ideal for locals and travelers, especially for my fellow photographers and bloggers. Anyone that has experience in these areas (don't have to be a pro) can help and make a difference. From Home: We need help with social media and marketing and after implementation, editing images, marketing. 


We believe in the Ubuntu, a beautiful word in the Xhosa language that in summary means "I am because we are". It is a philosophy I learned while in South Africa that speaks of the interconnectedness, caring, love, community, humanity and compassion of all people. 

No matter where you come from, we are one world, one people and we should strive to help those less fortunate in our own communities and in communities around the world. 

                                    Compassion should not have a border


MEDIA:

We are garnering media attention with more interviews being released imminently. 

  • Jaunted, a division of Conde Nast: How You Can Use Your Camera Phone to Empower South African Women Photographers
  • Brampton Guardian: Brampton women’s initiative for South African women is all heart
  • Cape Argus | Weekend Argus Sunday Edition (Cape Town, South Africa) PDF : Cellphone snaps to put women’s income in focus
  • Metro News, Toronto Edition PDF: Change Agents, Andrea Rees: Focused Volunteer 
  • City Sightseeing South Africa Blog (Cape Town, South Africa): City Sightseeing and The heART of a Woman Project
  • Matador Network: Top 10+ MatadorU Student Accomplishments for 2013 
  • Marie Claire Brazil: The Heart of a Woman: fotógrafa cria projeto que usa fotos de celular para ajudar mulheres carentes na África   (The Heart of a Woman: photographer creates project that uses photos from phone to help poor women in Africa)
The heART of a Woman Project is committed to providing education, guidance and support in mobile photography and small business for photography, not just during the workshop and time in Cape Town, but following the workshop to ensure success of the project. 



                Thank you for taking the time to learn about our project, Ubuntu!

          

If you have questions, at any time, please do not hesitate to contact us.
story_txt:
January 6, 2014 - The heART of a Woman Project was implemented Nov.15-30, 2013 and was a success! Take a look at the postcards that were created during the workshop and are now selling in the on-site boutique. Each participant received 200 postcards. The postcards and prints are now available online. 
October 22, 2013: Thank you everyone for your donations from the bottom of my heart and on behalf of the women at eKhaya eKasi. 
If you have found this page and would like to get involved we still need donations, used iPhones and volunteers, please visit us at
The heART of a Woman Project


How You Can Help:

Spread the word, connect with us on Twitter or Facebook
Donate  
Corporate Sponsorship

Used iPhone donations. If you or anyone you know upgraded or is planning to, please consider donating the used one to the project. 


Bloggers & Writers Making a Difference 


Volunteer - With just a few hours a week or 30-60 minutes a day, you can help and you can be anywhere




 


The Story:
In December 2012, I visited eKhaya eKasi, an art and education centre in Khayelitsha, a township outside Cape Town, South Africa. I learned of the many issues women
are faced with. HIV/AIDS is an epidemic; unemployment is high as is domestic
abuse and alcoholism. For many, education does not advance beyond the grade 9
level and there is very little social assistance available. Women are raising their children alone. Grandmothers
are raising their children’s children. 
Unemployment rates are 80% and most live on a few dollars a day or less. 
Many still live in makeshift
buildings without electricity or water. 
Women are the heart of their families and communities and I believe it is the Heart of a Woman that will persevere, inspire and empower other women in their communities and elsewhere. 
The model of education and empowerment through the arts inspired me and I came up with an idea of how to help using mobile photography. 


the view from the rooftop of eKhaya eKasi - December 10, 2012





The Pilot Project - heART South Africa
To educate unemployed mothers and young women (15 years+) of eKhaya eKasi, in mobile photography to empower and to fight poverty by creating a small business and sustainable income through the sales of photographic art products in the on-site art boutique.  
Workshop Date: November 15 - November 29, 2013


Location: eKhaya eKasi Art & Education Centre, Khayelitsha, South Africa. 

eKhaya eKasi is an Art & Education Center that works to benefit the Khayelitsha community through a programs that target illiteracy, unemployment, poverty, the AIDS epidemic and lack of social services.  eKhaya eKasi is the perfect model to pilot this project as it is already established in the community and serves over 400 women, children and men and welcomes tourists from around the world. 
As a woman and mother, the visit to eKhaya eKasi and Khayelitsha spoke to me. They are
mothers just like I am and all they want is what I want for my children,
to be happy and healthy and to have a better life than the life we have. 
As a daughter and granddaughter of immigrants from a developing country, Myanmar (Burma), I know how easily it could be me, it could be my children. 



eKhaya eKasi Art & Education Centre - December 10, 2012


As a professional photographer and small business entrepreneur of 10 years in Toronto, Canada, I will bring my experience and knowledge in photography, mobile photography, social media and small business for photography. 

What the Participants Will Learn during the Workshop

mobile technology and mobile photography 
photography fundamentals with a focus on lighting and composition
how to select, edit and prepare images for print as photographic art products
social media and small business for photography

Goal: Each participant will have 200 art cards produced from 1 image to be available for sale in the on-site boutique at eKhaya eKasi by the end of the workshop and through distribution in the Tourism and Fair Trade industry. If ONE tourist buys ONE art card, it can feed a family that day. What is only a few dollars to us in the developed world... a Starbucks latte, goes a much longer way in developing communities



What Will Your Donation Buy? 

mobile devices for participants should we not receive enough used iPhone 4/4s/5 donations
transportation to/from Cape Town so that they may participant in a hands on photo walk for 2 days as Khayelitsha is not safe for a group of our size
lunch during the workshop and photo walks
tour bus fees
production of photographic art products
produce perks, Indiegogo, Paypal fees
marketing and printed materials
accessories such as mobile chargers and cases
administration & start up costs such as producing products and sample products
transportation or petrol for offsite trips (printer, distribution, internet cafe)
internet service and portable wifi unit 
internet cafe to upload images to central site
a laptop to store the images until they can be uploaded to a cloud facility to prevent image loss and for volunteers to edit and produce products abroad. 



How it could make an Impact:

Empowers 
Gives women a voice and a creative outlet
Allows a real perspective of a woman in a developing community
Offers skills in mobile technology, photography, internet, small business and social media 
Creates sustainable income
Supports the community and eKhaya eKasi 
Opportunity to teach other women
Inspires
Raises awareness
Creates change and makes a difference 


Volunteer Program at eKhaya eKasi & From HomeAt eKhaya eKasi: We hope to set up a
volunteer program for photographers, mobile photographers and social media
enthusiasts. It would be ideal for locals and travelers, especially for my
fellow photographers and bloggers. Anyone that has experience in these areas
(don't have to be a pro) can help and make a difference. From Home: We need help with social media and marketing and
after implementation, editing images, marketing. 








We believe in the Ubuntu, a beautiful word in the Xhosa language that in summary means "I am because we are". It is a philosophy I learned while in South Africa that speaks of the interconnectedness, caring, love, community, humanity and compassion of all people. 
No matter where you come from, we are one world, one people and we should strive to help those less fortunate in our own communities and in communities around the world.

story:
On Apr 18th, 2009 two hackers who love to party came up with an idea. Broadcast all the awesome parties being thrown at defcon. Some of the most epic parties happen at Defcon, the problem is making sure everyone knows where to party. For FOUR YEARS we have been giving you the inside scoop on Defcon's HOTTEST parties, including secret access to even the most exclusive INVITE only ones. (Yeah, some people got a little pissed about that, but we just want to party!)

So finally the time has come, DEFCONPARTIES should host a PARTY.

The Defcon Organizers are organizing a DC21 PubCrawl and offering up party space to people who are willing to throw a party. The stars have aligned, and we want to throw a party, and YOU ARE INVITED.

(Read More at: http://www.defcon.org/html/defcon-21/dc-21-parties.html)

About us (@DefconParties):

  • We are not a company looking to sell you the latest Java app to protect you from APT XSS CYBERCYBERCYBER..  We are just a tight group of ~Random~ hackers that like to have a good time. When YOU have a good time, we are having a good time.  

  • We throw parties FOR THE USERS.

  • Because we are as small group of ~unfunded~ hackers, we need your help to make this amazing.

 

What We Need

We are not a Facebook funded, Everyone but you gets a cell phone, elitist party group. As such need to raise a small budget to provide a great party.  All funds raised here will go to making the party amazing. We need to raise a modest budget of $1500 in order to make this a success.  The funds will be used for:

  1. Mind blowing music. We are in talks with a well known Mashup Artist. Most of the funds that we are raising will be going to pay for his fee and travel expenses. All funds raised will be used on the party.  So keep showing your support!

  2. Smoke machines, DJ lights, and freaking laser beams.

  3. Amazing people.  This is where you come in.  We need your help raising enough to throw the party, but what we really want is for you to come out and enjoy it!  This party is for YOU.  Yes YOU, the one reading this right now.  Meet some people and bring them out.  Come meet some more interesting people.

story:
Who We are and What We Do

White Chocolate Razz Jazz Jam (Premium white chocolate and raspberry)

Blueberry Pear Fusion Jam (Early Blues blueberries and Barlett pears)

Mango Tango Jam (Mango, pineapple and strawberry)

Bubbly Be-Bop Strawberry Jam (Fresh strawberries and champagne)

DJ Mix is the result of what can happen when two good friends (Donna and Jane), who once made jam alone in their kitchens, realized how much fun it is to make jam as a duo. For two summers we created day-long excursions around our area of New England to find the best sources of local fruit. We spent hours in fields and orchards hand-picking, and then a long evening cleaning and processing the fruit so that we could cook jam all the next day, using the traditional recipes we had gathered throughout the years. This is our idea of an ideal summer vacation. 

By the second summer we got hooked on trying unique combinations of fruits. We have spent many sultry July and August days bent over the steaming kettle on the stove, breathing in, and oohing and aahing over, the aromas of mixes of raspberries and peaches, strawberries and kiwis, blueberries and pears. We have always kept it simple; fresh fruits, sugar, and fruit pectin. Then we tried adding some simple touches to a batch here and there, like bananas with toasted walnuts, some spices, some liquors. By autumn we had so many jars of jam they were flowing like glass rivers through both of our houses. But we still had more concoctions to try. We gave them away as gifts, and then made more. We got many requests for more jams, and we still couldn't stop making more. That's when we decided it was time to start selling.

Seven months later we are cooking our jams in a local commercial kitchen, (thanks, Ebenezer's!) selling at the local farmer's market, and fulfilling a number of custom orders. It has been quite a process and learning experience to get this far, and we can't wait to keep going! We would like to continue to "spread" the jam-love to a wider audience. Our next goal is to get our jams into local specialty food stores and markets, and to be able to sell them online. 

What We Need & What You Get

The process of getting a specialty food product into the marketplace is slow, grueling, and expensive. We are really passionate to move forward, but we have whittled down to the last of our savings to get this far, and are hoping that there are good folks out there, like you, who are kind enough to support us in our endeavors.

Here is the breakdown of our needs for the licensing process (which will allow us to sell at wholesale) and our first 60-gallon batch of our top 6 jam flavors to deliver to stores throughout Massachusetts. We will also be offering our jams online when we reach this critical point.

• Fruit, pectin and other ingredients — $1500

• Jars and lids — $500

• Labels — $800

• Product testing at Cornell plus nutrition analysis — $1100

• UPC codes — $800

• Application fee for licensing — $300

• Marketing, printing (sell sheets, etc.), shipping — $200

To show our heartfelt thanks for your generous support we would like to “jam” for you! With a thoughtful donation of $25 we will create a special “limited edition” jam that we guarantee you won't be able to find in any store. We will divulge the flavor at a later date, as we're continuing to run test batches in search of a combination that will get your feet tappin' and your taste buds singin'! And, since we're true New Englanders, we'll make it with the fresh fruits and flavors of the fall season.

The Impact

We really want to spread the jam love around, but even as we slowly grow, there are certain things about DJ Mix that you can count on:

• We will continue supporting our local farmers in New England

• We will never use anything but fresh, natural ingredients (no preservatives or artificial ingredients, ever!)

• Even as we expand (we are optimistic) we will continue to work in small batches so that we have full control over quality

• We will continue to infuse our passion, creativity, love and laughter into our products

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and that's OK. However, you can still help us out immensely if you “tune” other people in to our cause. We would be so grateful!!

story:
My friend Lisa Meyers was at the hospital watching over her son, and while she was away her home was broken into and her T.V. stolen.  Her son has recovered, but with all the bills she cannot replace a luxury item like a television.  I want to replace what she lost so her life can return to normal.

Initial funding will go to the purchase of a new television.  Delivery costs will be paid by me out of pocket.  All extra money will go to Lisa to pay for new locks and help with medical bills.

Initial funding will go to the purchase of a new television.  Delivery costs will be paid by me out of pocket.  All extra money will go to Lisa to pay for new locks and help with medical bills.

story:
My Story

In the first week of September, I’ll start the 36-hour journey from Oakland, CA to Eastern India for a four-month fellowship with Kiva.org.

Kiva is micro-financing nonprofit whose mission is to alleviate extreme poverty through connecting entrepreneurs and others living in need to basic financial services that are often out of their reach. Kiva's most common method of making this conneciton is through working with and strengthening local nonprofit banks and micro-lenders that already have a presence in these communites. 

During my fellowship, I’ll be spending two months in the state of Manipur working with Kiva’s partner WSDS Initiate, which specifically serves women from some of the most vulnerable populations in the region. Following that, I will spend two months in the state of Odisha. There, I will be splitting my time between two similarly minded organizations, People's Forum and Mahashakti Foundation. 

100% of every dollar you lend on Kiva goes directly to funding loans. Therefore, much of Kiva's work is dependent on their volunteers and fellows, like me. While in India, I will be Kiva's strongest connection to these three India-based partners and the borrowers they serve. The majority of my work will be devoted to helping these organizations streamline their operations in order to transition out of their one-year pilot phase of working with Kiva into full-fledge partners.

The Kiva Fellows Program

In the words of Kiva, “the Kiva Fellowship is an unpaid, volunteer position designed to increase Kiva's impact and to offer participants a unique insider experience to the world of microfinance”. The work of Kiva Fellows is extremely important to Kiva as an organization. Kiva has grown to work with over 160 microfinance partners in over 60 countries, making it difficult for Kiva to be in constant contact with all of them. After a partner's initial onboarding, Kiva Fellows are the strongest connection between Kiva and its partners.

If you want to know more about how microfinance works, check out this video from Kiva.

About Me

I was born and raised in Michigan about 10 miles outside of Detroit. Living in this area made me passionate about finding more responsible methods for urban and general economic development. To this end, I studied Public Policy in college with a concentration in Urban Development, and took time off my third year to travel and see how different cities and regions interact around the globe.

After graduating, I spent a year with AmeriCorps, serving at a nonprofit in the Bay Area that supports small business owners and evaluates public and private policies that drive more capital into low-income communities. I am looking forward to applying the skills I've developed domestically to help support and enhance my understanding of the programs working to alliveate extreme poverty in Eastern India. Furthermore, I could not be more thrilled to be working for organizations that specifically target underserved women.

How You Can Help

After speaking to past fellows and others who have lived in the region, I've budgeted that the four months in India will cost about $4,400. This includes airfare, visas, accommodation, food, immunizations, and transportation to visit borrowers, among other costs.

The AmeriCorps program I've just completed is not designed to leave its participants with a significant savings and as such, I have limited finances to support myself during the Kiva Fellowship. However, I believe the experience I will gain is worth a significant investment on my part. For this reason, I will be using my savings to purchase my first plane ticket and the necessary vaccinations before I go. However, I am not able to pay for the rest of the program without your help. Any contributions to this page over the fundraising goal, if not used for emergency or unseen expenses in the field, will be donated back to Kiva.

If you cannot support me financially, you can also help by spreading the word of my campaign. Liking this page or tweeting or emailing the link to your networks will make a major difference. The visibility of my Indiegogo campaign is directly related to the amount of activity my page receives.

I am thrilled to be joining Kiva’s 22nd fellowship class. I greatly appreciate your support. Thank you!

story:
Website Enhancement

We just launched our website "embryo" at http://www.prosperousindonesia.com on April 20th, 2013. The website still needs a lot of enhancement to become more attractive. The followings are some of the features that will be added to the website:

  • Photos and images of various objects.
  • Videos on various subjects and objects.
  • Other enhancement.
Your contribution will greatly help making this website more attractive to visitors.

About The Website

The website will become our main media to raise fund that will be utilized to transform poor people in Indonesia into new prosperous communities. We believe that we have found a new breakthrough that will enable us to achieve prosperous Indonesia by transforming those poor people into new prosperous communities. More details about the breakthrough can be found in our website at http://www.prosperousindonesia.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are some other ways you can help us:

  • Visit our website at http://www.prosperousindonesia.com.
  • Spread the words about the new breakthrough.
  • Buy our stickers through our website.
  • Do volunteer jobs for us when it is available at our website.

Other enhancement.

story:
UPDATE:  Illness and injury have set me back a bit over the last few weeks, and we are obviously quite far from goal.  I intend to give this another shot in a month or two.


I began working in retail in 2000, I’ve been a clerk, cashier, lead, buyer, assistant manager, and I’ve aided in business expansion.  Retail suits me well, not just because I enjoy tedious tasks and organization, but because I love interacting with people.  A lot of consumers just do their thing; they browse/buy and go about their day.  But some customers share themselves.  I get to hear about new jobs, new love, performances and hobbies, sadness and frustration.  It’s really amazing how many lives you connect with over a new shirt and a cash register.

This brings me to what I don’t like about retail: Size Segregation.  The vast majority of boutiques are size specific, some cater to “standard” sizing (Extra Small- Large/Extra Large) and some cater to “plus” sizing (1XL+).  They may carry one or two options just outside their normal size range, but there are nearly no boutiques that offer women of all sizes a choice to shop indiscriminately.  This, to me, is absurd.  Women come in all sorts of shapes and sizes, so it stands to reason that all women are Woman Sized, and should therefore be able to find clothing that fits (and looks good!) wherever they choose to shop.

This isn’t just about fashion; it’s about self-esteem and self-love.  Close your eyes and imagine a world where we aren’t obsessed with our bodies, where we see the beauty in ourselves and each other. Size segregation needs to become a thing of the past, and that change can start here with the support and encouragement of people like you.  Audacious Boutique is going to be a female focused, alternative fashion boutique, exclusively carrying sizes XS-4XL, with special orders available for customers who require a more expansive size range.  Every purchase comes with a high-five, hug, or both!

When you contribute to Audacious Boutique you’re contributing to the belief that all women are beautiful.  You’re offering women new opportunities to love the body they inhabit.  Every day I hear self-shaming statements fall out of the mouths of women who don’t see how truly amazing they are.  I can see the defeat in their eyes when that gorgeous dress or those jeans you've been coveting don’t quite fit.  That look breaks my heart every time.  Your contribution will help transform these looks of self-loathing into looks of confidence and empowerment.

Along with adding smiles to the faces of beautiful women (and the people who love them), your contribution will also provide at least one additional person with a job, ‘cause I’m going to need help!  Audacious will also offer products on consignment so you’ll be helping local creators and artists with opportunities to sell their work. 

My goal is to open the store with as little debt as possible so that I will be able to focus on the growth of the business and put revenue back into the boutique rather than giving it back to a bank.  Funding from this campaign can assist me with that goal as contributions will be used toward rental/leasing fees, painting/flooring/etc. (if needed), store furnishings, merchandise, and ad space.  It will also allow me to hire folks to assist me with getting things all set up.  Yay for jobs!

If the support of you lovely people results in more funding than I’ve sought out, I will donate 25% of the additional funds to Dress for Success, which is an organization that empowers underprivileged women by providing them with clothing, teaching them job skills, and helping them find and maintain employment.  I’ll put the rest back into the business.  As someone who is currently working two part-time retail jobs, I understand how difficult it can be to get by on varying hours and minimum wage.  I intend to offer those I employ a wage that would satisfy me as an employee, rather than the lowest wage required by law.  I want to show my appreciation for the future Audacious Boutique family, and additional funds would go a long way with bonuses, paid time off and possibly insurance that includes alternative health care.

Any and all contributions are so incredibly appreciated.  There are a variety of perks available; some are similar because I wanted to offer options.  They’re named after terms that could be used to describe various women in a positive light.  They involve thanks, high-fives, buttons, stickers, shirts, immortality (in the form of your name or favorite quote posted in the store).  For folks living in Portland, Oregon (or who like to visit) there are also discounts, a store mannequin could be molded after your body, and there will be an exclusive grand opening party where you can be one of the first to shop with a discount!

If you’d like to contribute in other ways please feel free to:
  -Spread the word!  If you care, share!
  -‘Like’ Audacious Boutique PDX on Facebook.
  -Let me put my campaign info cards on your business community board.
  -Words of encouragement and support are always appreciated!
  -Give someone a hug and tell them how amazing they are.

This is an opportunity to help change the way women view themselves.  So much of our society is focused on conditioning us to feel that no matter what we do we simply aren’t good enough.  But we are!  We are all so beautiful, and this is a chance to help remind people that our worth should not be based on our size.  This is an opportunity to promote love.

Thank you so much for taking a moment to visit my campaign.  I appreciate your consideration!  If you have any questions about this endeavor please don’t hesitate to ask.  My name is Ajé and I welcome your inquiries and feedback.

story:
True Fashion should include and Represent Everyone!

Please Support My Own Fashion Modelling Agency and fashion PR team promoting models all shapes, sizes and ages.

My Own Fashion is raising funds to enable them to create an agency for all women and men to have the opportunity to become professional models and fashion icons. With a little support from you, this dream and ambition will become a reality no matter their age, shape, size, disability or background. This is true fashion, bringing the beauty out in everyone it touches. Support and promote us and make this long standing dream finally become a reality.

At My Own Fashion and the team believe that true beauty is from within, and the external self, with the right attention is its own individual expression of beauty and art. Social and casting sterio types have taken away the true beauty and expression of individuality. My Own Fashion will become world leaders in portraying individual self expressive beauty. Our photographers, beauticians, fashion executives and designers will be leaders in developing the art of self expression and poise with complete individuality infused in every picture.

Our marketing directives will also ensure that we will both create and sustain high levels of artistic brilliance to ensure the best opportunities come to all our models, no matter what, shape, size or age. We want your support to take this to the next level.

Our Campaign is this simple:

Support us, support taking all prejudice out of beauty.

Please message me if you require anything further.

Check out our great perks and remember you have 10X chances of winning the Executive Package Worth £500.00 for donating as little as a £1.

story:
What it's all about

For Wilderness Festival this year, EcoHouse Initiative are designing and building a series of lily pads for the swimming and boating lakes. The pads are a base for creative idea-generating workshops on sustainable low-resource housing solutions.

The aim is to cover 2 giant lily pads with miniature houses built by festival goers, exploring the ideas of sustainable development. Over the course of the weekend the lilies will become LILYPUT, a miniature city, walked on by giants!

An additional lily pad will be used for relaxation and conversation, and as a life raft for swimmers with less buoyancy than others!

The aim is to raise awareness of the charity, and generate donations which will directly fund housing projects and research in South America.  Indeed at the very time of the festival, 11 EcoHouse volunteers will be in Ecuador and Brazil, working with local communities and NGOs for 8 weeks, honing the designs for low-cost sustainable housing in urban slums, and building their exemplar designs for families chosen by their partner NGO Techo.

Whilst the festival is going on, the EcoHouse team will be working on the front-line - putting your monetary contributions to good use.

NB all volunteers working abroad cover their own expenses. Money given to the charity is used to directly fund building work and research taking place within the South American communities. 


The Team

ECOHOUSE INITIATIVE:

The team represent the student body of EcoHouse Initiative, based at the University of Cambridge. Their work in South America empowers poverty stricken urban communities to improve their housing situations, but providing technical solutions to combat the degradation of housing. To realise this they develop and build low cost transitional and permanent housing along with a partner NGO, Techo. As well as housing design, another focus of their research is information systems, with the aim of transferring knowledge, educational resources and services through the use of appropriate technology to the developing world.

What We Need Funded...

We're fundraising for materials to build the lily pads - used to promote the work of EcoHouse Initiative and to fundraise (i.e. the money you give will help us fundraise larger amounts at Wilderness Festival , thereby multiplying your donation):

MATERIALS

  • Reclaimed plywood
  • Reclaimed timber battening
  • Resin
  • Bolts

TRANSPORT

  • Collection of materials
  • Delivery of the lily pads to site


Our Input...

DESIGN EXPERTISE 

  • Hours of design - achieving a resource-efficient modular design.
  • Calculations done for free by a naval engineer - an expert in boat-building.
  • Advice given by several structural and civil engineers.

WORKSHOPS

  • Blood, sweat and tears.
  • Workshop space given free by Makerversity, Somerset House, London.
  • Hours of design and build time by tireless volunteers.

ON SITE

  • Blood, sweat and tears.
  • More volunteers running interactive model-making workshops.
  • Lots of splashing around in 'Lake Superior'!!


What You Get

And you get, a warm fuzzy feeling ;) and the knowledge that your money is going to help us raise more money, all of which will go directly to current projects in Quito (Ecuador), and Sao Paulo (Brazil).

And if you're at the festival please come chill on a lily pad / help build LILYPUT...!


MANY THANKS   from all of the EcoHouse Initiative volunteers.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Anne-Marie, I have worked with the most excluded children and families for 15 years. My first job was at primary school unit for excluded children, the youngest was six. These incredibly traumatised children never went back to mainstream school, they were routinely restrained by adults sitting on their chests and pinning their arms down.  This experience never left me and has determined my choice of work from that point on. Since then I have worked with vulnerable children, teens and their families, including those in the youth justice system, gang affiliated, children in care, children excluded from school and children in prisons.
  • I am experienced in gaining funding and building income for other charities but I haven't found one that is entirely youth led and that has the elements that the many disadvantaged young people across the country I have engaged with, have said they need.
  • I want to be able to re-connect with the young people I have worked with around England and encourage them to build this charity with me; who we will work with, what we will do; who will work with us. I will be advocating a peer led and experience led approach to the work, thereby also creating job opportunities, training and development  for those who have faced adversity in their lives.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am trying to raise £500 to start us off in engaging the young people, running focus groups, and starting the website so that I can demonstrate need (direct from the horses mouth!) for other bigger funders.
  • We will start a website, blog and twitter to keep everyone in touch with our progress and developments.
  • We will be based upon a caring, empathic and Peer Led ethos, meaning those with experience of an issue are able to support those going through an issue eg those in care, with experience of care and so on
  • We will link to high profile supporters to gain and build as much publicity/events as possible to develop the charity
  • Nothing is Impossible!

The Impact

  • Your money will support the engagement of some of the hardest to reach children and young people in the country... THEY know the answers to breaking their own cycles, they need support to do this.
  • I have a strong track record of building and developing charity projects with vulnerable children in local areas and nationally, with a high profile contact list.
  • We will support young people in having their voices heard at the highest levels, local government, parliament etc
  • See my Linkedin Profile Anne-Marie Douglas and Twitter followers @annemdouglas for more details

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help spread the word by sharing and encouraging others to support
  • Please offer any support you can via skillshares etc
  • Also looking for high profile patrons to support the charity and launch

Thank you, there are the dreamers and there are the doers, please help me be a doer!

story:
Our Situation and Why We Need You

We have a tremendous idea...and a sticky situation. Starting in January of 2015, our FirstHand team will be working and taking a special class in Cincinnati, which is home to one the fastest growing entrepreneurial communities in the country. This is the prize for winning at Miami University's Startup Weekend in October of 2014. When we are in Cincinnati, we will have access to the best experts and mentors in the Midwest...but not to funding.

Our crowd funding efforts are important here because we need the initial capital to get this operation up and running. We want to have a functioning business already running and then ask professional investors for their capital (in order to take FirstHand to the next level) instead of asking for their money to test an idea. We want to test this idea with crowd funding while we have Cincinnati's entrepreneurial community as a consulting resource. So how did we get here and how will we test our idea? Check it out!

 

Our Story and What FirstHand is All About

When we (Tom and Christian) interned this summer in San Francisco, we traveled a lot and were fortunate to have a few friends in the city take us around. They showed us cool places to go shopping, Mom 'N Pop delis with delicious sandwiches, lively public parks, and even told us funny personal stories. They brought us into their world. It was an incredible experience! We didn't stick out. We didn't feel an ounce of anxiety. 

We felt like we had lived there for years...like locals. 

 

                        

 

 

 

We want to make that same experience possible for you... anytime...anywhere, whether you know friends in a city or not. We want to build a service that allows a traveler at any time to take out their phone, pick their local, pick the places they want to go and the activities they want to do, and then meet their local minutes later and do those things!

Through hard work and determination, two Midwestern guys like us built FirstHand from an idea we had while walking around San Francisco into a business model and a team! We took the idea to Miami University's Startup Weekend in October of 2014. While there, we met four more talented and motivated students who believe in FirstHand and want to make it a reality! Now, the FirstHand team is up to six! After about 60 hours of intense work, the creation of a business model, and a formal pitch to successful entrepreneurs and venture capitalists, FirstHand triumphed at Startup Weekend! 

 

How We Will Test It

The video above represents the long-term vision for FirstHand. But in order to build it up to that point, we need to start small and be wise with the limited resources we have. The best way to do this is to solve a problem our team is familiar with: university tours. 

Parents and students are basing the decision for their child's university partly on their impression from official tours. As students ourselves, we can tell you these tours are deceptive (Disneyland versions of universities) and can potentially lead families and students to make the wrong choice of college, have their child be miserable at a school, and waste thousands of dollars. 

In the first few months, we want to make a website that can process payments, we want to recruit college students at select universities, and we want to reach out to families of high school seniors. We will register the college students on our website and will allow the families to choose their own personal student guide who will show them around campus and give these families the real scoop on the university, both positive and negative. Families will be able to filter their guide based on their child's interests. For example, if their child is interested in Greek life and majoring in marketing, they will be able to filter through potential guides to find a marketing major who is also a member of a Greek organization. 

Payments will be made in advance of the tour and processed through the website. We can achieve this within the next few months and begin operations. With good results, we will be able to confidently go in front of investors with a proven model and pitch the next step: the mobile app, big city neighborhoods, and on-demand city locals. 

Your Impact

Contributors will help us develop a website with a clean user interface and payment processing capabilities. We want to do this right the first time, and you can help us! 

From our own experiences and our research, we know that people want authenticity. People want what's real. People want to be able to customize experiences to get the most for their money. With our long-term vision, you will be able to experience new places in a much deeper and more authentic way. 

With what FirstHand can become, you will no longer have to book pre-set tours and be limited to their schedules. You will no longer have to be stuck with a guide you don't care for. You will no longer have to suffer through an entire tour when you don't want to.

FirstHand will be an on-demand service--customizable and personal. It's an incredible tool to connect the world, break down cultural barriers, and make traveling less stressful! 

 
 

What We Need

We need $25,000 in funding. We can get a website created for $10,000, and the rest we will use for advertising, promotion, and for unexpected roadblocks. Funding also goes toward robust background checks on the college students. We will do everything we can to ensure our customers are safe. Our biggest challenge is simply time. We are in a race against time...chasing our dream. We have a small window to accomplish our goal. But we can do it with your help!

If we don't reach the funding goal, whatever we do raise will go first into making the website, and whatever is left will, again, be put into background checks and marketing. We will get as far as possible! We're working extremely hard to make this happen, and we love it! Nothing will be wasted. What matters most to us is making a great service that people will love. 

 
 

About the Founders

 

 

    I'm Tom Ibold, a co-founder of FirstHand. I am a senior at Miami University studying Supply Chain Management and Information Systems. I am very extroverted, love to travel, and enjoy meeting new people from all walks of life. Some of my biggest passions revolve around emerging technology and startup companies. 

    https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=136967...

    Thanks for the support!

    * We would like to thank Entrepreneur, John Altman, for giving us the opportunity to live and work in Silicon Valley this past summer. Without your generosity, none of this would be possible. Thank you for changing our lives. 

     - Tom and Christian
story_txt:
Our Situation and Why We Need You
We have a tremendous idea...and a sticky situation. Starting in January of 2015, our FirstHand team will be working and taking a special class in Cincinnati, which is home to one the fastest growing entrepreneurial communities in the country. This is the prize for winning at Miami University's Startup Weekend in October of 2014. When we are in Cincinnati, we will have access to the best experts and mentors in the Midwest...but not to funding.
Our crowd funding efforts are important here because we need the initial capital to get this operation up and running. We want to have a functioning business already running and then ask professional investors for their capital (in order to take FirstHand to the next level) instead of asking for their money to test an idea. We want to test this idea with crowd funding while we have Cincinnati's entrepreneurial community as a consulting resource. So how did we get here and how will we test our idea? Check it out!
 
Our Story and What FirstHand is All About
When we (Tom and Christian) interned this summer in San Francisco, we traveled a lot and were fortunate to have a few friends in the city take us around. They showed us cool places to go shopping, Mom 'N Pop delis with delicious sandwiches, lively public parks, and even told us funny personal stories. They brought us into their world. It was an incredible experience! We didn't stick out. We didn't feel an ounce of anxiety. 
We felt like we had lived there for years...like locals. 
 
                        
   
We want to make that same experience possible for you... anytime...anywhere, whether you know friends in a city or not. We want to build a service that allows a traveler at any time to take out their phone, pick their local, pick the places they want to go and the activities they want to do, and then meet their local minutes later and do those things!
Through hard work and determination, two Midwestern guys like us built FirstHand from an idea we had while walking around San Francisco into a business model and a team! We took the idea to Miami University's Startup Weekend in October of 2014. While there, we met four more talented and motivated students who believe in FirstHand and want to make it a reality! Now, the FirstHand team is up to six! After about 60 hours of intense work, the creation of a business model, and a formal pitch to successful entrepreneurs and venture capitalists, FirstHand triumphed at Startup Weekend! 
 
How We Will Test It
The video above represents the long-term vision for FirstHand. But in order to build it up to that point, we need to start small and be wise with the limited resources we have. The best way to do this is to solve a problem our team is familiar with: university tours. 
Parents and students are basing the decision for their child's university partly on their impression from official tours. As students ourselves, we can tell you these tours are deceptive (Disneyland versions of universities) and can potentially lead families and students to make the wrong choice of college, have their child be miserable at a school, and waste thousands of dollars. 
In the first few months, we want to make a website that can process payments, we want to recruit college students at select universities, and we want to reach out to families of high school seniors. We will register the college students on our website and will allow the families to choose their own personal student guide who will show them around campus and give these families the real scoop on the university, both positive and negative. Families will be able to filter their guide based on their child's interests. For example, if their child is interested in Greek life and majoring in marketing, they will be able to filter through potential guides to find a marketing major who is also a member of a Greek organization. 
Payments will be made in advance of the tour and processed through the website. We can achieve this within the next few months and begin operations. With good results, we will be able to confidently go in front of investors with a proven model and pitch the next step: the mobile app, big city neighborhoods, and on-demand city locals. 
Your Impact

Contributors will help us develop a website with a clean user interface and payment processing capabilities. We want to do this right the first time, and you can help us! 
From our own experiences and our research, we know that people want authenticity. People want what's real. People want to be able to customize experiences to get the most for their money. With our long-term vision, you will be able to experience new places in a much deeper and more authentic way. 
With what FirstHand can become, you will no longer have to book pre-set tours and be limited to their schedules. You will no longer have to be stuck with a guide you don't care for. You will no longer have to suffer through an entire tour when you don't want to.
FirstHand will be an on-demand service--customizable and personal. It's an incredible tool to connect the world, break down cultural barriers, and make traveling less stressful! 
  What We NeedWe need $25,000 in funding. We can get a website created for $10,000, and the rest we will use for advertising, promotion, and for unexpected roadblocks. Funding also goes toward robust background checks on the college students. We will do everything we can to ensure our customers are safe. Our biggest challenge is simply time. We are in a race against time...chasing our dream. We have a small window to accomplish our goal. But we can do it with your help!If we don't reach the funding goal, whatever we do raise will go first into making the website, and whatever is left will, again, be put into background checks and marketing. We will get as far as possible! We're working extremely hard to make this happen, and we love it! Nothing will be wasted. What matters most to us is making a great service that people will love.   
About the Founders
 
 
I'm Tom Ibold, a co-founder of FirstHand. I am a senior at Miami University studying Supply Chain Management and Information Systems. I am very extroverted, love to travel, and enjoy meeting new people from all walks of life. Some of my biggest passions revolve around emerging technology and startup companies. 
https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=136967...
Thanks for the support!
* We would like to thank Entrepreneur, John Altman, for giving us the opportunity to live and work in Silicon Valley this past summer. Without your generosity, none of this would be possible. Thank you for changing our lives. 
 - Tom and Christian

story:
Short Summary

What would it look like if you, your partner, your kids teacher, your co-workers, and your family members all became more emotionally healthy and happy? We know that when this happens, communities flourish and people will take better care of themselves, their loved ones, strangers, and our earth. 
Passion Provokers was formed in 2011 by founders Jami and Marla Keller, after spending 24 years working in the coaching field. From personal trials to professional success, they established a basic goal to give everyone 100% success: provide a coaching service that is short-term (a maximum of 12 months) for a lifetime of results. With their unique way of coaching, Passion Provokers has assisted over 1,000 couples and has empowered individuals and communities. 
We started this campaign because the need of our services is large, TOO MANY RELATIONSHIPS FAIL and the needs in our communities need your help. Since our process is time effective, we will be able to assist nearly double the people with the funding from this first phase of expansion. YOUR DONATION WILL SAVE A FAMILY! 

What We Need & What You Get

We will be launching three phases to this expansion cost, each asking for $18,500:

  • $18,500 will allow our team the flexibility to assist individuals, couples, and families in Idaho, Oregon, Washington, Utah, Nevada, California, and Arizona.
  • This dollar amount allows us to provide systems to the right professionals, who are focused on helping people in the Northwest expansion. 
  • 100% of your contribution will be used to pay this staffing expense. 

The Impact

No investment amount is too small (seriously, $1 is hugely significant and appreciated!) to help us in our efforts to create a happier, healthier, and more functional world. When you donate you are doing that same thing. Because our process is short-term, it is extremely cost-effective, and we are able to assist more people. 
  • Our clients tell us they get 10 years worth of standard counseling success when they work with us for just 10 sessions. 
  • We have helped change the lives of individuals, couples, and families with a simple process that is all-encompassing by teaching emotional health, sexual wellness, nutrition, and business coaching. 
  • Emotionally healthy people boost the economy by staying in healthy relationships, being better parents, working harder, are less likely to get ill, and are more selfless. 

Risks & Challenges 

  • That without help relationships will fail, leaving a path of relational destruction and children in split households.
  • The process used has recently been proven as a core component of healing and wholeness by the research of Brene Brown and Tara Bennett Goleman. While we can not guarantee results, we can guarantee the process works when it is followed as directed by our Coaches.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to invest, but believe in our cause, please share this campaign! On your e-mail, Facebook, and any other social media (use #ExpandPassion to link all of our posts).  

We only have 60 days to raise the money for this first phase, so if you share it once please consider sharing it several more times over the next couple months. 

Indiegogo has awesome and user-friendly share tools so you can post this on your personal social media (Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Linkedin, etc), or tell your family and friends about it. 

Also, if you read all of this, HIGH FIVE we love you! Thanks for your interest!

story:
We believe in good wine, good people and good work!

Partner with Sento Bene Wines in our launch and join us in making an impact in our global communities.


My Story and Why We Need Your Help

My name is Theresa “Tess” Gonnella, and I am the Founder & CEO of SENTO, Inc. SENTO combines my passion for wine, the heritage of Italy and philanthropy to bring a unique, cause-driven wine label to the U.S.

Mi Sento Bene means “I feel good” in Italian. My company’s mission is to empower people to give back and make a difference in the world, locally and globally, through the enjoyment of wine. Honoring that same commitment, SENTO will donate 15% of the profits from every bottle of Sento Bene™ wine sold to worthwhile causes that empower women.

I was born and raised in Sonoma County, California’s beautiful wine country by a large Italian family who has owned and operated an Italian Restaurant since 1925. My interest in wine, travel and people were then further expanded after visiting my family roots in the Lombardy region of Italy as a young woman. From this experience, I vowed to always return and make my mark in the wine industry in a unique way.

Following college graduation, I pursued a successful sales career in the pharmaceutical and biotech industries for 15 years before honoring my promise to return to Italy in 2011. It was then that I began working for a winery in the Piedmont region, focusing my experience to lead a team to sell Italian wine in the U.S. market.

Through SENTO, my hope is to use my passion and love of wine to make a difference in the world while inspiring others to do the same.


What We Need Your Help to Fund

We have sourced the wine in Italy, formed the company, and developed the brand.  With your donation and support, we hope to launch the company by funding these critical programs:

  • Building our global website that supports our philanthropic partners
  • Marketing and social media programs to spread the word on the wine and how Sento Bene Wines give back with every bottle to worthy women’s causes
  • Social media contests that drive people like you to upload videos and share their own stories on how they give back to the world
  • A series of philanthropic launch events across the country to introduce the wine label to consumers, the media, philanthropic partners and wine distributors starting in June 2014


The Impact You’ll Make by Supporting Us

By supporting the launch of our Sente Bene wine brand, you will:

  • Empower women’s organizations that are dedicated to education and career advancement issues like Step Up
  • Help us to give in the future by kick starting our campaign of giving – when we sell wine in the future, 15% of every bottle sold will go directly to a philanthropic organization
  • Support a female entrepreneur launching a new brand that supports women’s issues, educates and inspires
  • Build a brand that will offer other cause-driven products in the future like bottled water that give back with every purchase


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the spare money to donate to any cause, so if you cannot donate, I am asking that you help in other ways:

  • Post our campaign on your Facebook and Twitter to share the word
  • Use Indiegogo’s share tools to inspire other folks to give what they can
  • Email, phone, skywriting and carrier pigeons are also appreciated… anything that will get the word out on the street about SENTO, Sento Bene Wines and the difference we hope to make : )


THANK YOU!!!


With your help, a little wine and some luck, we can make an impact on the lives of women and their families to make the world a better place!


Join us to Connect – Toast – Inspire!

story:
Fundación Sinergia       Fundación Alfombra Mágica                 Cell Digital S.A.S. 
    
                                        

          Giss Creativa                       Coinse Ltda.                    Alimentos Mandala

     
     Dektol Producciones                                       Andrés Rada


Spanish / English version

Mientras los niños y niñas beneficiarias del proyecto Cyclo Bicis se divierten y sonríen, desarrollan sus destrezas físicas incrementando su fuerza, agilidad y autoconfianza. ¡Tu contribución lo hace posible!

Queremos poner a rodar 100 Cyclo Bicis en barrios de recursos materiales limitados y pocos espacios de recreación para niños y niñas de Cali.

Vamos a fabricar y donar 100 Cyclo Bicis a los niños y niñas entre los 2 y los 5 años de edad de la ciudad de Cali, Colombia, cuyas familias son de escasos recursos. Queremos fomentar el uso de la bicicleta desde una edad temprana y estimular su desarrollo y aprendizaje a través del juego.

Esta comprobado cientificamente que el ejercicio físico posee efectos beneficiosos sobre la función cerebral, tales como promover la neuroplasticidad y aumentar el rendimiento del aprendizaje y la memoria, además de mejorar la interacción con otros y con el ambiente físico y social.

Para Cyclo, Innovación, Desarrollo y Aprendizaje la donación de estas 100 Cyclo Bicis tendrá un impacto en nuestro entorno inmediato que es Cali ya que desde los primeros años de vida estamos promoviendo el uso de la bicicleta como un sistema de transporte sustentable, alegre y saludable para todos.

Además de la actividad física y la sensación de libertad, las Cyclo Bicis ayudan a fortalecer las relaciones familiares. Queremos fortalecer a través del juego y la diversión, la unión familiar y el tejido social de las comunidades, acompañando el desarrollo y crecimiento de los niños y niñas beneficiarias.


Cuánto hemos avanzado hasta ahora con el proyecto Cyclo Bicis

Después de un proceso de investigación y experimentación que inició a principios del año 2013, invitamos a la familia, a los amigos y amigas para compartir sus habilidades y los fondos necesarios para la producción de las primeras 23 Cyclo Bicis: 8 se hicieron para nuestra familia Cyclo y las restantes se entregaron a 15 niños y niñas de diferentes barrios de las ciudades de Cali y Palmira, en el Valle del Cauca. Así que lo conseguimos!…hoy Cyclo es para nuestros hijos, hijas y otros niños y niñas de nuestra ciudad, una realidad!  



Mapa de Georeferenciación de los niños beneficiarios

Este mapa muestra la distribución de las 23 Cyclo Bicis entregadas hasta ahora.


Da click aqui Mapa de Georefenciacion, para ver el mapa completo.


Cómo funciona la entrega de las Cyclo Bicis

Cyclo, Innovación, Desarrollo y Aprendizaje junto con organizaciones comunitarias que trabajan por el bienestar de la primera infancia en diferentes sectores de limitados recursos de Cali, selecciona a los niños y niñas beneficiarios.

Estos niños y niñas tienen la posibilidad de quedarse con la bicicleta de aprendizaje hasta que hayan crecido lo suficiente o hasta que puedan montar una bicicleta con pedales. Las bicicletas regresan al proyecto, se les hace un mantenimiento y están listas para ser utilizadas nuevamente. Y así se inicia nuevamente el Ciclo.

Para acompañar a los niños, niñas y a sus familias en el proceso con las Cyclo Bicis, se organizan encuentros con regularidad. Estos encuentros son apoyados por profesionales voluntarios en educación física y salud, que ayudan con la organización de actividades lúdico recreativas y de integración.


Lo que necesitamos

Nuestra meta es fabricar 100 Cyclo Bicis y para ello necesitamos USD $22.000. Cada dólar que inviertes en la campaña estará destinado a las siguientes actividades:

Producción de las 100 Cyclo Bicis: Compra de todos los materiales, principalmente madera de alta calidad para asegurar su estabilidad y durabilidad; esto incluye la mano de obra, tanto la administrativa como la operativa.

Entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis: Las 100 Cyclo Bicis serán entregadas en un evento especial, en el que participan voluntarios recreacionistas, educadores físicos, fisioterapeutas, artistas y un staff de producción que ayudarán con la organización de actividades lúdico recreativas para los niños, niñas y sus acompañantes.

Diseño, elaboracion y envio de recompensas: las recompensas que recibes por contribuir con nuestra campaña incluyen postales, serigrafías y camisetas, cuyos diseños son elaborados exclusivamente para el logro de este sueño por artistas locales, que serán enviadas a cualquier lugar del mundo donde realices tu contribución. También realizaremos la producción de un videoclip de agradecimiento para nuestros patrocinados oficiales, especialmente el día del Evento oficial de entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis.

Producción gráfica y audiovisual de la campaña:  nuestra campaña también destinará un porcentaje muy bajo de sus recursos para sostener la producción gráfica y audiovisual requerida desde el inicio de la campaña hasta la entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis.

En que no invertiremos tu dinero: no invertiremos tu dinero en el pago de actividades como diseño gráfico,  fotografía, comunicaciones y manejo de redes sociales, diseño de piezas publicitarias, georeferenciación y traducción de textos a diferentes idiomas, ya que estas actividades son realizadas por voluntarios.


Lo que obtienes

La Campaña 100 Cyclo Bicis agradece tus contribuciones con recompensas especialmente diseñadas para ti; en la sección de Recompensas te explicamos, qué recibes a cambio de tu contribución. Gracias por apoyarnos.

 

                       

                       


Tres razones para donar:

  • Educación: fomenta la apropiación del espacio público y la movilidad sostenible
  • Ecológico: esta desarrollado con materiales amigables con el medio ambiente
  • Reutilizable: después del aprendizaje, las bicicletas son reparadas y donadas nuevamente.


Impactos

Impactos de primer nivel  . Niños y  niñas: El proyecto Cyclo beneficia directamente a 100 niños y niñas, entre los 2 y los 5 años de edad, ya que a través del uso continuo de las Cyclo Bicis desarrollan destrezas físicas y cognitivas que se reflejan en la pronta coordinación de sus movimientos y el equilibrio. Además se promueve la actividad física como un estilo de vida saludable desde temprana edad. 

Impactos de segundo nivel - Núcleo familiar de los niños y niñas: Los beneficiarios indirectos son el grupo familiar a los que pertenecen, ya que los cuidadores se ven involucrados en el uso de la Cyclo Bici y se convierten en participantes activos del proceso de crecimiento y aprendizaje. 

De esta forma Cyclo Bicis impacta positivamente en la familia del niño o la niña, permitiendo que los beneficios con el uso de la bicicleta de aprendizaje se sostenga en el tiempo. 

Impactos de tercer nivel - Población infantil de escasos recursos de la Ciudad de Cali: De otra parte, los niños y niñas con limitadas alternativas para educarse y divertirse, que viven en contextos de riesgo por drogas, violencia en las calles, trabajo forzado o pobreza. Cyclo Bicis propicia a través del juego, el crecimiento saludable de niños, niñas y la unidad familiar cuando sus tutores toman parte activa del aprendizaje.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes contribuir económicamente a la campaña, esto no significa que no puedas colaborar, puedes hacerlo de las siguientes formas:

  • Corre la voz a través del hashtag #100CycloBicis2014 en Facebook.
  • Suscribete a nuestro blog:www.cyclobicis.wordpress.com
  • Comparte nuestra FanPage de Facebook con tus redes sociales. https://www.facebook.com/pages/Cyclo-Innovaci%C3%B3n-Desarrollo-y-Aprendizaje/941789625836076
_____________________________________________________________________________

100 CYCLO BICIS AND THOUSANDS OF TENDER SMILES

    While boys and girls benefiting of the Project Cyclo Bicis have fun and smile, they develop their physical skills by increasing their strength, agility and confidence. Your contribution makes it possible! 

    We want to put 100 Cyclo Bicis rolling in neighborhoods with limited material resources and few recreational spaces for children in Cali. 

    We will manufacture and donate 100 Cyclo Bicis to children between 2 and 5 years old in Cali, Colombia, whose families are poor. We want to foster the use of the bicycle from an early age and stimulate their development and learning capacity through play.

    It’s scientifically proven that physical exercise has beneficial effects on brain function, such as promoting neuroplasticity and improve performance of learning and memory, and improve interaction with others and the physical and social environmental function. 

    For Cyclo, Innovating, Development and Learning the donation of these 100 Cyclo Bicis will impact our immediate environment which is Cali, since from the early years of life we are promoting the use of bicycles as a system of transportation that is sustainable, fun, and healthy for everyone.

    Besides the physical activity and the feeling of freedom it gives, the Cyclo Bicis help strengthen family bonds. We wish to strengthen, through play and fun, family unity and social structure in the communities, along with the development and growth of the children benefited.

    How far have we advanced until now with the Cyclo Bicis Project 

    After a research and experimentation process that began in early 2013, we invited family and friends to share their skills and funds necessary for the production of the first 23 Cyclo bikes; 8 were made for our Cyclo family and the rest were given to 15 children from different neighborhoods in the cities of Cali and Palmira, in the Valle del Cauca. So we made it! ... Today Cyclo is for our sons and daughters and other children of our city, finally a reality! 

    Georeferencing map of the beneficiary children

    This map shows the distribution of the 23 Cyclo Bicis donated up until now.

    Click here Georeferencing Map to open it.


    How does the donation process work for the Cyclo Bicis

    Cyclo, Innovating, Development, and Learning together with community organizations who work for the well-being of the early childhood in different sectors of limited resources in Cali, select the boys and girls to be benefited.

    These children have the possibility to keep the learning bicycle until they have grown enough or until they can ride a bike with pedals. The bicycles are returned to the project, given a thorough maintenance tune-up, and then are ready to be used again. This is how the Cycle begins again

    To accompany the boys and girls along with their families who have the Cyclo Bicis, regular events are held. These events are supported by volunteer professionals in physical education and health, who help organize playful as well as integrating recreational activities.

    What we need

    Our goal is to fabricate 100 Cyclo Bicis and to do so, we need $22,000 USD. Each dollar you invest in the campaing is designated to the following activities:

    Production of the 100 Cyclo Bikes: Purchasing of all materials, mainly the high quality wood, to assure stability and durability; this includes man-hours in both operational areas and administrative.

    Donation of the 100 Cyclo Bikes: The 100 Cyclo Bicis will be donated at a special event, which will be supported by recreationist volunteers, physical educators, physiotherapists, artists, and a production staff that will assist with the organization of playful activities and recreation for the boys and girls and their families and friends.

    Design, creation, and shipping of rewards: rewards for contributing to our campaign include postcards, serigraphy, and t-shirts, whose designs are created exclusively for this project by local artists,which will be shipped anywhere in the world where you make your donation. We will also put together a video in thanks to our official sponsors, especially on the day of the event where we donate the 100 Cyclo Bicis.

    Graphic and audiovisual production of the Campaign: Our campaign will also allocate a small percentage of its resources to sustain the graphic and audiovisual production required from the start of the campaign until the delivery of the 100 Cyclo Bicis.

    What we will not invest your money in: We will not invest your money in paying for activities like graphic design, photography, communication and management of social media, design of publicity materials, georeferencing and translation of text to different languages, since all of these activities are done by volunteers.

    What you get

    The 100 Cyclo Bicis 2014 Campaign thanks you for your contributions with rewards specially designed for you. In the Rewards section we will explain more in depth what you receive for your donation. Thank you for supporting us.

                          

                          

    Three reasons to donate

    • Education: encourages the appropriation of public space and sustainable mobility.
    • Ecological: this Cyclo Bici is developed with friendly environmental materials.
    • Reusable: after learning, the bicycles are repaired and donated again.

    Impacts

    Primary level impact – Boys and girls. The Cyclo Bicis project will directly benefit 100 boys and girls between the ages of 2 and 5 years of age. The continuous use of the Cyclo Bicis will develop their physical and cognitive skills that will be immediately reflected in the coordination of their movement and balance. It also promotes physical activity as a healthy lifestyle starting at a young age.

    Secondary level Impact – The children’s family core. The indirect beneficiaries are the family groups of those children, since they also take care of them and are involved in the use of the Cyclo Bicis and become active participants in the growth and learning process. This way Cyclo Bicis positively impact the children's families, allowing the sustainability of the overall benefits of the bicycle as a learning tool over time.

    Tertiary level impact – the low income children’s population of the City of Cali. On another level, we want to impact the boys and girls who have very limited alternatives for education and fun. These kids live in high drug-risk environments; rife with street violence, forced work and poverty. Cyclo Bicis promotes, through play, the healthy growth of boys, girls, and their family units when their guardians take an active part in the learning process.

    Other ways you can help

    If you can´t donate financially to the campaign, it doesn’t mean you can’t collaborate. You can do so in the following ways:

    • Spread the word through the hashtag #100CycloBicis2014 on Facebook. 
    • Subscribe to our blog: www.cyclobicis.wordpress.com.
    • Share our fanpage on Facebook with your social networks. https://www.facebook.com/pages/Cyclo-Innovaci%C3%B3n-Desarrollo-y-Aprendizaje/941789625836076

               ___________________________________________________________
