          Dektol Producciones                                       Andrés Rada



Spanish / English version


Mientras los niños y niñas beneficiarias del
proyecto Cyclo Bicis se divierten y sonríen, desarrollan sus destrezas físicas
incrementando su fuerza, agilidad y autoconfianza. ¡Tu contribución lo hace posible!



Queremos poner a rodar 100 Cyclo Bicis en barrios de recursos materiales limitados y pocos espacios de recreación para niños y niñas de Cali.
Vamos a fabricar y donar 100 Cyclo Bicis a los niños y niñas entre los 2 y los 5 años de edad de la ciudad de Cali, Colombia, cuyas familias son de escasos recursos. Queremos fomentar el uso de la bicicleta desde una edad temprana y estimular su desarrollo y aprendizaje a través del juego. Esta comprobado cientificamente que el ejercicio físico posee efectos beneficiosos sobre la función cerebral, tales como promover la neuroplasticidad y aumentar el rendimiento del aprendizaje y la memoria, además de mejorar la interacción con otros y con el ambiente físico y social.Para Cyclo, Innovación, Desarrollo y Aprendizaje la donación de estas 100 Cyclo Bicis tendrá un impacto en nuestro entorno inmediato que es Cali ya que desde los primeros años de vida estamos promoviendo el uso de la bicicleta como un sistema de transporte sustentable, alegre y saludable para todos.Además de la actividad física y la sensación de libertad, las Cyclo Bicis ayudan a fortalecer las relaciones familiares. Queremos fortalecer a través del juego y la diversión, la unión familiar y el tejido social de las comunidades, acompañando el desarrollo y crecimiento de los niños y niñas beneficiarias. Cuánto hemos avanzado hasta ahora con el proyecto Cyclo BicisDespués de un proceso de investigación y experimentación que inició a principios del año 2013, invitamos a la familia, a los amigos y amigas para compartir sus habilidades y los fondos necesarios para la producción de las primeras 23 Cyclo Bicis: 8 se hicieron para nuestra familia Cyclo y las restantes se entregaron a 15 niños y niñas de diferentes barrios de las ciudades de Cali y Palmira, en el Valle del Cauca. Así que lo conseguimos!…hoy Cyclo es para nuestros hijos, hijas y otros niños y niñas de nuestra ciudad, una realidad!  Mapa de Georeferenciación de los niños beneficiariosEste mapa muestra la distribución de las 23 Cyclo Bicis entregadas hasta ahora. Da click aqui Mapa de Georefenciacion, para ver el mapa completo.Cómo funciona la entrega de las Cyclo BicisCyclo, Innovación, Desarrollo y Aprendizaje junto con organizaciones comunitarias que trabajan por el bienestar de la primera infancia en diferentes sectores de limitados recursos de Cali, selecciona a los niños y niñas beneficiarios.Estos niños y niñas tienen la posibilidad de quedarse con la bicicleta de aprendizaje hasta que hayan crecido lo suficiente o hasta que puedan montar una bicicleta con pedales. Las bicicletas regresan al proyecto, se les hace un mantenimiento y están listas para ser utilizadas nuevamente. Y así se inicia nuevamente el Ciclo.Para acompañar a los niños, niñas y a sus familias en el proceso con las Cyclo Bicis, se organizan encuentros con regularidad. Estos encuentros son apoyados por profesionales voluntarios en educación física y salud, que ayudan con la organización de actividades lúdico recreativas y de integración.Lo que necesitamos Nuestra meta es fabricar 100 Cyclo Bicis y para ello necesitamos USD $22.000. Cada dólar que inviertes en la campaña estará destinado a las siguientes actividades:Producción de las 100 Cyclo Bicis: Compra de todos los materiales, principalmente madera de alta calidad para asegurar su estabilidad y durabilidad; esto incluye la mano de obra, tanto la administrativa como la operativa.Entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis: Las 100 Cyclo Bicis serán entregadas en un evento especial, en el que participan voluntarios recreacionistas, educadores físicos, fisioterapeutas, artistas y un staff de producción que ayudarán con la organización de actividades lúdico recreativas para los niños, niñas y sus acompañantes. Diseño, elaboracion y envio de recompensas: las recompensas que recibes por contribuir con nuestra campaña incluyen postales, serigrafías y camisetas, cuyos diseños son elaborados exclusivamente para el logro de este sueño por artistas locales, que serán enviadas a cualquier lugar del mundo donde realices tu contribución. También realizaremos la producción de un videoclip de agradecimiento para nuestros patrocinados oficiales, especialmente el día del Evento oficial de entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis. Producción gráfica y audiovisual de la campaña:  nuestra campaña también destinará un porcentaje muy bajo de sus recursos para sostener la producción gráfica y audiovisual requerida desde el inicio de la campaña hasta la entrega de las 100 Cyclo Bicis.En que no invertiremos tu dinero: no invertiremos tu dinero en el pago de actividades como diseño gráfico,  fotografía, comunicaciones y manejo de redes sociales, diseño de piezas publicitarias, georeferenciación y traducción de textos a diferentes idiomas, ya que estas actividades son realizadas por voluntarios.
Lo que obtienes
La Campaña 100 Cyclo Bicis agradece tus contribuciones con recompensas especialmente diseñadas para ti; en la sección de Recompensas te explicamos, qué recibes a cambio de tu contribución. Gracias por apoyarnos.                                               Tres razones para donar:


Educación: fomenta la apropiación del espacio público y la movilidad sostenible


Ecológico: esta desarrollado con materiales amigables con el medio ambiente

Reutilizable: después del aprendizaje, las bicicletas son reparadas y donadas nuevamente.

ImpactosImpactos de primer nivel  . Niños y  niñas: El proyecto Cyclo beneficia directamente a 100 niños y niñas, entre los 2 y los 5 años de edad, ya que a través del uso continuo de las Cyclo Bicis desarrollan destrezas físicas y cognitivas que se reflejan en la pronta coordinación de sus movimientos y el equilibrio. Además se promueve la actividad física como un estilo de vida saludable desde temprana edad. Impactos de segundo nivel - Núcleo familiar de los niños y niñas: Los beneficiarios indirectos son el grupo familiar a los que pertenecen, ya que los cuidadores se ven involucrados en el uso de la Cyclo Bici y se convierten en participantes activos del proceso de crecimiento y aprendizaje. De esta forma Cyclo Bicis impacta positivamente en la familia del niño o la niña, permitiendo que los beneficios con el uso de la bicicleta de aprendizaje se sostenga en el tiempo. Impactos de tercer nivel - Población infantil de escasos recursos de la Ciudad de Cali: De otra parte, los niños y niñas con limitadas alternativas para educarse y divertirse, que viven en contextos de riesgo por drogas, violencia en las calles, trabajo forzado o pobreza. Cyclo Bicis propicia a través del juego, el crecimiento saludable de niños, niñas y la unidad familiar cuando sus tutores toman parte activa del aprendizaje.
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudarSi no puedes contribuir económicamente a la campaña, esto no significa que no puedas colaborar, puedes hacerlo de las siguientes formas:

Corre la voz a través del hashtag #100CycloBicis2014 en Facebook.


Suscribete a nuestro blog:www.cyclobicis.wordpress.com


Comparte nuestra FanPage de Facebook con tus redes sociales. https://www.facebook.com/pages/Cyclo-Innovaci%C3%B3n-Desarrollo-y-Aprendizaje/941789625836076


_____________________________________________________________________________
100 CYCLO BICIS AND THOUSANDS OF TENDER SMILESWhile boys and girls benefiting of the Project Cyclo Bicis have fun and smile, they develop their physical skills by increasing their strength, agility and confidence. Your contribution makes it possible! 

We want to put 100 Cyclo Bicis rolling in neighborhoods with limited material resources and few recreational spaces for children in Cali. 
We will manufacture and donate 100 Cyclo Bicis to children between 2 and 5 years old in Cali, Colombia, whose families are poor. We want to foster the use of the bicycle from an early age and stimulate their development and learning capacity through play.
It’s scientifically proven that physical exercise has beneficial effects on brain function, such as promoting neuroplasticity and improve performance of learning and memory, and improve interaction with others and the physical and social environmental function. 
For Cyclo, Innovating, Development and Learning the donation of these 100 Cyclo Bicis will impact our immediate environment which is Cali, since from the early years of life we are promoting the use of bicycles as a system of transportation that is sustainable, fun, and healthy for everyone.
Besides the physical activity and the feeling of freedom it gives, the Cyclo Bicis help strengthen family bonds. We wish to strengthen, through play and fun, family unity and social structure in the communities, along with the development and growth of the children benefited.

After a research and experimentation process that began in early 2013, we invited family and friends to share their skills and funds necessary for the production of the first 23 Cyclo bikes; 8 were made for our Cyclo family and the rest were given to 15 children from different neighborhoods in the cities of Cali and Palmira, in the Valle del Cauca. So we made it! ... story:
Short Summary


Hey thank you guys for taking your time out to read over our campaign.  We are Urban Harem Magazine, one of the fastest growing Urban Men's Interest Magazines in the country and we are raising money in order to assist us in continuing our growth.  We have been blessed to be accepted into Barnes and Nobles along with already being in Books A Million and some 7-Elevens.  Barnes and Nobles has 661 stores and is the largest retail store for books and magazines in the country.  This opportunity gives us a bigger national audience. Needles to say, now we need your help!


We are attempting to raise $5,000 to assist us in our growth.  We have different categories for anyone that wants to help

  • Donations: Any amount donated helps. Even $1! We appreciate any and everyone that wants to help us reach our goal!
  • $5 Package: A $5 donation will give you one of our previously printed issues of the magazine along with a thank you letter from our team. (Please add $3.99 for Shipping and Handling)
  • $8.99 Package: For $8.99 you can pre order the next issue of our magazine with Bad Girls Club Model Aysia Garza on the cover.  (Please add $3.99 for Shipping and Handling)
  • $15 Package: For $15 you can get a 1 year subscription of our magazine.  (Please add $4.99 for Shipping and Handling)                                                                    
  •                                          Friends & Family Pack

  • $50 Package: The $50 family pack will include a UHM Hat or UHM T-Shirt along with a one (1) year subscription.
  • $100 Package: The $100 family pack will include a UHM Hat & a UHM T-Shirt with a two (2) year subscription to the magazine.

What We Use The Money For

We have two immediate needs for the funds raised:

  • Printing - With the new Barnes and Noble account we need more magazines printed in order full-fill the order from our distributor.  With additional printing comes additional printing cost.  A portion of the funds will cover these cost.
  • Facility - Moving into a new entertainment facility that will consist of state of the art equipment, which includes a recording studio, green room for video recording and 3 photography studios.

Investing

If you are interested in investing we give 25% return on your investment in the amounts of...

  • $500
  • $1,000
  • $2,500
  • $5,000

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you want to support but you are unable to donate, purchase or invest please share this link with your friends on social media
  • Indiegogo has prided itself with it's share tools so please use them!

story:
The Project 

My name is Christine Chen and I am a current student at Stanford University. I am traveling to Ghana this summer to create an audio documentary on the current and future dimensions of orphan care. While there, I will conduct in-depth interviews with individuals leading the way in driving nationwide orphan care reform efforts. These stories will be synthesized into a professional, 20-25 minute audio piece, which will be broadcast on the Stanford public radio station (KZSU) and available online through the Stanford Storytelling Project.

Service has always been a large part of my life. This project arose from a personal realization that we need to better understand the effects of our desire to "make a difference" in other countries. Even the best intentions can do more harm than good if they are not clearly aligned with a community's needs. In this case, supporting orphanages in Ghana seems like a noble cause, but in reality ends up perpetuating a corrupt and harmful system that fails to meet the needs of the children. 

That is why this project is so important to me. 

It is a way to raise awareness about this sensitive and complex issue—but more importantly, to do so through the voices of those who've witnessed the problem firsthand. People like Madam Helena Obeng-Asamoah, Acting Director of the Department of Children at the Ministry, who's led Ghana's efforts in orphanage reform since the early 2000's; or Mrs. Adwoa Yeboah-Marfo, founder of the Marfo Children Care Foundation, who's dedicated her life to providing a caring family environment in Ghana for orphaned children.

This audio documentary will be carried upon their voices. 

Help make this initiative possible. With your support, we can bring a more robust awareness to this  issue, and encourage people everywhere to more critically examine the ways they choose to make a difference.

How can you help?

I recently received the Stanford Braden Grant in partial support of this project; however, the grant does not cover the cost of living expenses for the duration of this project. I will be living in Ghana for two months, and then near Stanford, CA for the final month of creating this documentary. All funds will go towards paying for these 3 months of housing. 

  • Housing cost in Ghana (2 months): $1,200
  • Housing cost while back in the US (1 month): $1,200
  • TOTAL: $2,400

I would appreciate any amount you can give towards this overall goal. 

Your support helps make this project and vision possible.

Why is this issue important? 

In Ghana, orphan care is a critically important issue.  At best, institutional care through facilities like orphanages is highly detrimental to child welfare and development, even while operating at the highest possible standards. This, coupled with the lack of continuity of care, emotional support, and training for independence outside of the orphanage put these children at a significant disadvantage (Williamson, 2010). 

At worst, orphanages operate illegally, taking advantage of the system—and children—to generate a profit (IRIN, 2009). Facilities engage in "orphan tourism," imposing poor living conditions on their children as a way to solicit donations from sympathetic Western donors. (Frimpong-Manso, 2013). In spite of this, there continues to be ongoing support of orphanages from foreign donors, who pledge money or resources to support existing orphanages, or to found new ones.   

While there is no simple solution to this problem, a more meaningful long-term approach, which has been spearheaded by the Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare, is to support family-based care. This involves reunifying children with family members and empowering communities to support cohesive family units. In 2006, the Ghanaian government enacted the Care Reform Initiative, a nationwide effort to move children out of orphanages and back to immediate or extended families. Beyond mere reunification, they also aim to re-purpose orphanages into schools, community centers, and women shelters, which will contribute towards supporting the community itself (Ghanaian DSW). 

The momentum of this movement, coupled with the growing realization of the non-sustainability of orphanages, has contributed to a growing push to better meet the needs of Ghana’s most vulnerable children. This is the current state of affairs in Ghana, and it holds immense potential for changing the way orphaned children are cared for now and in the future.

WORKS CITED

Frimpong-Manso, Kwabena. “From walls to homes: Child care reform and de-institutionalisationin Ghana.” International Journal of Social Welfare (2013): 1-8. 

Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare. The Care Reform Initiative. National Plan of Action for Orphans and Vulnerable Children. 2014. Accra, Ghana.

Integrated Regional Information Networks. “WEST AFRICA: Protecting children from orphan-dealers.” Humanitarian News and Analysis. 27 May, 2009. Accessed March 01, 2014. <http://www.irinnews.org/report/84582/west-africa-protecting-children-from-orphan-dealers>

Williamson, J., & Greenberg, A. (2010). Families, not orphanages. Better Care. Network, New York. 

What else am I doing in Ghana?

In addition to this audio documentary project, I will be working with Kaeme, a non-profit that works in partnership with the Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare (DSW). We will be supporting the DSW’s efforts to carry out nationwide orphanage reform efforts, through canvassing existing orphanages and working to implement an online database to facilitate the reunification of children with families. 

Check out more about this incredible organization here: www.kaeme.org/. 

How else can you help?

  • Share this campaign with anyone you feel might be interested in supporting this project
  • Check out my audio documentary, which will be broadcast on KZSU and published online to the Stanford Storytelling Project in the fall of 2014, and then share it with family, friends, colleagues, great-aunts-twice-removed, and anyone else!
Thank you!
story_txt:
The
Project 
My name is Christine Chen
and I am a current student at Stanford University. I am traveling to
Ghana this summer to create an audio documentary on the current and
future dimensions of orphan care. While there, I will conduct in-depth
interviews with individuals leading the way in driving nationwide orphan care
reform efforts. These stories will be synthesized into
a professional, 20-25 minute audio piece, which will be broadcast on the
Stanford public radio station (KZSU) and available online through the Stanford
Storytelling Project.
Service has always been a large part of my life. This project arose from a personal realization that we need to better understand
the effects of our desire to "make a difference"
in other countries. Even the best intentions can do more harm than good if they are not clearly aligned with a community's needs. In this case, supporting orphanages in Ghana seems like a noble cause, but in reality ends up perpetuating a corrupt and harmful system that fails to meet the needs of the children. 
That is why this project is so important to me. 

It is a way to raise awareness about this sensitive and complex issue—but more importantly, to do so through the voices of those who've witnessed the
problem firsthand. People like Madam Helena Obeng-Asamoah, Acting Director of the
Department of Children at the Ministry, who's led Ghana's efforts in
orphanage reform since the early 2000's; or Mrs. Adwoa Yeboah-Marfo,
founder of the Marfo Children Care Foundation, who's dedicated her life to providing
a caring family environment in Ghana for orphaned children.

This audio documentary will be carried upon their voices. 

Help make this initiative possible. With your
support, we can bring a more robust awareness to this  issue, and encourage people everywhere to more critically examine the ways they
choose to make a difference.

How can you help?
I recently received the Stanford Braden Grant in partial support of this project; however, the grant does not cover the cost of living expenses for the duration of this project. I will be living in Ghana for two months, and then near Stanford, CA for the final month of creating this documentary. All funds will go towards paying for these 3 months of housing. 

Housing cost in Ghana (2 months):
     $1,200
Housing cost while back in
     the US (1 month): $1,200
TOTAL: $2,400

I would appreciate any
amount you can give towards this overall goal. 
Your support helps make this project and vision possible.
Why is this issue important? 
In Ghana, orphan care is
a critically important issue.  At best, institutional care through facilities like orphanages is highly detrimental to child welfare and development, even while operating at the highest possible standards. This, coupled with the lack of continuity of care, emotional support, and training for independence outside of the orphanage put these children at a significant disadvantage (Williamson, 2010). At worst, orphanages operate illegally, taking advantage of the system—and children—to
generate a profit (IRIN, 2009). Facilities engage in "orphan tourism," imposing poor living conditions on
their children as a way to solicit donations from sympathetic Western donors. (Frimpong-Manso, 2013). In spite of this, there continues to be ongoing support of orphanages from foreign donors, who pledge money or resources to support existing orphanages, or to found new ones.   While there is no simple solution to this problem, a more meaningful
long-term approach, which has been
spearheaded by the Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare, is to support family-based care. This involves reunifying children with family members
and empowering communities to support cohesive family units. In 2006, the
Ghanaian government enacted the Care Reform Initiative, a nationwide effort to
move children out of orphanages and back to immediate or extended families. Beyond mere reunification, they also aim to re-purpose orphanages into schools, community centers, and women shelters, which will contribute towards supporting the community itself (Ghanaian DSW). The
momentum of this movement, coupled with the growing realization of the
non-sustainability of orphanages, has contributed to a growing push to
better meet the needs of Ghana’s most vulnerable children. This
is the current state of affairs in Ghana, and it holds immense potential
for changing the way orphaned children are cared for now and in the future.
WORKS CITED
Frimpong-Manso, Kwabena.
“From walls to homes: Child care reform and de-institutionalisationin Ghana.”
International Journal of Social Welfare (2013): 1-8. Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare. The Care Reform Initiative. National Plan of Action for Orphans and Vulnerable Children. 2014. Accra, Ghana.
Integrated Regional
Information Networks. “WEST AFRICA: Protecting children from orphan-dealers.”
Humanitarian News and Analysis. 27 May, 2009. Accessed March 01, 2014. <http://www.irinnews.org/report/84582/west-africa-protecting-children-from-orphan-dealers>Williamson, J., & Greenberg, A. (2010). Families, not orphanages. Better Care. Network, New York. 
What else am I doing in Ghana?
In addition to this audio documentary project, I will be working with Kaeme, a non-profit that
works in partnership with the Ghanaian Department of Social Welfare (DSW). We
will be supporting the DSW’s efforts to carry out nationwide orphanage reform
efforts, through canvassing existing orphanages and working to implement an
online database to facilitate the reunification of children with
families. Check out more about this incredible organization here: www.kaeme.org/. 
How else can you help?

Share this campaign with anyone you feel might be interested in supporting this project
Check
     out my audio documentary, which will be broadcast on KZSU and published
     online to the Stanford Storytelling Project in the fall of 2014, and then share it
     with family, friends, colleagues, great-aunts-twice-removed, and anyone else!Thank you!

story:
We’re developing a cooperatively owned grocery store with a focus on local and organic food at competitive prices.


 

The front and back of our T-shirts!


   

 Our canvas tote bags!                                 And our bibs!

If you would like to find out more the naming rights for our aisles, alley, shopping carts, etc.  please send an email to info@cliftonmarket.com


Clifton, a neighborhood of Cincinnati, Ohio, lost its only grocery in 2011 when Keller’s IGA closed.  Keller’s had faithfully served the community for over 70 years, serving as both a social hub to the community and an anchor to the business district. 

 The Keller’s IGA was still turning a profit in its final year, but due to issues in their second store, deferred maintenance, and unpaid taxes it was forced to close.  The store served as a social hub to the community and an anchor to the business district, but it has now been vacant for three and a half years, hurting both businesses and residents alike.

After numerous courtships with larger grocery chains, a change of ownership and promise of a new IGA, the building still sits vacant.  As a community we cannot wait anymore for someone else to fill the space. As a community we can create the grocery store that our neighborhood needs.


The Clifton Market is incorporated as a cooperative business with the State of Ohio -it will function like a traditional grocery store, but is owned by the community (and beyond).  Owner shares in Clifton Market cannot be sold via Indiegogo, but check out our website to learn more: cliftonmarket.com

The cooperative owners will vote each year for the board of directors.  The board will govern the grocery store and hire a store manager to operate and manage the store.

Our shelves will be stocked with as much local and organic products as we can source, while also stocking conventional grocery items at competitive prices.  We will have a mouth watering produce department, a full service butcher and seafood department, a Euro bakery, a deli with prepared foods and salad bar, extensive beer and wine selection, international foods as well as everyday products.


 



Truly, we need $4 million dollars - it takes a lot of money to buy, renovate, and stock a grocery store.  In the first phase we are trying to raise $1 million from the community.  $1 million is the minimum needed to secure financing for the purchase of the building.  So far, we have raised $680,000 and that number keeps rising, but we need it to accelerate.

Through this Indiegogo campaign we’re trying to raise at least $50,000, with a reach goal of $150,000.  An influx of cash at this level would be a huge boost in our efforts – and go a long way to convincing other potential donors that this project is going to succeed.  Money raised from this campaign will be used for the purchase of the 30,000 sq. ft. building.  Upon purchase, the building will then be cleaned up, built out, and reopened in the second phase of the project.

  • The return of a local, community-based grocery store. 
  • Bringing 15,000 customers weekly to the Ludlow Business District
  • Local farmers and food producers, as we plan to stock a large array of local food.
  • The preservation of an urban business district that relies on the grocery store to generate the necessary foot traffic for business.
  • Livable wages for employees.

When is the last time you were given the opportunity to help open a grocery store? Support us today!  And check out our website at cliftonmarket.com


This project is community grown.  Our board of directors is made up of dedicated community volunteers – the only benefit we stand to gain from this project is a functioning grocery store.  100% of your donations go towards opening Clifton Market.  We are dedicated to putting the groceries back into the grocery store.

We’ve already raised $680,000+ and have 885+ owners – proving both a strong community commitment to the project and trust in its leadership and overall viability.

We have a diverse team working on this project, with over 50 years of combined grocery experience and over 50 years of combined marketing experience.  Our board has members who are 5th generation Clifton residents and members across a diverse age, gender, and race groups.  We have positioned ourselves for success, and you can help.


All large undertakings come with risk - this community owned grocery being no different.  Funding is our largest hurdle.  We are confident that the store will be successful once opened (and we have an in-depth 3rd party market survey on our website that adds reassurance), but we have to buy, build out, and stock the grocery first, which represents a large investment.  Your participation in this Indiegogo campaign will help lower this financial hurdle.

If you would like to participate by volunteering or becoming a share owner, check out our website at cliftonmarket.com.  Spread the word; share our campaign and our cause with your friends on social media.  Like us on Facebook!


          Adam Hyland - President of the Board

Adam is a fourth generation resident of Clifton and currently serves  as Co Vice President for Clifton Town Meeting.  He is the founder and principal of EccaNova, strategic digital Ad brokering and political consulting.   Adam has over 15 years of experience working on land use and political campaigns in 20 different states from Township Trustees to Presidential campaigns.

          Emma Hartkemeier - Board Member

Emma is a native of Clifton, retired Kindergarten teacher and a life-long volunteer of Clifton projects.  She has been involved with the Village Garden Club, Clifton School PTA, Friends of the Cincinnati Parks, Hamilton County Curriculum Council, and Immanuel Presbyterian Church.  She appreciates that Clifton residents always have life necessities available on Ludlow Av.

          Jo Taylor - Board Member

Jo is a 15-year resident of Clifton, a retired full-charge bookkeeper and fofice manager.  Clifton was the first community she had ever lived in where walking to get her groceries was an option and she quickly fell in love with it’s many benefits.

          Shaun McCance - Board Member

Shaun moved to Clifton just six months before Keller’s closed.  He and his wife wanted to live in a friendly, walkable neighborhood when they moved to Cincinnati and immediately fell in love with Clifton.  Growing up just outside of Gary, IN, he has seen the effects of urban decay and understands how vital a business district can be to a neighborhood.  Shaun works as an open source programmer, technical writer, events planner and volunteer coordinator.

          Robert Krikorian - Board Member

Robert ‘s commitment to the Clifton Market arises from concern for Clifton and the belief that grass roots effort is the best way to solve local problems and create a positive ripple effect.  He has lived in in the Clifton area for many years and is a member of the faculty in the Department of Psychiatry & Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati Medical Center.

          Marilyn Hyland - Board Member

is a Marketing Strategist.  She created the 6 year marketing strategy for Clifton to return the historic Esquire Theatre back to service and prevent its demolition.  Marilyn likes to be a part of a tradition of people creating their vision of their community.  Marilyn is a former board member of Clifton Town Meeting  and Vice President of the Clifton Theatre Corporation.  She owns the Marilyn Hyland Agency, an integrated marketing strategy, advertising, public relations, and government liaison company.

          Gary Goldman - Board Member

Gary is an attorney and president of Theatre Management Corporation, which operates the Esquire, Mariemont, and Kenwood movie theaters.  He was instrumental in the Clifton neighborhood’s effort to keep the Esquire from being torn down in the 80’s. 

          Charles Marxen - Field Director

Charles is a recent graduate from the University of Cincinnati's College of Engineering.  He runs the day-to-day operations of the Clifton Market project, finds and coordinates volunteers, and leads community outreach, among many other responsibilities.

         Randy Miller - Grocery Advisor

Randy brings the vision, business acumen, strategic focus and mature judgment gained during a successful career in the grocery industry. Leveraging more than 30 years of progressive experience with Kroger, biggs and Jungle Jim’s has enabled Miller to significantly impact profitability and growth objectives for these industry leaders for which he has served as a strategic partner. 

  

Updated November 1, 2014. For the latest info, visit http://cliftonmarket.com/faq

Q: Why a Co-op?

A: The co-op business model is the fastest and easiest way to raise money. Grocery co-ops source more local food, pay better wages, and put more money back into the local economy. Profits from the co-op are returned to owners in the community in the form of patronage dividends. This encourages owner loyalty because the more you shop, the more you get back.

Q: How will this store succeed when Keller’s didn’t?

A:Keller’s IGA was turning a profit even in its last year of operation, but profits were being used to support another store and the store needed renovations and modern marketing. Market analysis indicates that an uptrend grocery would bring in more money than the conventional model that Keller’s followed. Clifton Market will be an uptrend grocery.

Q: Can an independent store like Clifton Market be competitive?

A: Co-ops have exclusive distribution channels to get organic and quality foods at competitive prices. We also plan to use local products not only for quality but to reduce shipping costs. We plan to have a wide variety of products to serve all shoppers who live or work in the area.

Q: What is the status of negotiations?

A: We have a contract to purchase 319 Ludlow and are currently working on raising funds through owner loans to complete the purchase.

Q: What is the condition of the former IGA?

A: The building is considered to be “White Box” ready by commercial real-estate standards. It is structurally sound and ready for cosmetic upgrades. It has a new roof, asbestos was abated, and flooring issues have been fixed.

Q: How much will the project cost?

A: The cost of the building is $1.65 million, which will give us a clear title. We will need another $2.9 million for construction, equipment and fixtures, initial inventory, and operating expenses. The building was appraised at over $2 million, so we are getting a bargain.

Q: How will we raise the funds?

A: We are raising funds through shares and owner loans. When we secure half the financing from the community, we will approach banks and other institutions for conventional loans. Distributors have offered rebatable loans and free first inventory worth up to $500,000. We are also pursuing gifts and donations from large institutions interested in promoting the health and well being of Clifton residents.

Q: How do I buy a share?

A: Purchase online, visit us during our office hours, or download the owner share application and mail it with a check to:

Clifton Market

PO Box 20162

Cincinnati, OH 45220

Q: When will the store open?

A: Once we have purchased the building, we can set the final schedule, but we expect the store will be open for summer 2015. The sooner we raise the necessary funds, the sooner the store will open.

Q: What does uptrend and full-service mean?

A: Uptrend describes the look and feel of the grocery store - a more polished look than conventional stores (think Whole Foods and Trader Joe’s).   Full-service means that the store sells fresh fruts and vegetables, fresh meats, poultry, and sea food, dairy products, canned foods, frozen foods, dry groceries and baked goods and non-alcoholic beverages.

story:
Lets start something magickal.

Raising funds to open a New Age/Occult supply and gift store.

Hello, and welcome to my page. 

   The plan is to open a New Age/Occult gift shop in the Pensacola Florida area, on or near May 1st, 2014. It will be more than a place for trinkets and books. Imagine a place that stocks stones, oils,cards, jewelry, and a huge assortment of fresh and fresh dried herbs (yes cooking is magik to). It will have drums, Native flutes, Native drums, and singing bowls. You can also find candles, incense, smudge, statuary, ritual tools, and so much more at a fair price (I did the math, it can be done!). Numerous classes and workshops will be offered so there is something to do almost everyday it is open. The tentative schedule includes belly-dancing classes, Yoga classes, healing sessions, tarot readings, meditation workshops, and many more that will be ready to go as soon as the doors are open.

   After being led to open this kind of store I did some research. By research I mean that I read articles. I spoke to many business owners of both New Age and Occult bookstores. Some stores were successful and some of them had closed. I had to know the stories of what worked and what didn't. What surprised me was that everyone that was contacted took the time to tell me what they learned from both successes and failures. It was a sign.

   I didn't have the start up capital. I didn't have anything of monetary value. I only had a vision and close friends and family that wanted a place like the one I described to happen close by them. So, with that support I blazed ahead knowing it would work. As of now suppliers, instructors, and workshop leaders have been lined up. A permanent space has been found that is large enough, in a great location and at an affordable lease (We have also have plans to be at local Expos, Renaissance Fairs, and Conventions). The store has been named and is a legal LLC. The licensees that can be obtained before leasing a space have been obtained including a Federal Employer Identification Number and the ability to collect sales tax for the State on both goods and services. 
 

  Now, the store needs cash to open. When you choose to continue the momentum of this project by giving we will return in kind with a gift. The gifts and suggested donations are to the side. If you think your friends would like to hear the story, just like us or give is a share at www.facebook.com/thepentaclepensacola



Sincerely,

John Harmon II


The Pentacle LLC

www.facebook.com/thepentaclepensacola

thepentacle@mail.com




Here are some things I feel must be added:

If you are sending a lot of money and would like a business plan I have one and will share it with you.

If you would like a Press Release contact us and one will be sent to you.

If you are seriously considering funding an Alter please contact me first as some limitations apply.

If the goal is not met we will use the funds to prepare for upcoming conventions and festivals.

Because you have read all the way to the end I want to thank you again for your time and contribution.

Imagine a place that stocks stones, oils,cards, jewelry, and a huge assortment of fresh and fresh dried herbs (yes cooking is magik to). It will have drums, Native flutes, Native drums, and singing bowls. You can also find candles, incense, smudge, statuary, ritual tools, and so much more at a fair price (I did the math, it can be done!). Numerous classes and workshops will be offered so there is something to do almost everyday it is open. The tentative schedule includes belly-dancing classes, Yoga classes, healing sessions, tarot readings, meditation workshops, and many more that will be ready to go as soon as the doors are open.   After being led to open this kind of store I did some research. By research I mean that I read articles. I spoke to many business owners of both New Age and Occult bookstores. Some stores were successful and some of them had closed. I had to know the stories of what worked and what didn't. What surprised me was that everyone that was contacted took the time to tell me what they learned from both successes and failures. It was a sign.   I didn't have the start up capital. I didn't have anything of monetary value. I only had a vision and close friends and family that wanted a place like the one I described to happen close by them. So, with that support I blazed ahead knowing it would work. As of now suppliers, instructors, and workshop leaders have been lined up. A permanent space has been found that is large enough, in a great location and at an affordable lease (We have also have plans to be at local Expos, Renaissance Fairs, and Conventions). The store has been named and is a legal LLC. The licensees that can be obtained before leasing a space have been obtained including a Federal Employer Identification Number and the ability to collect sales tax for the State on both goods and services.    Now, the store needs cash to open. When you choose to continue the momentum of this project by giving we will return in kind with a gift. The gifts and suggested donations are to the side. If you think your friends would like to hear the story, just like us or give is a share at www.facebook.com/thepentaclepensacolaSincerely,John Harmon IIThe Pentacle LLCwww.facebook.com/thepentaclepensacolathepentacle@mail.comHere are some things I feel must be added:If you are sending a lot of money and would like a business plan I have one and will share it with you.If you would like a Press Release contact us and one will be sent to you.If you are seriously considering funding an Alter please contact me first as some limitations apply.If the goal is not met we will use the funds to prepare for upcoming conventions and festivals.Because you have read all the way to the end I want to thank you again for your time and contribution.

story:
Hi, My name is Dylan Petrohilos, I'm an activist from Frederick MD. 

I've been organizing in Frederick, DC and MD over the past 7 years. (Going on 8 soon!) Most recently I've worked in the campaign "Healthcare is Human Right – Maryland" and "Stop the Sale of Citizens And Montevue." Both will be close to my heart.

You've probably seen my design work: 

  • banners at protests
  • websites
  • info graphics

I've done much of this as a volunteer, and have not asked for much in return.

And while some of you, I probably have never made a poster, flyer or website. But some I have. Anyway, long story short, in an attempt to repair my laptop I broke it; short circuited the mother board. Which in macbook pros cost 700 + to replace. Which is absurd, at that point I might as well buy a new lap top.

I'm trying to raise 1000 dollars and currently trying to get as much of that on my own. But here is the deal.

50 dollars I will give you a silk screened poster

100 Dollars I will design you a free poster. 

300 dollars I will give you a coupon which will be a free logo. (2 free round of edits included.) Which normally I would charge 500 + dollars for.

For 500 dollars, I will give you a shirt, poster, and a free logo, free flyer and free poster design.

Not bad? Well if you have some extra cash please consider helping me out. If not please keep up the good work and I hope we will meet on the right side of the barricade.

story:
History

UNCG quidditch was founded in Fall 2010 as an intramural (campus only) sport. By the next year, we had become a fully recognized club sport, which means we compete with teams across the state and country. Last year was the first year we went to the Mid-Atlantic Regional Competition (Sponsored by the International Quidditch Association). We are planning on going again this year, but one important thing has changed: It is now much farther away. In order to go, we have to get a hotel for two nights for the whole team (21 players) and we are planning on renting a bus with our friends from Appalachian State Quidditch. The bus alone will cost over $3000 (our half is $1500) and the hotel will cost at least $500. So we need your help! Look to the side of the screen for all of the awesome perks you get when you donate, and watch the video above for an example of our extreme awkwardness and lovableness. Also donate! (please)

Other Ways to Help

  1. Ask your parents for money
  2. Ask your grandparents for money
  3. Share the page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, etc

story:
--Summary--

The goal of this project is to promote new ways of working with foods, drinks and bio stuff. With your help we establish an open food lab at an amazing international event where people can learn, experiment, discuss and do whatever seems fun around the topics mentioned above. Based on the previous successful events we have found that the impact on boosting the peoples creativity is great both on the international and local level. With every year we grow stronger being able to do more for happy life in harmony by our means in an independent way thanks to your support!

--Introduction-- who are we and what do we do

Food Hacking Base (fhb) is an open group of people from all over the world who share the love of experimenting with foods, beverages and bio stuff. We have been promoting these concepts on major hacker events for years now and did also some touring. We report on are activities on our wikies, blogs, coordinate through our discuss list and by IRC, Facebook, Twitter well you name it. We are into building tools and coming up with new technologies often based on ancient wisdom of traditional societies merging our ancestors knowledge with today's scientific understanding and technology. Having a good time enjoying excellent food and drinks are important to us too, we do not miss any opportunity to hang out having fun :-)

During our events you can just pop in joining or giving one of our donation based workshops, present and chat about some cool idea, cook your favorite dish, just have your pick. We build and run facilities which are supporting these activities like experimental kitchen, workshop venue, biolab, washing area etc. We are documenting what we do sharing that with the community as our contribution to the open source paradigm with the hope of changing the world for the better and "enjoying the ride!"

If you would like to know more about what we plan for 31c3, please check the section --This project, bullet points--, for more detail information how we are going to run the base at the 31c3 and use the money from this campaign please check --The Base in detail--.  The "real time" info is on our FHB assembly 31c3 wiki pages. Many thanks for spreading the word around and for your support, with love your fhb team!

--This project-- bullet points

This campaign aims to build food&beverage&bio hacking hub at the 31c3, an appropriate place shared and run by the community where we can all play. Last year we set up with big help from 30c3 orga first fully functional fhb with workshop venue, experimental kitchen, presentation desk and multimedia corner on an indoor event. This year we will add biolab where we want to demonstrate some aseptic techniques, do some microscopy, pH measurements etc. As usually we need tools and equipment (pots, pans, stoves), and of course food ingredient! We'll need all of these to make exotic and exciting experiments and make our hacking accessible getting people into this as we did at OHM2013, the last CCC camp in Finowfurt, 28c3, 29c3, 30c3 congresses and on our tours.

Donations which we receive and do not use will be set aside for the future projects and events, and possibly for compensations of some of the travel and participation cost of people involved.

If you want to know more about how the FHB will be used, please read on at the chapter --The base--.


--The base-- in detail

CCC congresses are major hacker events where we provide open environment for food, beverage and bio hacking. Last year we have done the main push for building and running the necessary facilities on an indoor event and it was a big success! Now we want to improve it based on the previous experience and new trends which are coming and we embrace needing your help to do so!

We will build a decent experimental kitchen where you can food&beverage hack, it should suit 4 people at time quite well. The workshop venue should fit up to 15 people for hands on workshops and 20-25 for tastings, importantly all donation based no one turned away for lack of funds. You can therefore learn from an experienced people how to make variety of things and taste numerous samples to get an overview on given topic like cheese, wine, kimchi etc. We have again on the list the presentation venue, biolab and variety of supportive infrastructure like washing area, multimedia center, the chill out corner is self explanatory, isn't? This years "new thing" is setting up a biolab which will allow us deeper insight into some of our experiments and it will also open whole new area of topics to play with like variety of aseptic techniques which we can use for growing mushrooms etc. It will be first time for the biolab so please be patient, thank you. We provide this to the community knowing that promotion of good food and drinks to our fellow hackers is very needy and important thing to do indeed. It works like this: first we get the attention of the people by giving away delicious tasters. When we get their interest up we invite them to further "elucidate" themselves both theoretically and practically, learning during hands on workshops how to make their own kombucha, kimchi, growing mushrooms or building their own incubator, the topics are as numerous as people who are involved. We document our activities online, our fhb wiki portal is dedicated to that. So it is really up to your preference, you can pop in, have look and hang out a bit but also experiment wildly and share with the community, we do our best to provide for all. 

The true value of what we do stretches further beyond this event. It is the inspiration, bringing the people together around these topics and building a network of enthusiast who help each other to carry on in their activities in their own hackerspaces and homes, that is what matters! This is making the hacker movement more social and "human soft" with the ancient art of food and drinks in it's core, keeping it up to date based on an open source paradigm. It brought peace into the lives of our forefathers for thousands of years, let's cherish it too.

If you'd like to know in further detail how your money will be spent, we invite you to take a look at our 31c3 wiki page especially on the budget section.

We want to redistribute our equipment, tools and building material after the event to the communities and people who want to use it, hoping that some of it will join us again temporarily at the future events, please get in touch if interested! We really don't like stuff laying around under the dust to the "next time", "now is the time to use me" sounds much better to us.

We hope to see you at 31c3 at our spot, many thanks for supporting us, we really appreciate it! :-)

Bitcoins - we are very happy to accept Bitcoins (more than any other currencies to be honest), please use this wallet!

Bitcoin account address: 1Ph2ce4rUZei5Bz9GXESAHduczBY2QP2FT

Thank you!

--The goals--

€1000 - The Food Hacking Base basic set up. We will be able to build necessary infrastructure for experimental kitchen and workshops.

€1500 - Basic Biolab will be possible. We will also be able to buy some better equipment which we can use on the future events.

€2500 - and over. We can plan our infrastructure in a such manner that we can reuse it more easily on the future event and we can run things without looking on every penny which would be less stressful.

story:
A Foundation of Selfless Service

In 2013, Theralution, an innovative physical therapy and fitness company, was founded with integrity, compassion, and selfless service as a base of its core values. As a part of its mission, Theralution not only seeks to enrich lives through physical therapy and fitness, but also by helping individuals through humanitarian efforts. Theralution has a chance to change lives and inspire others to act, and that time is now!


The World is Watching 


The world is witnessing the devastating effects of the Ebola Virus in West Africa. This outbreak has been recorded as the worst Ebola outbreak in history.  Collectively, more than two thousand people in Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria and Sierra Leone have become infected. To date, more than twelve hundred have died. The stories of so many lives lost, and those of many others fighting for their lives, are heart breaking and tragic. The situation has received increasing grim. US News reports that in an effort to prevent the spread of the virus, a 15 year-old boy was shot dead by security forces in a slum community that was blockaded with 50,000 people inside.


Your Support is Needed

Theralution is partnering with Marylanders for Progress, a non-profit charitable organization dedicated to helping individuals in Liberia, specifically those in Maryland County, Liberia. The organization has created and implemented health care, education, and economic development projects through partnership with Liberia's William V.S. Tubman University. You can read more about this charitable organization at www.marylandersforprogress.org

With community support, Theralution seeks to raise $500.00 in cash donations to assist those currently affected by the Ebola epidemic. All funds will be submitted to Marylander's for Progress, and will be used to purchase health care equipment and provide preventative education and treatment for those currently in need.


A Gift From Us To You

For donations greater than $25.00, Theralution will provide donors with a breathable moisture wicking flagship shirt.  All donations are tax deductible. If Theralution fails to reach its goal, the money raised will still be submitted to Marylanders for Progress.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please understand that if you are unable to give a financial gift, please help by spreading the word about this campaign. Any contribution you make is greatly appreciated, and will have a lasting affect on many lives. Thank You!!

story:
Firstly, thank you for watching our campaign. By giving us 6 minutes of your time today, we hope you’ve realized the potential Atlantis Niagara has for growth and continued excellence in the competitive Icewine/agritourism industry in Niagara.

With your help, Atlantis Niagara can become synonymous with Niagara Tourism. The remarkable experience combined with the finest and most complex Icewines, is an experience ever sought out in Niagara, but never fully realized. Now, you can be a part of it.

As we mentioned in the video, Atlantis Niagara is the accumulation of over 200 years of experience, 7 million dollars of our own capital, and countless hours of hard work.

Through all of this, we have not sacrificed the quality of our wines and the excruciatingly complex means in which we produce them. This unique method of crafting ultra-premium Icewine has been passed down by generations of the Kocsis family.


What we hope to include now, is an experience you will never forget. The demand in Niagara for unique experiences is as high as ever. Approximately 12 million people visit the Niagara region each year.

While thrill seekers of every age flock here in search of their next story, there is a definite shortage of attractions suited to their wants.

Besides, one highly priced helicopter Tour Company and a couple of boat tours, Niagara has few attractions for the adventure seeker.

Until now. Until Atlantis Niagara.

We plan to bring the first, and ONLY hovercraft tour to Niagara.

The Hovercraft can hold 25 passengers (perfect for an office party), can travel smoothly across land and sea (imagine whipping through a vineyard, then out on to Lake Ontario for an exciting 20 minute tour with 360 degree spins), and is fully operational year round! Even through the chilling winters of Niagara that make our Icewine so special.

On top of all of this, we want to offer helicopter and power boat tours. Atlantis Niagara will be your one-stop tourist attraction.

Something important to us at Atlantis Niagara is that these attractions are reasonably priced to you, our valued customer. You wont see any $200 for 20-minute prices here. At Atlantis Niagara, we are geared more towards $50-$75 per person for a 7-minute helicopter ride as well as a 20 minute hovercraft tour.

Powerboat tours in our 50foot turbine powered catamaran that is capable of speeds in excess of 100 miles-per-hour will be offered as a two-hour trip up the Niagara River and back to our winery. Afterwords, enjoy a delicious barbecued lunch and your choice of 3 tastings. This tour will be in the $200 range, but is considered a half day tour…and allows you to become an official member of the Atlantis Niagara 100MPH Club !....a very exclusive club indeed!

This will allow you to experience more of the amenities while still being budget conscious.

A 7-minute helicopter ride still allows plenty of time to explore the escarpment of Niagara, and offer great picture & video opportunities (perfect for couples, photographers, and filmmakers).

Between the exuberant amounts of fun you will be having with our attractions, you will also be able to sip on and enjoy our handcrafted, ultra-premium Icewine.

Ahhh the Icewine, what really makes Atlantis Niagara special.


The amount of commitment and dedication that Atlantis Niagara winemaker/owner John Kocsis takes to craft each bottle can really only be described after you taste one of his Icewines.

Hailed by wine writers as Icewines unlike anything they have ever tasted before, John’s complex Icewines are something every person should try once in their lifetime.

If you don’t believe how unique and special his Icewines are, just ask to taste the small lot Vidal, Riesling blend he has concocted that fermented outside in minus 20 degree (Celsius) weather!

WINESTOCK! 2015

Prepare for the party of your life. 

Atlantis Niagara wants to thank YOU for supporting us by inviting you to a Grand Opening Two Day, Pre-Party, "Winestock! 2015" For $500.00, you and a guest will experience the greatest party Niagara has ever seen!

Fireworks, live music & entertainment, delicious Niagara cuisine, and all the wine you can drink! "Winestock! 2015" is sure to be an unforgettable event.

Bring your wife, girlfriend, or both! We recommend you bring a tent, or feel free to contact us, closer to the date, and we will arrange accommodations for you at a local waterfront hotel.

Dates TBA: Summer 2015. Please drink responsibly, and if you don't we will arrange Designated Driver services back to your hotel.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

How old must I be to contribute to Atlantis Niagara?

19 in Canada & Europe. 21 in the United States. We wish everyone could enjoy Atlantis Niagara Icewine, but we must respect the legal drinking age.

Can I contribute to Atlantis Niagara if I'm not of legal drinking age, but will be by July 2015?

NO. 

Can I contribute to Atlantis Niagara if I'm not of legal drinking age but I'm giving it as a gift to someone who is of legal drinking age?

NO.

When will the Icewine in the perks be available?

July 2015. 

What Icewine's are available in the perks?

The 2013 Vidal Icewine...retail value $50.00 
The 2013 Cabernet Franc Icewine...retail value $80.00

The winter of 2013 was one of the coldest Niagara has seen in one hundred years...and we say thank you. It helped us produce some of our most unique, and complex Icewines yet!

How rare are these Icewines?

Extremely. Atlantis Niagara is a limited production luxury brand winery. Our wine is not just wine, it is art. Every bottle passes through the hands of owner/winemaker John Kocsis, ensuring that you get the best possible expression of Niagara.

How will I get my Icewine?

All orders will be shipped directly to you! Canada, Europe, & the United States.

How old do I have to be to attend "Winestock! 2015"?

19, welcome to Canada. 

Can I purchase Atlantis Niagara Icewine without contributing to it's indiegogo campaign?

Absolutely! Just visit here and you can view our selections! 

CHRISTMAS INDIEGOGO SPECIAL-100 Cases Available

Do you want to experience Atlantis Niagara Icewine for the holiday season? Or are you looking for the perfect gift for that special someone who has everything?

Get the Atlantis Niagara, double-gold award winning, 2010 Cabernet Franc Icewine for 25% off including shipping, now until our campaign is over! Regular retail price per bottle: $225.00, OUR SPECIAL OFFER (including shipping) $165.00 per bottle.

Comments from Rick VanSickle renowned wine writer from Wine In Niagara 

Atlantis Niagara Red Ice Cabernet Franc Icewine 2010 ($225, 92 points) — Intense raspberry, strawberry, stewed and integrated herbs and sweet honey aromas burst from the glass. It’s unctuous, luxurious and super concentrated on the palate with cherry-raspberry compote, a touch of roasted nuttiness and bright acidity that brings a refreshing touch to this lavish icewine. It’s super delicious and lasts on the finish for a minute or more. I don’t know how Kocsis did this on his first try, but a heck of an effort here. Consumers will have to decide whether they want to part with $225 for a half bottle of icewine.


Atlantis Niagara has something for everyone. From the person or couple seeking new and exciting experiences to share together, to the lover and collector of fine wines.

We are committed to being the best. With a jaw-dropping tourist experience and only the finest Icewines, we can offer the best. All we need is your help.

So please donate, share, retweet, anything at all would be greatly appreciated.

Stay tuned each Friday for more updates about Atlantis Niagara!

And contact us here if you have any additional questions, or are interested in purchasing Atlantis Niagara Icewine.

Thank you.
story_txt:
Firstly, thank you for watching our
campaign. By giving us 6 minutes of your time today, we hope you’ve realized
the potential Atlantis Niagara has for growth and continued excellence in the
competitive Icewine/agritourism industry in Niagara.
With your help, Atlantis Niagara can
become synonymous with Niagara Tourism. The remarkable experience combined with
the finest and most complex Icewines, is an experience ever sought out in
Niagara, but never fully realized. Now, you can be a part of it.
As we mentioned in the video, Atlantis
Niagara is the accumulation of over 200 years of experience, 7 million dollars
of our own capital, and countless hours of hard work. 


Through all of this, we have not
  sacrificed the quality of our wines and the excruciatingly complex means in
  which we produce them. This unique method of crafting ultra-premium Icewine
  has been passed down by generations of the Kocsis family.


What we hope to include now, is an
experience you will never forget. The demand in Niagara for unique experiences
is as high as ever. Approximately 12 million people visit the Niagara region
each year.
While thrill seekers of every age flock
here in search of their next story, there is a definite shortage of attractions
suited to their wants.
Besides, one highly priced helicopter Tour
Company and a couple of boat tours, Niagara has few attractions for the
adventure seeker.
Until now. Until Atlantis Niagara.




We plan to bring
  the first, and ONLY hovercraft tour to Niagara. 
The Hovercraft
  can hold 25 passengers (perfect for an office party), can travel smoothly
  across land and sea (imagine whipping through a vineyard, then out on to Lake
  Ontario for an exciting 20 minute tour with 360 degree spins), and is fully
  operational year round! Even through the chilling winters of Niagara that
  make our Icewine so special.

On top of all of this, we want to offer
helicopter and power boat tours. Atlantis Niagara will be your one-stop tourist
attraction. 
Something important to us at Atlantis
Niagara is that these attractions are reasonably priced to you, our valued
customer. You wont see any $200 for 20-minute prices here. At Atlantis Niagara,
we are geared more towards $50-$75 per person for a 7-minute helicopter ride as
well as a 20 minute hovercraft tour.
Powerboat tours in our 50foot turbine
powered catamaran that is capable of speeds in excess of 100 miles-per-hour
will be offered as a two-hour trip up the Niagara River and back to our winery. Afterwords, enjoy a delicious barbecued lunch and your choice of 3 tastings. This tour will be
in the $200 range, but is considered a half day tour…and allows you to
become an official member of the Atlantis Niagara 100MPH Club !....a very
exclusive club indeed!This will allow you to experience more of
the amenities while still being budget conscious.
A 7-minute helicopter ride still allows
plenty of time to explore the escarpment of Niagara, and offer great picture
& video opportunities (perfect for couples, photographers, and filmmakers).

Between the exuberant amounts of fun you
will be having with our attractions, you will also be able to sip on and enjoy
our handcrafted, ultra-premium Icewine.
Ahhh the Icewine, what really makes
Atlantis Niagara special. 





The
  amount of commitment and dedication that Atlantis Niagara winemaker/owner
  John Kocsis takes to craft each bottle can really only be described after you
  taste one of his Icewines.

Hailed by wine writers as Icewines
unlike anything they have ever tasted before, John’s complex Icewines are something every
person should try once in their lifetime.
If you don’t believe how unique and
special his Icewines are, just ask to taste the small lot Vidal, Riesling blend
he has concocted that fermented outside in minus 20 degree (Celsius) weather! 
WINESTOCK! 2015Prepare for the party of your life. Atlantis Niagara wants to thank YOU for supporting us by inviting you to a Grand Opening Two Day, Pre-Party, "Winestock! 2015" For $500.00, you and a guest will experience the greatest party Niagara has ever seen!Fireworks, live music & entertainment, delicious Niagara cuisine, and all the wine you can drink! "Winestock! 2015" is sure to be an unforgettable event.Bring your wife, girlfriend, or both! We recommend you bring a tent, or feel free to contact us, closer to the date, and we will arrange accommodations for you at a local waterfront hotel.Dates TBA: Summer 2015. Please drink responsibly, and if you don't we will arrange Designated Driver services back to your hotel.FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONSHow old must I be to contribute to Atlantis Niagara?19 in Canada & Europe. 21 in the United States. We wish everyone could enjoy Atlantis Niagara Icewine, but we must respect the legal drinking age.Can I contribute to Atlantis Niagara if I'm not of legal drinking age, but will be by July 2015?NO. Can I contribute to Atlantis Niagara if I'm not of legal drinking age but I'm giving it as a gift to someone who is of legal drinking age?NO.When will the Icewine in the perks be available?July 2015. What Icewine's are available in the perks?The 2013 Vidal Icewine...retail value $50.00 The 2013 Cabernet Franc Icewine...retail value $80.00The winter of 2013 was one of the coldest Niagara has seen in one hundred years...and we say thank you. It helped us produce some of our most unique, and complex Icewines yet!How rare are these Icewines?Extremely. Atlantis Niagara is a limited production luxury brand winery. Our wine is not just wine, it is art. Every bottle passes through the hands of owner/winemaker John Kocsis, ensuring that you get the best possible expression of Niagara.How will I get my Icewine?All orders will be shipped directly to you! Canada, Europe, & the United States.How old do I have to be to attend "Winestock! 2015"?19, welcome to Canada. Can I purchase Atlantis Niagara Icewine without contributing to it's indiegogo campaign?Absolutely! Just visit here and you can view our selections! CHRISTMAS INDIEGOGO SPECIAL-100 Cases AvailableDo you want to experience Atlantis Niagara Icewine for the holiday season? Or are you looking for the perfect gift for that special someone who has everything?Get the Atlantis Niagara, double-gold award winning, 2010 Cabernet Franc Icewine for 25% off including shipping, now until our campaign is over! Regular retail price per bottle: $225.00, OUR SPECIAL OFFER (including shipping) $165.00 per bottle.Comments from Rick VanSickle renowned wine writer from Wine In Niagara Atlantis Niagara Red Ice Cabernet Franc Icewine 2010 ($225, 92 points) — Intense raspberry, strawberry, stewed and integrated herbs and sweet honey aromas burst from the glass. It’s unctuous, luxurious and super concentrated on the palate with cherry-raspberry compote, a touch of roasted nuttiness and bright acidity that brings a refreshing touch to this lavish icewine. It’s super delicious and lasts on the finish for a minute or more. I don’t know how Kocsis did this on his first try, but a heck of an effort here. Consumers will have to decide whether they want to part with $225 for a half bottle of icewine.Atlantis Niagara has something for
everyone. From the person or couple seeking new and exciting experiences to
share together, to the lover and collector of fine wines.
We are committed to being the best. With
a jaw-dropping tourist experience and only the finest Icewines, we can offer
the best. All we need is your help.
So please donate, share, retweet, anything
at all would be greatly appreciated. 
Stay tuned each Friday for more updates
about Atlantis Niagara! 
And contact us here if you have any additional
questions, or are interested in purchasing Atlantis Niagara Icewine. Thank you.

story:
2015, what an amazing start to the year, and what promise this year holds for all of us.  None more so than our dearest friend Kathy Lazier, who just so happens to be, for our mutual benefit, the most talented colorist and stylist any of us have ever met!
Every now and then in our lifetimes we to have the opportunity to reach out and help someone in such a positive and meaningful way that it will change their life forever. Those are the moments that make us smile from deep within, the moments that widen our eyes to the beauty of life and the true gift of friends and loved ones.
This is one of those moments.  Our beloved Kathy, after a career of helping us all, is now about to embark on the realization of her life long dream!  Many of us remember similar moments in our own lives, we remember the stomach jitters associated with such a life changing event, and for many of us it was a helping hand that insured we launched successfully.
Today is our opportunity to reach out with our own helping hands and assist Kathy in realizing her vision.  For all those many years that she has been our friend, for all those many times she has cared for our needs, now it's our turn.
What a privilege it is to be a part of building and ultimately achieving a life long dream!  So help if you can, a little or a lot, just help with your heart.
Welcome everyone to Rouge - a Katherine Lazier Salon 
Go Kat Go !!
Want to hear more of Katherine's dream & what is so especially unique about her salon? Click on the link below  to hear her talk about her vision with her dear friend , Max Ryan.
http://www.empoweradio.com/home/shows/on-demand/magic-of-life/809462-The-Anatomy-Dream-with-Katherine-Lazier.html
A few of the attributes that will make Rouge so special is that Katherine is a life long lover of the arts. She is an avid collector of all mediums of art. Part  of her dream is to have her salon be an active art gallery, show casing local artists as well as artists from afar. Katherine has the artists booked & ready to get their art in her salon Upon opening.
Giving back to her community is important  Katherine. She is very involved with Big Brother Big Sisters of Ventura County. Rouge will be used for fund raising events as well as many other community-based programs .   She is an avid "support small & local business " beliver.
So, there will likely be a number of wine, whiskey and other libations tastings from local brewers & wine makers!!! Lol

The funds raised will be used for construction costs & start up funds. Rouge is located in The Collection at Riverpark in Oxnard. The Collection is a brand new high end, multi use shopping, dining & entertainment outdoor space that is attached to Riverpark, a unique housing development.

As this is a brand new building , Katherine has the extraordinary opportunity to build her dream salon from demising walls & concrete floors on out! However, the construction costs are much higher than anticipated & Katherine is reaching out to ask for your support In helping to make this life long dream come to fruition.

Thank you for your support & contribution to Katherine's dream!

story:
Our Hope

Cedar Studios is a burgeoning community center and performance space in Olympia, Washington. Our educational art lab boasts a large hardwood dance floor, extensive outdoor workshop spaces, and a professional audio recording studio, all nestled near the 1000-acre woods of the Evergreen State College. We are excited to steward this beautiful property, and we look forward to offering free and sliding-scale classes, workshops, and performances to the community.

In addition to being a promising space for healing and education, Cedar Studios is also our dream home! We are so close to our goal after years of dealing with Olympia slumlords. With your help, we can end the cycle of rental insanity and step into a place of power in our personal and professional lives. In addition to helping create a resource for our community, your donation secures permanent housing for a disabled person. Thank you for your generous assistance with funding the downpayment for our home and studio center. 


Our Offer

We and our community of colleagues have academic and professional backgrounds in psych, art, and education. We have struggled to share our work and radical pedagogy due to the costs and other challenges involved in sharing or renting studio spaces. We have separately dreamed of stewarding a space where we could do our solo work and collaborations with other teachers and practitioners. It was exciting to learn this about each other in the early stages of our relationship, and this shared dream helped us know we were on an exciting path in our increasingly shared journey. After housing and health struggles, we caught a big break and found our home at Cedar Studios, nestled in the same woods we had once loved and left due to mold and other issues. With only a few thousand dollars to go before we can make our down-payment, we are eager to close the circle and become homeowners and studio managers. We like the idea of supporting worthwhile projects and classes in our community without taking financial advantage of teachers and students. We believe it is absurd that unique learning opportunities are lost due to abuses of power and mismanagement of spaces.
We have taught classes with various institutions and communities throughout the West Coast. Some of the classes we have offered in the past include restorative yoga, odissi dance, guided meditation, music history, music theory, ethnomusicology, sound/art therapy, and math (statistics).  We also have ongoing photography, film, and music projects taking place in our studios and grounds.
Some of the classes we (and our colleagues) will offer beginning May 2015 include restorative yoga, partner yoga, yoga nidra, beginning aerial silks, odissi dance, and meditation courses informed by the latest information from the rapidly changing field of neuroscience.

Our Request

Your gift will go a long way to help us reach our goal. Whether you have $5, $50, $500 to donate, we thank you for including us in your budget.

Here are some ways that you are still crucial to our cause besides (or in addition to) donating cash to our fundraiser:

  • Please share our campaign with friends, family members, or professionals who may be interested in supporting our work.  http://igg.me/at/cedarstudiosfund 
  • Please like our Facebook page feel free to invite others to check out Cedar Studios. That is the best place to hear abour our classes and events.         https://www.facebook.com/cedarstudios
    •  
Thank you for sharing our dream with us!

story:
Short Summary

Take Point Now is our call to action to all our fellow veterans to reclaim their extraordinary lives. We want our epic adventure to compel others to follow their dreams. Gather your family, friends, and neighbors and make a difference in your community!

Our Goals

  • Break Guinness World Records on Personal Watercraft (PWC), including crossing the Atlantic Ocean in record time.
  • Advocate for the development of adaptive gear for injured and disabled veterans to join the community on the water.
  • Inspire veterans, and their loved ones, to take back their extraordinary lives and achieve something great!

 Take Point Now is our call to action to all our fellow veterans to reclaim their extraordinary lives. We want our epic adventure to compel others to follow their dreams. Gather your family, friends, and neighbors and make a difference in your community!
