story:
Our Story

Project Suyana is a completely student-run, non-profit organization at the University of Michigan. We have worked in the region of Puno, Peru since 2007 to promote sustainable humanitarian aid projects. Our most recent project was implementing clean burning stoves in the village of Huanuscuro, and we are happy to say that the need for these stoves is dwindling.

While we loved getting dirty and building these adobe brick stoves, our years working on this project have been successful and are coming to a close. We are looking to continue our close relationship with the people in this village through another project. We want to decide what project to tackle next based on what the people living in Huanuscuro think they need. We strongly believe that the input of the community is essential to make our project sustainable and useful. We want to see what an average day in the community if like through the eyes of the children and we need your help to make this happen. 

Project PHOTOS (Photography in Huanuscuro Outling The Observation of Society) will allow us to take 5 digital cameras and one portable printer to Peru with us on our trip in August. These cameras will be distributed to the children in the school each day with a prompt. As well as being able to see what daily life is like though their eyes, we hope to prompt the children to photograph things they would like changed as well. In this way we are able to address health and community concerns that the people living in the community find most important. 

At the end of each day the portable printer will allow us to let each child pick their favorite picture to take home. This picture is much more than a simple souvenir. Most of the families do not have an opportunity to take or have pictures of their loved ones. These pictures are treasured keepsakes of what they themselves or their family looks like. Project PHOTOS is a great opportunity to continue our committed relationship with this community as well as to receive input on what projects would be most useful.

Thank you for your support! Check out our blog at http://projectsuyana.blogspot.com/

story:
Hi!

 

I am Sam and I live in Austin,TX. First off, I want to thank you for visiting our crowdfunding campaign page.

As many of you know, Austin has an amazing cycling scene and most of the people I have lived with are biking fanatics.

As I describe in our 'lil video above, there is so much happening that it's often hard to keep up and we use our fridge as a means of leaving messages about cycling stuff for one another. This is where the idea for Bikeboard was born. Basically, we thought it would be cool to make our fridge visible to everybody and to even allow other people to post things to our "fridge."

The most practical way to accomplish this is with a website and app, so that is what we are setting out to do. We're trying to raise $10,000 to get the ball rolling and we hope you will help. Of course, give what you can. but also, tell your friends and relatives about what we're up to and encourage them to check out the video. If you have ideas about the project or people you think we should talk to, PLEASE let us know that, too!

We can build something great together, so check out some of our perks over there on the right and make your contribution right….now!

 

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Sam

ps. best way to get in touch is: gobikeboard@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

You may have recently seen news footage about a shooting in Tempe, AZ, involving a young man named Ryan Hall.  Ryan was involved in a tragic, near death experience about three weeks ago, when he was shot through the back by a man attempting to murder him. 

(To veiw a video and article about the shooting, click here: http://www.myfoxphoenix.com/story/22136023/2013/05/01/cell-phone-video-shooting)

Thankfully, this near life-ending situation did not end as badly as it could.  Ryan was treated in the hospital for a little over a week, but is now out and trying to manage all of the challenges associated with this traumatic experience.

This campaign has been put together to help support Ryan through the variety of financial hurdles that are inherent to such an injury.

Ryan is currently a restaurant worker in downtown Phoenix, and the father of an almost two year old son.  He has been working in the restaurant industry for a few years now with the hope of eventually developing a business in audio and video production.

We are asking that you will take the time to consider making a donation to help Ryan through an immensely undeserved and challenging set of circumstances.

It is easy to not realize how fast basic life costs add up, until something outside your control entirely interrupts your means of working—not to mention the variety of other expenses associated with not having health insurance, court fees, and trying to provide for a new infant. 

Please take a moment to consider the following details to understand the impact that your contribution will have on Ryan’s life, and where your money will be going. 

What We Need

ALL money raised will be given directly to Ryan. 

*Any payments you make through this website are directly connected to Ryan’s account

The GOAL is to raise $5,000

(It is possible to exceed this goal, as this goal is only a partial projection of the overall costs.)

  • Time off work, $500/wk (minimum) x 8 wks (doctors projected 8-10 weeks): $4000

          *Ryan’s job does not provide paid time off (PTO)

  • Child support, $300/mt (minimum) x 2 mts: $600
  • Court fees (already incurred): $1500
  • Car repairs (occurring from the bullet): $2000
  • Basics (food/rent for two months): $1400

The minimum donation is $1, but we are asking that you consider making at least a $10 donation.  There is NO LIMIT to the donation that you can offer.  Please consider giving generously.

The Impact

Ryan is in the process of recovering physically, and otherwise, from an experience that few of us could even imagine for ourselves or our loved ones.

By contributing to this campaign you will be helping ease some of the financial burden that Ryan has had to assume, as result of this traumatic event. 

Please take the time to offer your support and encouragement by making a donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support by donating, please consider helping get the word out:

  • Re-post the link to the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter
  • Send your family, friends, or others an email with the link
  • Post the information in your work place
  • Tell your family and friends the next time you see them
  • Mail a note or letter with the campaign information

 **This campaign has been developed by Jeremiah Blue, a friend of Ryan Hall.  Please be aware, Ryan has NOT endorsed any other web-based or indiegogo.com campaign on his behalf.  For questions, comments, or concerns, please use the contact information provided on this site, or by clicking the Facebook link below that will direct you to Ryan's page.

story:
Nous aimerions créer un petit coin de paradis , sur notre  domaine de 50 hectares en pleine nature, dans la forêt.

En arrivant on peut découvrir un lac. En le longeant, on accède à l'entrée de la propriété. C'est là que se dressent, la maison du gardien, l'accueil, ainsi qu'un joli bâtiment construit sur Pilotis, pour prendre en toute quiétude le petit déjeuner, boire un café ou se restaurer.

En s'avançant, dissimulé sous les arbres, on aperçoit  le premier chalet, magnifique avec sa terrasse dominant le lac.

Plus loin, un petit pont de bois enjambe la rivière, d'où nous pouvons apercevoir deux autres gîtes avec leur terrasse, d'où, depuis sa chaise longue ont peut facilement surveiller les enfants qui font du pédalo et du canoë sur le lac.

Un petit chemin à gauche, suit le lit de  la rivière et nous emmène à d'autres maisons de bois posées sur la rive, dans un calme juste troublé par les oiseaux et le clapotis de l'eau.

Enfin , en continuant la ballade,  on découvre d'autres chalets nichés dans les bois , et de jolies cabanes cachées dans les arbres.

Parmi toutes les essences regroupées dans notre domaine, se dresse une érablière. Nous allons l'exploiter, afin de vous faire découvrir la cabane à sucre , et goûter notre sirop.

Le domaine compte une dizaine de chalets et cabanes, tous individuels, invisibles les uns des autres, préservant l'intimité de chacun, mais restant proches.

Nous disposeront également d'un chalet en bois rond, grand confort, avec 3 chambres, grand salon et salle à manger, cuisine américaine, et une cheminée majestueuse. Il sera facile d'y accueillir des groupes de 8/10 personnes.

Chaque chalet et cabane dispose, d'au moins deux grandes chambres avec 2 lits, ainsi que toutes les commodités, salle de bain, toilettes, eau chaude, télévision, accès internet, Climatisation et chauffage.

J'aimerais aussi pouvoir installer un lieu totalement dédié au bien être. Quel bonheur de se glisser dans un sauna ou un Spa, après une bonne journée à l'extérieur, ou se prélasser au son d'une douce musique avec un bon bouquin! 

Voila, mon rêve de "Cabane au Canada".

C'est dans ce cadre, que J'aimerais vous recevoir, pour un séjour inoubliable.  http://www.lacabaneaucanada.fr/

 A l'ouest de l'autre côté du domaine, une belle et grande bâtisse, style grange canadienne qui abritera tout notre système logistique, au rez de chaussée, l'atelier pour l'entretien et la maintenance du domaine, le garage avec nos Motoneiges, VTT, QUAD et 4X4. Et à l'étage des chambres pour loger le personnel

Nous envisageons la création à terme d'au moins 5 emplois à plein temps et certainement d'autres à temps partiel  pour offrir un maximum de confort à nos clients.

Une participation de votre part, d'au moins 30.000$ , pourrait me permettre de finaliser mon projet plus rapidement et dans de bonnes conditions, sans endettement ni pression financière, mon objectif est de pouvoir vous offrir des séjours à un tarif très préférentiel ce qui pourrait permettre à de nombreuses familles de découvrir le Canada.

En contrepartie, pour vous récompenser selon, et même au delà de vos participations,  je vous propose des chèques cadeau à valoir sur les séjours dans nos gîtes. et c'est avec grand plaisir que je vous accueillerais sur mon domaine pour vous faire découvrir cet endroit magnifique et ainsi partager avec vous mon aventure Québécoise.

il est évident que, si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, je ferais appel à un autre mode de financement pour compléter les montants réunis. Par contre si l'objectif est dépassé, je peux aisément vous offrir les séjours que vous désirez.

Pour ceux qui ne peuvent contribuer, cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas aider. Vous pouvez quand même passer le mot et faire de la publicité autour de mon projet sans oublier d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

story:
Who We Are and What We Do:


We're Rob & Kate. We love cars and we love helping people, so much so, we made a business out of it!  We are professional Car Coaches and we've been helping people find cars since 2008. We also help people find their lost money after an accident. Check it out!

Here's the rub, someone crashed into your car. What a hassle! You fix it, but now it's worth less. Great! :(

This loss is what's known as "Accelerated Depreciation" and it sucks.

We prove how much less money your car is worth, after an accident, and help you get it back. That's our business!

We'd like your help. We want to enter the 2013 Vancouver International Auto Show, in March. We've poured our blood, sweat and tears into this cause for five years and we see the Auto Show as the showdown, throwdown - oh yeah, it's gonna go down! We're talking 80,000 people over 5 days!


This S#@t ain't cheap! Here's the Nitty Gritty:

 
To make it happen, we need $25,000.  Just the car show alone is $10,000. Design and production costs are $5,000. Printing costs are $5,000. Waaaaaaaait a second... 10 + 5 + 5 doesn't add up to 25 large. WTF? 

The missing $5k will be used to turn our eBook "How to Buy Your Next Used Car in 5 Easy Steps" into a full-blown membership site. As a member, you will have full access to all the tips, tricks and insider knowledge about buying your next car.  

The site will launch, at the Auto Show, and the proceeds will help us spread the word even further. You can make it happen. Want to see more about what our membership site will have for you? Click here.


The Impact


The difference your contribution will make:

  • More money in your pocket. (Do you like money? We like money!)
  • More people will know about this loophole.
  • One person makes a difference, together we make change.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute, that's okay!  Join our conversation and raise awareness.

  • Make some noise!  Tell your friends.  Share it on your Facebook. Tweet it. Email it to a pal who just had an accident. Join our Forum on our site and ask us your questions.  We will answer!
     
  • Indiegogo has some great share tools, use them and help us get the word out!

 

Learn More About Us

Here's our story about who we are and why we do what we do.

Here is a link to our comprehensive FAQ page.

Here are some of our successes so far:

  • We have been contacting personal injury law firms throughout BC to let them know that this is something you can claim.

  • CBC marketplace last year did an exposes on accelerated depreciatoin/diminished value which we were interview for. It was seen by over 4,000,000 people in Canada.  Click here to watch.

story:
We have a sleek and intimate space, a dynamic team and a concept that will rock Brooklyn and become a fixture for the kosher community and the neighborhood at large. 

With your support, we’ll be up and running by early November! 

Our location; the address is 708 Washington Avenue in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn. We're a mere few blocks from Grand Army Plaza and Prospect Park, a short walk to the Botanical Gardens and the Brooklyn Museum. We're right in the middle of three subways: Brooklyn Museum 2/3, 7th Ave B/Q and Clinton/Washington Ave. C. 

THE TEAM

We're Itta Werdiger Roth, founder and Chef of The Hester, a kosher supper club, and Sasha Chack, former Food & Beverage Director of 92YTribeca, and we have a truly unique, accessible and fun restaurant concept.

At MASON & MUG, guests gather at their own small tables or together around a bar. Street art, large-scale maps and hardcover books provide a lush indoor backdrop. Or bask outside in sunshine and conversation, surrounded by an organic herb garden whose offerings are used daily in our menu.


THE FOOD

Our concept: small plates, inexpensive, quickly and freshly prepared. The constantly-changing menu is our own take on street food from all over the world. International ideas are paired with local, seasonally-sourced produce.

The in-shop General Store will also stock our favorite menu items. House-made jams, pickles and dips, as well as artisan breads and your Sunday bagel fix!

We hope to appeal to everyone, but we’ll especially attract local and organic patrons, and kosher-keepers. Honest preparation, food education and satisfaction are all critical to our success.


THE BAR

We’ll offer a wide selection of craft beers and kosher wines, affordably priced. We will also offer wine cocktails, sparkling mimosas for Sunday brunch, sangria, bellinis and sake-based cocktails for warm summer nights.


Mason & Mug is a unique and needed restaurant concept: The first and only kosher restaurant in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn. Spread the word, spread the excitement! And stay tuned for our opening date! 

To keep in touch, like us on facebook! https://www.facebook.com/MasonMug

story:
Hi, we are Allison and Lonna, the owners of Crimson. 

Our campaign is to raise the money to move our shop from its tiny space in Temescal Alley into a larger space in the alley.  This larger space will allow us to spread out and do the things that we originally wanted to do when we conceptualized the shop, like teach gardening and plant care classes, host community building events, and carry a wider variety of indoor and outdoor plants and gardening supplies.

By contributing to our campaign, you will help us fix up our new space in a beautiful, old historic building that needs some serious love before we can move in.  The old walls need to be re-plastered, the concrete floor needs to be leveled, and the old windows need to be fixed so that they are operable.  We also need to build shelves and a new counter/ work-space, as well as fill the shop with all sorts of beautiful and amazing things to buy.

We have some unique and hand made perks for those who contribute which include airplants, handmade terrariums, planted succulents, fresh flowers or orchids every month for a year, and lastly a free consultation and garden design. 

Your contribution, no matter how small, will help us reach or goal to move into our larger space and continue our commitment to our customers and the community in and around the alley.

Please help us spread the word, Indiegogo has some great share tools to make it easy!

story:
About Smart Money Chicks ™

In 2007 we launched Smart Money Chicks™, A Financial Education Company for Women. We are designed to be different than the traditional financial marketing and educational models. Live educational events are the key to women having success in their financial lives.

We have held events for the last 5 years in the Atlanta Area as well as online and are proud to say that we have laid a foundation for a very bright future. The emotional energy is high at all of our events and it continues to reinforce the message that women want to know more. They want to have fun collaborating and connecting in a safe and energizing atmosphere ALL while learning and talking about MONEY and their Business.

The Smart Money Chicks Summit,

is a unique conference for women that focus on the area of Business and Personal Finance. Women, Entrepreneurs and community leaders from across the Atlanta Area will join together for a powerful 2 days of learning in the area of business and personal finances.

The Reality

American women are the #1 consumer group in the world. They control over 50% of all the country’s wealth--to the tune of $14 trillion. This number is expected to rise to $22 trillion in 2020, yet many women feel they do not have the education needed to manage this money.

While the number of women starting their own business outpaces men, revenue for female owned companies still lags behind. Less than 3% of women owned businesses reach the Million Dollar Mark.

How you can Help?

DONATE!  It is important for us to keep our ticket prices as low as possible without losing quality content and making the SMC Summit worthwhile for everyone.  In order to make this possible, we will need help from the community.  Every dollar contributed will be put right back into the conference!

 

Other Ways to Help...

Do you know someone who can benefit from the SMC Summit? We would love for you to spread the word to friends, families and coworkers...

 

What others have said about past SMC events!

"It was one of the best conferences that I have attended. Knowledgeable speakers with a long list of information. I would have paid more more for the weath of knowledge delivered."

"Very informative. All the speakers gave great advice and insight on how to build a pleasant positive relationship with money."

"It was really fun meeting everyone, the topics were very informative. I just wish it would have lasted longer so we could go to more classes."

”Your seminars exude ethics, sincerity, and honesty, that is one reason I have been so hooked on the people associated with you and your group. I totally trust anyone that is affiliated with Smart Money Chicks."

They want to have fun collaborating and connecting in a safe and energizing atmosphere ALL while learning and talking about MONEY and their Business.
The Smart Money Chicks Summit,
is a unique conference for women that focus on the area of Business and Personal Finance. Women, Entrepreneurs and community leaders from across the Atlanta Area will join together for a powerful 2 days of learning in the area of business and personal finances.
The Reality
American women are the #1 consumer group in the world. They control over 50% of all the country’s wealth--to the tune of $14 trillion. This number is expected to rise to $22 trillion in 2020, yet many women feel they do not have the education needed to manage this money.
While the number of women starting their own business outpaces men, revenue for female owned companies still lags behind. Less than 3% of women owned businesses reach the Million Dollar Mark.
How you can Help?
DONATE!  It is important for us to keep our ticket prices as low as possible without losing quality content and making the SMC Summit worthwhile for everyone.  In order to make this possible, we will need help from the community.  Every dollar contributed will be put right back into the conference!
 
Other Ways to Help...
Do you know someone who can benefit from the SMC Summit? We would love for you to spread the word to friends, families and coworkers...
 
What others have said about past SMC events!
"It was one of the best conferences that I have attended. Knowledgeable speakers with a long list of information. I would have paid more more for the weath of knowledge delivered."
"Very informative. All the speakers gave great advice and insight on how to build a pleasant positive relationship with money."
"It was really fun meeting everyone, the topics were very informative. I just wish it would have lasted longer so we could go to more classes."
”Your seminars exude ethics, sincerity, and honesty, that is one reason I have been so hooked on the people associated with you and your group. I totally trust anyone that is affiliated with Smart Money Chicks."

story:
The Seeds of Our Project

Last year, I said goodbye to an amazing friend, Lee Harris. Lee lived his life to the fullest spectrum. He refused to sacrifice who he was for the world, an artist. Like so many of us fighting cruelty, he struggled to find his place. What he didn't know is that he became a light in the dark for all of us. This is largely done in his memory.

The Roots of Our Project

To begin, my name is Angela Shook. I am working to create an organization, Of Lion and Lamb, that partners with artists to open shelters for struggling young adults. When an artist sells work through Of Lion and Lamb, a percentage of each sale will be donated to the opening and upkeep of a shelter.

Once enough funds are raised to open physical doors, Of Lion and Lamb will offer young adults a place to seek help confidentially, counseling services, a safe place to rest, and continued support. We can't change the past, but together, we can design a better tomorrow.

Your help is crucial. In August, the shop will take its first breath and open at https://www.etsy.com/people/OfLionandLamb. 10% of each sale will be given to Mercy Ministries, a free-of-charge Christian residential program for young woman. Find more info here:http://www.mercyministries.org/. Like Of Lion and Lamb, Mercy aspires to offer a place of refuge for young adults in need, and we like that!

Let's Water This Tree!

This is only the beginning. With your help, our Etsy site will graduate to an independent domain where artists can join and donate a percentage together. Your funds will provide materials and marketing, but more importantly, help mend hearts, and ultimately open homes. Let's put our hands together and create an organization worth investing in.

Of Lion and Lamb.

"Handmade helping mend hearts."

story:
Who we are:

Kingdom Come Clothing Co. is a more-than-profit clothing company with a mission to advance the Kingdom of God and represent Jesus Christ. We've been working on this vision for a little over a year now, ever since God inspired it in March 2013. For those of you who don't know our company model, it's featured in the picture above.

For every shirt purchased from KCCC, three things will happen: 

1. They'll be equipped with a t-shirt featuring a Bible verse to share the gospel.
2. They'll be sponsoring a child in need for one week through World Vision.
3. They'll be giving one dollar to an ongoing church planting fund.

What we're doing:

We're getting ready to sell our first self-printed t-shirt from our own website. This is what we have been working toward for the past year. For our first shirt, we've chosen the three simple words "God is love" from 1 John 4:8. We believe this is the best place for us to start as a company and as individuals: by letting people know that our God is a God of love. The design is simple: 


Why we're raising money:

The reason we're doing this fundraiser is to raise money to buy t-shirts. Specifically, we want to buy at least 200 shirts to have in stock before we put this shirt on our website for sale. 

What's in it for you:

We've got some pretty cool options/rewards for you to help us start selling this shirt. We hope you'll find one that you like and consider supporting us! 

Your friends,

Steven & Sarah

P.S. if you have any questions, please feel free to send us a message!




..............................................................................................................................................

story:
Short Summary

The New Waterfront Festival is a free, collaborative event made possible by City of Seattle entities, non-profit organizations, Waterfront businesses, and the community of Seattle. Intended to increase awareness and to gain consumer support for businesses during Seawall construction throughout the fall and winter of 2014/15, NWF is also a platform for all Seattle businesses to be seen and heard as a united force that can make a difference.

Did we mention it ends in a light show on the Great Wheel set to the live musical performance of Vaudeville Etiquette?

We understand that as an independently owned and operated business, you may not often have the opportunity to be a part of large events like this. By becoming a NWF Sponsor, you can utilize the broad Festival platform to be seen and heard in a large market at an affordable price, simultaneously boosting the local economy of Seattle.

What We Need & What You Get

While City organizations and Partners are pitching in what they have to make the Festival a reality, we need money to pay the performers, print all the signage and festival merchandise, do a proper ad campaign to spread our message, and to cover a few other logistical and legal expenses. In return, you get the broad platform of a City-wide festival that will reach the masses of Seattle and surrounding regions.

  • We need sponsorship dollars to pay performers what they deserve, print all signage for the stages and Waterfront Park, a trash and recycling contract to protect the Puget Sound, audio engineering and lighting, festival merchandise to sell to give to our volunteers, tents and tables to give us shelter from the October rain, and an ad campaign that will properly spread the message of the festival and it's purpose - to gain awareness and continued consumer support during a time of difficult construction obstacles. Other expenses often come up that we aren't aware of straight away!
  • As a NWF sponsor, you are joining the united force of the Seattle community to not only help save Waterfront businesses in jeopardy, but to also take advantage of a collaborative effort where everyone's brand can be recognized on a large scale. Your brand will be broadcast on a highly regarded radio station (NWCZ Radio), printed on festival signage, have placement on our social media outlets and website, and be included in all festival related press releases. Your logo will also be added to our promotional print and web campaigns, which will reach the entirety of Seattle and it's surrounding regions.
  • If we don't reach our goal, the money we receive will go to pay performers what they've been contracted for, as they will have given up other paying gigs to be at the festival. It will also cover the upfront expenses of technical work and promotional material that has already been produced.

The Impact

The impact of your sponsorship will reach much further than just an event. With each sponsor that joins this cause, the message of a community taking care of their own will become apparent. You are contributing to the life of Waterfront businesses that will be open during Seawall construction. In addition to gaining this awareness, you will prove that by working together in a collaborative fashion, it is possible to reach goals that are not possible to reach on your own.

  • We want to continue the spirit of collaboration long after NWF lights have gone down and we've all packed up and gone home. As local businesses work together for a good cause, we will inspire a future of creating mutually beneficial relationships for many future projects and causes. Your brand will be a part of the inspiration for a whole city to start making social changes for a better economic future.

  • All of our partners are taking the risk of putting on this event in the hopes that Waterfront businesses will get the awareness and continued consumer support they need in order to survive construction obstacles. We can't do it without you. We need the support of the entire community in order to make a difference for the livelihoods of many.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges to every endeavor. NWF is no different.

  • Waterfront construction obstacles will be in place on the day of the festival. We will have to work around barricades and fences, limited space, and limited parking and accessibility.
  • By creating helpful signage and alternate transportation options, we will keep everyone safe while they enjoy the festival activities, and keep the Waterfront clear of clogged traffic. 
  • Some people may not want to brave the construction in order to attend the festival. But the businesses that have to brave the construction to stay alive throughout the fall and winter of 2014/15 need people to come down and be a supportive presence in this way. With your help, we can provide the public a reason to be involved and options to do it safely.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't contribute financially, you can still be an important part of this cause by spreading the word within your own networks. Visit our website to share the event on Facebook and Twitter, submit your ideas for economic collaboration in the future, and find out how your presence at the festival will directly influence businesses health.
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
NEW OFFER TO KICK OUR CAMPAIGN ALONG!! CHECK OUT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE FOR MORE INFO!!

 

Hello Indigogo people, my name is Clinton and I am so close
to capturing my lifelong dream of owning my own seaplane business, but I need
your help. I live in a beautiful coastal area in Australia on Queensland’s south east coast and really can’t believe that no one has thought of doing what I want to do sooner!

 I have been an aviation fanatic for as long as I can remember and have been a licensed pilot for the last 10 years. I work hard during the week to support my family and fly as often as I can on weekends but nothing would beat ripping holes in the skies everyday in a Beaver seaplane showcasing what this fantastic place has to offer. Having my own business would release me from the burden of working for the man and justify the huge cost I had to pay in obtaining all my licenses.

Over the last 15+months I have worked with the authorities of the Moreton Bay Marine Park to obtain the necessary approvals to operate the seaplane within the park. I have also sourced an aircraft that is currently being FULLY rebuilt for us to
use. This means that if all goes to plan, my aircraft will be brand new and be
wowwing my customers as soon as I can secure the funding we need to get started. We live on the coast and I, like many people that live in my area use the bay as our
backyard. Just off the coast is Moreton Island home to the world class Tangalooma
Resort that up until now can only be accessed by an hour and a half ferry ride from the Port of Brisbane. Moreton Bay Seaplanes DeHavilland Beaver seaplane will be able leave an airport on the mainland coast and cross Moreton Bay to the island in as little as 10mins!

The area is also home to many other unspoilt islands that we
intend to visit and all have crystal clear tropical waters abundant with reefs for
snorkelling and scores of wildlife such as green sea turtles, whales and
dugong. Other tours will involve day trips to the Tangalooma Resort that offers all
sorts of activities such as sand tobogganing, quad bike tours, parasailing and
glass bottom boat adventures. We will also be offering the young and the young
at heart a flightseeing/jet ski adventure where passengers enjoy some wonderful
views of the nearby Glasshouse Mountains before experiencing the thrill of
taking charge of a Jet Ski within the Pumicestone Passage.

The funds we need will be put towards the purchase of things
like the cost of insurance, our website, headsets for the aircraft, slim life jackets for
passengers, marketing and ferry fuel to fly our new aircraft from where it’s being
rebuilt in Sydney up to Brisbane. In return for your generosity you will
receive a token of our appreciation and if you like, regular updates of goings
on via an email newsletter on how we’re tracking. If you’re unable to
contribute you can still help by spreading the word of my dream to reach as
many people as possible. Thankyou in advance to all the generous people that
help to make my dream possible and I hope to someday take you on one of our tours!

story:
**We've raised our initial £500**

But lets not stop there! We could do so much more with your donation! - Indiegogo will now only take a 4% admin fee from us rather than 9%.  - Read on to find out about what we want to achieve with your generous donation.

Short Summary

Hi there, we are crowd funding on behalf of YES Edinburgh, 

We have ONE advertising Trailer at present, kindly donated for the cause by one of the team in YES Pentlands, It has been making appearances throughout Edinburgh and has become a bit of an internet sensation! 

However, Edinburgh is a big place, with a lot of people to target and we aspire to greater things !

We ideally want a fleet of ad board trailers to be used tactically along the main arterial routes in and out of Edinburgh, parked for a few minutes on overbridges and at local yes campaign events. if we raise enough we may even spread them out with the immediate Edinburgh Area - we've already had an amazing response with ONE trailer roaming through Edinburgh on the odd day a week 


This is being spearheaded by Yes Edinburgh West the sectoral subgroup in Edinburgh 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need as much money as possible to get this off the ground,  the more money we raise the more advert locations we can afford, Edinburgh is a big area, lots of spaces to promote our YES Message 
  • The facts :

  • We are aiming for 12 ft by 8 ft double sided ad trailers and artwork for each costs around £300.00 for both sides
  • We need to buy  second hand advert trailers or hire them for the campaign - they are not cheap. but we are resourceful in getting them.  
  • we need to kit at least one vehicle out with  aTow Bar and spare number plates -  (this costs about £340.00) 


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

Please share this with your friends on twitter, Facebook and by email


Thanks on behalf of YES Edinburgh,

story:
Help us to print the first english issue of bond men's magazine!

We already published seven issues in german language, now we think it's time for the english version.

Curious about the german versions, please click here

 

About bond men's magazine

New Heroes Wanted!

True daredevils, tough veterans, resilient guys, cool fighters, smart gentlemen, snobby underdogs.

bond men’s magazine offers estheticbound and trend conscious men - and their families - of any age, which enjoy the finer things in life and give old values such as respect, honor, openness, willpower, courage, strength and human character new brilliance their own platform in high quality.

Respect, honor, courage and character
 
The educated and successful reader will discover topics such as people, interviews, fashion, automobile, gadgets, technology, countries & cities, journeys, hotels, jewelry, watches, cosmetics, luxury, sport and lifestyle.

bond men’s magazine wants to reach MEN who are willing to take the time to browse through an exceptional magazine, to read and to enjoy it.

bond men’s magazine succeeds in combining the artistic with the commercial, the creative with the pragmatic and practicalities with fantasy, all at the highest level  of quality. No other high-end magazine devotes as much space to lavish visual presentations and editorial material, often with a surprising twist and amazing publications.

True values

bond men’s magazine is the stage on which world-renowned companies, photographers, artists and designer love and prefer to present their work, because they can be sure of a unique presentation and resulting attention, not least because of the magazine's outstanding paper and print quality.

It is about people and the commitment of their work. It is about strong partnership and respect.

It is about giving, not just taking. It is about trust and loyalty.

It is about human being. It’s about us!

 

What the funding is for

  • Translation of the magazine from German to English and publish
  • Costs associated with printing and shipping
  • PR, Marketing and Merchandising

Please spread the word about this project to your family, friends and networks.

Thank you!

story:
The Northfield Depot needs your help to survive!

 On September 7, 1876, the James-Younger Gang rode into Northfield, Minnesota, intent on raiding the First National Bank.  The good people of Northfield, rallied by the cry "Get yer guns, boys, they're robbin' the bank!", gathered with their rifles and pistols to defend the bank and the town.  Defeated and bloody, the gang left Northfield, never again to ride as the James-Younger Gang.
 
Now Northfield is facing another challenge, to save the 1888 Depot, or to let it be demolished.  The Northfield depot is an historically and architecturally significant landmark on the West Side of downtown.  If we don't act NOW, it will be demolished and its history lost forever.  
 
An old and faithful friend, the Northfield depot was the town's primary link to the world outside. Since 1888 it was the hub for moving goods from farm to market; bringing students to Carleton and St. Olaf College from across the nation; and transporting troops to the Spanish-American War and World Wars I and II. Its story is the story of Northfield. Now is our last chance for it to once again play a strong role in the city's economic growth.
 
Once moved and revitalized, the depot will serve the community as a transportation hub. Buses from the Twin Cities will drop off and pick up passengers at the Depot.  There will be a bike rack of bicycles that visitors can use to explore the historic town of Northfield.  The interior of the Depot will be available for historical rail road displays, or as a gallery for local artists.  A sculpture area is planned for display of local artist sculptures.  The Northfield Depot will become a beautiful and vital part of Northfield.
 

You can be part of the team that will:

• Preserve a historic landmark
• Revitalize a key part of our downtown
• Reuse an existing architectural treasure
• Enhance the appearance of the city gateway
• Create a space for exhibition and a sculpture garden
 

We need funds to:

• Prepare the new site (provided by the City)
• Move the depot building
• Restore the interior and exterior for use
 
Funds raised will be added to the $90,000 already raised.  Feel free to check out our website at northfielddepot.org for more detailed information. We are a 501 (c) (3) non-profit so your donation is tax-deductible.  
 
As required by law, the cost of the perk must be deducted from the donation.  The thank you letter will define the deductaible amount of the gift.
 

How to "Ride with the James-Younger Gang":

Every year in September the James-Younger Gang once again attempts to rob the Northfield First National Bank.  The "Gang" of re-enactors put on their dusters, strap on their gunbelts, saddle up and ride into Northfield.  You can ride along side of Jesse James and Cole Younger as they make their way into town to raid the bank. For a contribution of $5,000, you can have this a once-in-a-lifetime experience!  Jesse James will meet you at your hotel, provide you with a well-trained horse, a duster, gunbelt and pistol, and introduce you to the adventure of becoming a member of the outlaw gang.  You will also receive a professionally filmed CD of your ride, and become a life-long honorary member of the gang.

However, if you are more the law and order type, for a donation of $2,500 you can take part in the defense of the bank and town by joining the townfolk re-enactors.  Jesse James will meet you at your hotel, provide you with a costume, a rifle or pistol, and  place you in a location where you can help destroy the band of desperadoes.  You will also receive a professionally filmed CD of your defense of the bank.  

UPDATE: Another opportunity to re-enact is during the St. Olaf and Carleton special Reunion Re-enactments June 1 or June 20 of 2013. The rest of the perk remains the same.

You will be contacted immediately to pick your date.

There are many other perks listed to the right of the screen.  If you aren't ready to become a bankrobber or a town defender, perhaps one of the other options would be more to your liking.

Please share this project with your friends 

Send it to your twitter followers, put it on your facebook page, or send out e-mails to let your friends know about this project and the opportunities for adventure. We know there are many others that believe in the same values we do, of historic preservation, of beautification and revitalization. 
 

 Who We Are:

Lynn Vincent, Co-Chair --  Fund Development Committee; Retired CEO of The Girl Scouts of Cannon Valley Council, past CEO of two other Girl Scout councils; owner of Vincent & McBride, Inc. 

Rob Martin, Co-Chair -- Fund Development Committee; Owner of Rob Martin Insurance Agency, the Farmers Insurance Group; active member of the Northfield Rotary Club 

Clark Webster, Treasurer -- Project and Application Engineer, Printed Circuit Industry; member of Gopher State Railroad Museum; past member Minnesota Transportation Museum; active in railroad preservation.

Pat Allen, Events Committee --  Owner of Learning Innovations, Inc., served on Northfield Planning Commission; city planner; former school board member; high school and university teacher.

Steve Edwins, Design Committee --  Architect, owner of SMSQ Architects; adjunct Assistant Professor of Art and Art History; founding member of the City of Northfield Heritage Preservation Commission; member of the Northfield Downtown Development Corporation

Alice Thomas, Communications Committee --  Administrator in higher education; current member of the Northfield Planning Commission; Northfield Round Table; and Northfield Historical Society Board

Chip DeMann, Advisor on Building Move --  President of the Rice County Historical Society; farmer and businessman; experienced in remodeling and moving of large buildings; leader of the Jesse James re-enactment gang

Baird Jarman, Advisor on Renovation --  Associate Professor of Art History with specialization in nineteenth-century American visual culture; serves as an architectural historian on the State Review Board of the Minnesota Historical Society
story_txt:
The Northfield Depot needs your help to survive!
 On September 7, 1876, the James-Younger Gang rode into Northfield, Minnesota, intent on raiding the First National Bank.  The good people of Northfield, rallied by the cry "Get yer guns, boys, they're robbin' the bank!", gathered with their rifles and pistols to defend the bank and the town.  Defeated and bloody, the gang left Northfield, never again to ride as the James-Younger Gang.
 
Now Northfield is facing another challenge, to save the 1888 Depot, or to let it be demolished.  The Northfield depot is an historically and architecturally significant landmark on the West Side of downtown.  If we don't act NOW, it will be demolished and its history lost forever.  
 
An old and faithful friend, the Northfield depot was the town's primary link to the world outside. Since 1888 it was the hub for moving goods from farm to market; bringing students to Carleton and St. Olaf College from across the nation; and transporting troops to the Spanish-American War and World Wars I and II. Its story is the story of Northfield. Now is our last chance for it to once again play a strong role in the city's economic growth.
 
Once moved and revitalized, the depot will serve the community as a transportation hub. Buses from the Twin Cities will drop off and pick up passengers at the Depot.  There will be a bike rack of bicycles that visitors can use to explore the historic town of Northfield.  The interior of the Depot will be available for historical rail road displays, or as a gallery for local artists.  A sculpture area is planned for display of local artist sculptures.  The Northfield Depot will become a beautiful and vital part of Northfield.

story:
Hi! My name is Jan, though the community at large might know me as Kurohane Shizumi.

I'm about to be 24 years old and I work full time since I graduated from college in 2012.

I'm trying to raise money for my house's taxes. I guess I should start by saying that I have lived in my house since I was born—so my whole life. It was originally my grandmother's but when I was 8, she passed away from lung cancer. I lived from then on with my dad and his brother, my uncle, along with my brother. And then, in November of 2012, right before I graduated, my dad died suddenly; ultimately of a heart attack. And not 8 months later, my uncle died of lung and liver cancer within two weeks of being diagnosed with it.

I'm crowdfunding because unbeknownst to my brother and I, my uncle, who had been saying he was paying the taxes, actually hadn't been for the last two years. And with the sudden death of both of the adults I had come to rely on, I didn't think I would need to save money for this year's taxes so... I found myself with quite a lump sum to pay and no way to pay it.

My grand total of need is about $7700, and needs to be payed by May 30th.

Combined with the money my relatives were able to provide, we still need $3700. I'm asking for $4000 flat because of the PayPal fees going to be taken out (we'll be left with $3720).

Please help us secure our family!!!

PS:

I'm not 100% sure what to do for perks, but if you have any specific requests, please comment/leave a message!!!

story:
Short Summary

We hoped you liked our video we had some fun making it, some of the cuts you see in the video are a small portion of the amazing young talent we have had the opportunity to work with whilst at university, with this soon coming to an end we are looking to take a major step into the industry.


Who are we and what do we plan to do and why?

We are Fiermente Productions a group of 3 students that all met at university and discovered we had a similar passion and desire for recording and producing great music. We all came from different backgrounds with different skills that after working together we found those skills to be very complimentary. What we would like to do with Fiermente is to create an affordable and high quality production studio, as we have seen so many young talented people over the past 3 years ranging from buskers on the streets of London to other students at the university. This has been going quite well over the past 6 months or so, as we have had the facilities available to us to get the people into the studio to create some amazing sounding music as I am sure you will agree. Check it out on the website under portfolio www.fiermente.co.uk

But this is all due to come to an end as we are about to leave university when we have looked around for a studio we could hire out to take artists into we have found that they are either very expensive or not good enough quality. I hear you say ‘but some people just do it from there house’ but as much as this is true, we want to take this to the next level, having already put about £4,000 in to the equipment, website, marketing and a few other things. We believe we can really make a difference in the British music scene we have the passion, we have the dedication and we have the talent you can judge that for yourself on www.fiermente.co.uk.

WE JUST NEED YOUR SUPPORT 

What we need and why in detail?

We are looking for £15,000 in total this will be split to the following things

£4200 towards a space, this will be dry hire of a recording space in London, this will give us the deposit and 6 months rent, which will give us a good start in getting set up to maximize the quality and efficiency of the studio.

£4000 towards microphones, as much as we already have a small collection of microphones, every microphone is build for a specific purpose and we do need to expand our range to be able to record every instrument to maintain consistence in the quality of our recording.

£1000 will go towards acoustic treatment, a room with bad acoustics can ruin a good recording, it can make recordings sound unclear or unnatural, so each live room would have to be treated to achieve a clean and clear sound.

£800 Towards furniture, simply put, we would need sofas, chairs, table and everything to make our clients as comfortable as possible to keep them working hard and inspired.

£1000 towards monitoring speakers, we have purchased monitoring speakers already but speakers depend strongly on the size of the room and distance from the listening position, so an alternative pair are needed to monitor the recordings correctly.

£1500 for Marketing/PR as clients are hard to come by, we will need to constantly be marketing ourselves to our target market to keep work up.

£2000 for some additional software to make our rig completely  professional.

£500 additional equipment e.g cables, stands, ect.....

What You Can Get?

Here are the gifts that are on offer to you

Recording and mixing of a full album (12 Maximum)

Recording and mixing of a LP (7 Track Maximum)

Recording and mixing of a EP (4 Track Maximum)

Recording and Mixing of a Single

Professionally mix your previously recorded tracks (3 Maximum)

A physical copy of our first three releases.

A limited edition t-shirt (designed especially for this campaign)

A hand written thank you message

A physical copy of our first release

A personalized email from us

A free download of the EP soundtrack from our video

A Thank you email from us

A free download of the full version of the track in our video

Your Impact on This

So now you know what we plan to achive bringing affordability to music production without skimping on quality. We can say this would not be achieveable without your help. You would be allowing us to make our dreams come true, but also enabling us to produce the soundtrack to your future.

Some Final Words

If you cannot afford to donate, don’t worry you can still help please spread word about this share on Facebook, twitter and with anyone you know that might help. As much as donations of money will help us we also need skilled people that may be able to donate a bit of time to the cause we are looking for people specializing in Photography, Web Design and Marketing.

You can check out the web site at www.fiermente.co.uk or contact us on info@fiermente.co.uk  

We are also on social media 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/FiermenteProductions?ref=hl

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/fiermenteproductions

Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/fiermente


If you are an artist or a band looking to record (or if you know any) then just get in touch, we can discuss special rewards / studio time

story:
Do/Luck?

Do/Luck is a design group found in the fall of 2013 by three graphic design students who attend Virginia Commonwealth University. Having pride and love towards their motherland, the Republic of Korea, Do/Luck specializes in research and design involving Hangul. 


EXHIBITION MOTIVES

Do/Luck found themselves learning the importance and value of their first language going through many communicative obstacles in English. The passion and interest in Hangul came through longing to explore Korean Typography more in depth than the Roman alphabetical typography. This interest motivated the group to hold an exhibition spreading the word of Hangul’s great aesthetics and structural design. The first obstacle Do/Luck came to is that not everyone knew upon encountered ‘Hangul.’ In Korea, where Hangul is the first language, it is easier to attract more attention in its design aspects. However, exhibiting how Hangul is beautiful and physiologically driven to a person who does not know anything about Hangul will only become an exhibition for our own goods rather than asking for agreement or interest from the American audience. In order for Do/Luck’s exhibition

to be effective it is essential that visitors know how to read Korean. This motivated the group to teach the American audience how to read Hangul in a fun and easy way by hosting a Hangul Market. 


WHY SO IMPORTANT?

Numerous linguists have praised hangul for its featural design, describing it as “remarkable”, “the most perfect phonetic system devised”, and “brilliant, so deliberately does it fit the language like a glove.” The principal reason Hangul has attracted

this praise is that the shapes of the letters are related to the features of the sounds they represent: the letters for consonants pronounced in the same place in the mouth are built on the same underlying shape.

In addition, vowels are made from vertical
or horizontal lines so that they are easily distinguishable from consonants. Hangul has a written record explaining the principles that went into its invention. Hangul is so easy and systematic that anyone can learn how to read it in just a few hours,

if you already know how to speak some Korean. If you are new to the Korean language, it might take a little longer. However, learning to read is so easy in Hangul. 


EXHIBITION CONCEPT

In the United States, farmers’ market exist for people to sell local produce and goods to add on to the local community and culture. We want to use the idea of farmer’s market as our base to give the American audience a friendlier approach to learn about the excel- lence of Hangul and its educational facts. 


EXHIBITION PURPOSE

The Hangul Market Exhibition’s goal does
not aim to teach the American audience
to learn perfectly how to read and write in hangul. The bigger picture for the group is to teach how hangul is different physiologically created based on human biological features and teach the systems of the structural aspect of Hangul. Do/Luck hopes to teach American audiences how to distinguish hangul from other alphabet. Currently Korean culture receiving more attention, Do/Luck wants to use this opportunity to teach about Korea and hangul and its excellence educational perspective. The group would also like to provide fun visual experiences for those interested in learning hangul. Learning a second language is a way to build influential power towards any nation that will also build and strengthen its cultural identity. A particular living in a foreign country is an opportunity for the group members to show pride in mother country. 


To conclude this, Do Luck appreciates the attention and the time to review the proposal. The interest and passion towards Hangul had brought the group to come up with different ideas and execution to share the interest and knowledge with a bigger crowd. As students and designers just entering to the real professions we are still educating ourselves as well but strive to learn with our audience. We would appreciate your objective and professional input and feedback to our proposal as well as support.

Thank you.

story:
The goal of the Global Food Database in the first year is to capture the spirit of American food.  We do not tout any preference to fine dining, New American Cuisine or the alternative farmer. Nor are we supporters of agribusiness, fast food or GMOs. We seek to tell the story of our food, good or bad, as a preference wrapped in our personal history, community and national policies, and as we stand on a precipice of deciding as a nation and world what shape our food consumption and production will be taking. We need to collect these stories to give voices to our most fundamental need.


We will travel the country by bike, seeing the land, and discovering and rediscovering our country’s food sources. We will talk to the people, visit farmers, chefs, food businesses and religious leaders to divine an understanding of where we come from and the impact our eating has as a nation. The collected stories will paint a portrait of our national dinner table and give us insight of how it will be set in the future.


After the first year we will be selecting a new country, giving it a year of study. Moving on from there to the next country, and the next one. A country each year till we have crossed the globe seeing not just food from the stories of its nationals, but till we start to see the complex web of international food from its history, its migration and the development of a globalized food system.


Along the way we will be collecting personal food histories, collecting recipes, cataloging local foods and creating short documentaries on food producers. The material collected will also feed the final goal of the project. In years to come we hope to create a true database of food. This database will be a comprehensive collection of all ingredients on earth, taking advantage of the proliferation of the cell phone and internet technology to create an app-based collection system that can be distributed to collectors globally.  Once in place, the impact of this project will be vast, from the discovery of new ingredients to the rediscoveries of ingredients in your backyard; the ability to foster local food systems; or the creation of poverty relief programs.


We are looking for a modest investment into the project. Most of what we are asking for will go to equipment cost: the video and audio recorders, the bicycle and the gear that will carry us across the country, and the camping gear that we will live in year by year. It is our willingness to live and travel by such modest means that makes such an endeavour not only so affordable, but keeps us closer to the land and people that we will be covering.  Because half of our expenses are under equipment cost, a contribution now will fund not only this year but every subsequent year.


After equipment cost the remaining funding covers travel expenses, food and emergencies. We will be able to fund the daily needs of the program for eight thousand a year by the incorporation of lessons learned from the material gathered, knowledge of local and wild foods across the country, sourcing food from the people we are interviewing and providing an example to the ability of a low cost approach to providing a full and complete diet.


We will also be needing your help in other ways.  As the project moves across the country we need your help in finding our stories. Let us know about the food stories that you find exciting from around the country, tell us about your favorite farmer or chef. We also want your story, the audio heard in the video above is a montage of some of the personal food histories that we have already collected. In every town we will set up a session to record personal food histories. When come to your townwe will announce where will be setting up and want you come down and give us your stories. You will be able to suggest stories or find out where we will be next on Facebook or our upcoming blog.
story_txt: The goal of the Global Food Database in the first year is to capture the spirit of American food.  We do not tout any preference to fine dining, New American Cuisine or the alternative farmer. Nor are we supporters of agribusiness, fast food or GMOs. We seek to tell the story of our food, good or bad, as a preference wrapped in our personal history, community and national policies, and as we stand on a precipice of deciding as a nation and world what shape our food consumption and production will be taking. We need to collect these stories to give voices to our most fundamental need.We will travel the country by bike, seeing the land, and discovering and rediscovering our country’s food sources. story:
Bills, Bills, Bills

(Thank you to everyone who has opened their hearts to us. I am not the type who asks for help, but with three children involved, and no wish to let them down or render them homeless, I went for the desperate measure. I appreciate your generosity more than you will ever know.)

If a guy on Kickstarter can get funded $11,000 to make a potato salad, I might as well try to help my family keep our house.

Hey, my name is Van. I live in one big house with my mom, dad (sometimes), autistic older brothers, mostly unemployed uncle, and a freelance contractor, in addition to 4 rescue dogs, and more than a dozen adopted stray cats.

Through a series of unfortunate events, including the house fire pictured above, the only full time job under this roof is my father, who teaches at a middle school (which is on summer break right now), and my, my uncle, and our contractor are all part time. Between mortgage on the house, car payments, insurance, my brothers' student debts, food, etc., we have a million things that need to be paid and no money to pay it with. My mother was extremely ill, she was our main income, and she's trying to go back to work, but er new employer won't let he work with all of our outstanding debt. So, with no where else to turn, we figured it's worth a shot to depend on the kindness of the internet.

Why $10,000?

The $10,000 goal is currently a baseline. I figure if we can get that much, just to get going, it will be enough to cover my brother's student debts (and their only debt right now is housing payments, because they have full scholarships to cover classes and books because they're super smart), hold over the mortgage company, and last us on other expenses until my dad goes back to work in August. The deadline is set as my birthday just so I don't forget it. Honestly, the goal is just a base line. Anything you can give will help!!!

    Gifts, rewards, perks, etc.

    I'm afraid that right now, I can't give any rewards or perks. If giving something for nothing doesn't work for you, I'm trying to set up an ebay or other page where you can buy some of the old or classic games that have accumulated in my house (including games for systems as far back as Nintendo 64, SNES, and PlayStation 1) and all proceeds will go to keeping my family afloat. I'm also getting things set up so maybe I can do sewing or craft commissions. Basically, keep an eye on this space! Rewards will pop up!

    Thank you for reading, thank you for caring (even if you can't give), have an excellent day.

story:
She Who Must Consult

I was hatched from a dragon's egg three decades ago and kidnapped by... ok, no, not really. I'm originally from NJ but I currently reside in Western Massachusetts with my husband and our dog. I've been working in Internet retail since 2004 and my expertise is in search engine optimization and usability. I also have a Cafepress shop for my graphic design work and an Etsy shop for my polymer clay sculptures. Most importantly I have a marketing consultation company called Strange Child Productions. I provide business support and website development for people with limited spare time, limited resources, and whose projects might not always make sense to a traditional business consultant.

The whole world can be your marketplace and your fan base doesn't have to be restricted to your home town. I want to show people that brick and mortar stores and galleries aren't the only way to reach people anymore. I've been helping artists and crafters sell their work online for a few years now and I really love it. I get to meet new people and help them figure out what they need to do to get more exposure. I feel like there are lots of marketing consultants out there looking to work for large companies, but I want to focus on the needs of individuals, startups and small companies.

What I Need

I've set myself a $1000 goal because this will help cover some paid advertising and some of the equipment I don't already have. I'm launching a series of "in home" workshops and to do this I'm going to need an overhead projector and screen, and eventually a new laptop. I am also hoping to put together print marketing materials for clients who like to have documents they can hold in their hands.

Any extra funds will go towards a series of free workshops in locations that are easily accessible from public transportation.

What You Get

STUFF! Awesome stuff. Useful Stuff. Educational Stuff. Or maybe even helpful stuff.

No seriously. I've got a variety of perks for different budgets and interests. I'm offering bumper stickers, sculpture and coupons for consultation and training.

Spread the word!

If you can't contribute monetarily, share my campaign with your friends. Every little bit helps.
